Quiz Attempt #119716

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table shows the revenue (in ₹ lakh) obtained by a publishing house while selling three types of publications, namely, books, magazines and journals during the four years from 2020 to 2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:Which year shows the highest change in revenue obtained from journals over the previous year?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.2020
  • B.2021
  • C.2022
  • D.2023
Correct Answer: 2022

Change in revenue

In 2021 = 2 lakh

2022 = 7 lakh

2023 = 0

Thus, 2022 shows highest change in revenue.

Question 2
The following table shows the revenue (in ₹ lakh) obtained by a publishing house while selling three types of publications, namely, books, magazines and journals during the four years from 2020 to 2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:In 2023, approximately what percent of the total revenue came from books?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.46%
  • B.55%
  • C.35%
  • D.25%
Correct Answer: 46%

Required percentage = 7940+54+79 × 100 ≈ 46%

Question 3
The following table shows the revenue (in ₹ lakh) obtained by a publishing house while selling three types of publications, namely, books, magazines and journals during the four years from 2020 to 2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:There was an increase in revenue from at least two types of publications in comparison to previous year for exactly ________ year(s)(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.1
  • B.2
  • C.3
  • D.0
Correct Answer: 2

In 2021 there is increase in all the three publications.

In 2022, there is an increase in Magazines and Books.

Thus, the answer is 2 years

Question 4
The following table shows the revenue (in ₹ lakh) obtained by a publishing house while selling three types of publications, namely, books, magazines and journals during the four years from 2020 to 2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:If the year 2024 were to show the same percent revenue growth over the year 2023 as the year 2023 over the year 2022, then the revenue in the year 2024 will be approximately(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.₹ 194.063 Lakh
  • B.₹ 187.075 Lakh
  • C.₹ 172.083 Lakh
  • D.₹ 177.095 Lakh
Correct Answer: ₹ 177.095 Lakh

% increase in 2023 = 173-169169×100 ≈ 2.37%

Revenue in 2024 = 173 × 1.0237 ≈ 177.095 Lakh

Question 5
The following table shows the revenue (in ₹ lakh) obtained by a publishing house while selling three types of publications, namely, books, magazines and journals during the four years from 2020 to 2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:The growth in total revenue in 2023 in comparison to the year 2020 is approximately(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.21%
  • B.28%
  • C.15%
  • D.11%
Correct Answer: 15%

Required percentage = 173-150150×100 ≈ 15%

Question 6
The contents of Swayamprabha Channel - 25 with the theme of “Humanities and social sciences” are provided by:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.IIT Kanpur
  • B.IIT Madras
  • C.IIT Tirupati
  • D.IIT Bombay
Correct Answer: IIT Kanpur

The contents of Swayamprabha Channel - 25 with the theme of “Humanities and social sciences” are provided by IIT Kanpur.

Question 7
In the period of subject English, in a class, Ram is able to recall the author of the book ‘The diary of a young girl’. This type of memory is called _______(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Procedural
  • B.Semantic
  • C.Episodic
  • D.Constructive
Correct Answer: Semantic

When Ram recalls the author of the book “The Diary of a Young Girl” (Anne Frank) during his English class, he is using semantic memory.

 

Semantic memory refers to the long-term memory system that stores general world knowledge, facts, concepts, and meanings — independent of personal experience.

 

For example, knowing that Anne Frank wrote The Diary of a Young Girl, or that Paris is the capital of France, are all part of semantic memory.

 

Other Options:

(A) Procedural memory – Related to how we perform tasks and actions (e.g., riding a bicycle, typing).

 

(C) Episodic memory – Memory of personal experiences and specific events, including time and place.

 

(D) Constructive memory – A concept where the brain reconstructs memories, sometimes filling gaps with plausible information; not applicable in straightforward factual recall.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 8
A language teacher wants to create visually appealing presentations / lessons with embedded videos and interactive slides to enhance online lessons.Which of the following tools are most suitable for this purpose?A. CanvaB. QuizletC. Book CreatorD. FlipgridE. Adobe IllustratorChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.B, C and D Only
  • B.A, C and E Only
  • C.B, D and E Only
  • D.A and C Only
Correct Answer: A and C Only

Let’s evaluate each tool:

A. Canva

  • Excellent for creating visually rich presentations
  • Supports video embedding, animations, and templates
  • Widely used by teachers for lesson design and slides

 

B. Quizlet

  • Best for creating flashcards and quizzes, not presentations or slides
  • Limited multimedia embedding and design flexibility

 

C. Book Creator

  • Allows creation of interactive digital books
  • Supports text, images, videos, and audio
  • Ideal for online lessons with multimedia

 

D. Flipgrid (now part of Microsoft Flip)

  • Focuses on video discussions, not slide presentations
  • Great for student engagement, but not for lesson creation

 

E. Adobe Illustrator

  • Professional tool for graphic design, not optimized for creating teaching presentations or interactive lessons
  • Steep learning curve and not suitable for embedding videos or creating slides easily

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 9
What is a key principle in designing authentic assessment?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Standardizing assessment tasks to ensure fairness
  • B.Focusing on assessing only basic knowledge
  • C.Integrating real-world contexts and tasks into assessments
  • D.Using only traditional assessment methods like tests and quizzes
Correct Answer: Integrating real-world contexts and tasks into assessments

Authentic assessment is designed to evaluate students' abilities in real-world contexts by engaging them in tasks that demonstrate meaningful application of knowledge and skills.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 10
Which of the following are the three meta-cognitive skills used to regulate thinking and learning?A. PlanningB. PresentingC. MonitoringD. EvaluatingE. SequencingChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, C and E Only
  • B.A, C and D Only
  • C.B, C and E Only
  • D.B, D and E Only
Correct Answer: A, C and D Only

Meta-cognitive skills are higher-order thinking skills that help individuals regulate their learning and thinking processes. The three key meta-cognitive skills are:

 

A. Planning

 

Setting goals, selecting strategies, and allocating resources before a task begins.

 

C. Monitoring

 

Being aware of and tracking one’s understanding and performance during the task.

 

D. Evaluating

 

Reflecting on and assessing the outcome after completing the task to improve future learning.

Question 11
The principal orientation to the role of theory in relation to research is deductive in which of the following research strategies?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Quantitative
  • B.Qualitative
  • C.Inductive
  • D.Constructive
Correct Answer: Quantitative

In research, the deductive approach starts with a theory or hypothesis and then tests it through data collection and analysis. This approach is typically associated with quantitative research, where researchers begin with a theory or hypothesis and design experiments or surveys to test this theory.

(A) Quantitative: In quantitative research, the approach is often deductive, where the researcher starts with a theory or hypothesis and tests it using statistical methods.

(B) Qualitative: Qualitative research is generally inductive, where researchers explore phenomena and develop theories based on observations and data rather than starting with a hypothesis.

(C) Inductive: The inductive approach works the opposite way from deductive; it involves deriving general principles from specific observations. This is more common in qualitative research.

(D) Constructive: This term is not typically used to describe a research strategy in terms of the deductive or inductive approach.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is (A) Quantitative, as it commonly follows a deductive approach.

Question 12
Which of the following types of validity is mainly concerned with the issue of causality?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Measurement Validity
  • B.External Validity
  • C.Internal Validity
  • D.Ecological Validity
Correct Answer: Internal Validity

The type of validity that is primarily concerned with causality is (C) Internal Validity.

(A) Measurement Validity: This is concerned with whether a test or measurement tool accurately measures what it is intended to measure, not directly related to causality.

(B) External Validity: This refers to the extent to which the results of a study can be generalized to other settings, people, times, or situations. While important for generalization, it is not directly related to establishing causality.

(C) Internal Validity: This is the correct answer. Internal validity refers to the extent to which a study can accurately establish causal relationships between variables. A study with high internal validity means that the observed effect is likely due to the manipulation of the independent variable, and not due to extraneous or confounding variables.

(D) Ecological Validity: This refers to the extent to which the findings of a study can be generalized to real-world settings. While important for realism, it does not directly relate to causality.

Therefore, the correct answer is (C) Internal Validity, as it is directly concerned with determining causal relationships.

Question 13
In the APA style of writing journal article references, identify the correct order of the following information about the research article:A. Title of the articleB. Last name of the authorC. Page numbersD. Name of journalChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.A, B, D, C
  • C.B, A, D, C
  • D.B, D, A, C
Correct Answer: B, A, D, C

In APA style for referencing a journal article, the correct order of the information is:

B. Last name of the author (Author's surname followed by their initials)

A. Title of the article (The title of the article should be in sentence case, not italicized)

D. Name of journal (The journal name should be in italics and title case)

C. Page numbers (The page range of the article in the journal)

 

Thus, the correct order is (C) B, A, D, C.

 

Example:
Smith, J. (2020). The role of psychology in education. Journal of Educational Psychology, 45(2), 123-134.

Question 14
In the context of medical research, a comparison group that receives what appears to be a treatment, but which actually has no effect, is called the(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.experimental group
  • B.control group
  • C.placebo group
  • D.independent group
Correct Answer: placebo group

In medical research, a placebo group is used to help test the effectiveness of a treatment. This group receives a placebo, which is a substance or treatment that appears to be a real treatment but has no therapeutic effect. The purpose of the placebo group is to compare the effects of the actual treatment with the effects of a non-active substance, allowing researchers to determine if the treatment is effective or if the observed effects are simply due to psychological factors (the placebo effect).

(A) Experimental group: This is the group that receives the actual treatment being tested.

(B) Control group: This group serves as a baseline for comparison but may receive a placebo or no treatment at all.

(C) Placebo group: This is the correct answer. The placebo group receives a non-active treatment to test the effectiveness of the real treatment.

(D) Independent group: This term does not specifically refer to a group in the context of medical research.

 

Thus, the correct answer is (C) Placebo group.

Question 15
The numerator and denominator degrees of freedom are used in the computation of which of the following test statistics?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Z
  • B.Chi-Square
  • C.t
  • D.F
Correct Answer: F

The numerator and denominator degrees of freedom are used in the computation of the F-test.

(A) Z: The Z-test does not use degrees of freedom for its computation. It is based on the standard normal distribution.

(B) Chi-Square: The Chi-Square test uses degrees of freedom, but it only has a single degrees of freedom parameter, not both numerator and denominator.

(C) t: The t-test uses degrees of freedom, but only in the context of the sample size (numerator), not both numerator and denominator.

(D) F: The F-test is used in the analysis of variance (ANOVA) and other statistical models, where both numerator and denominator degrees of freedom are involved in the calculation of the F-statistic.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is (D) F.

Question 16
Interpretation of a media text, which is in variance with the original creator's intention is described as(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Impersonal decoding
  • B.Aberrant decoding
  • C.Above-the-line decoding
  • D.Unequal decoding
Correct Answer: Aberrant decoding

Aberrant decoding refers to a situation where the audience interprets a media message in a way that differs significantly from the intended meaning of the creator or sender.

 

It is common in mass communication where individual experiences, cultural backgrounds, and personal biases affect interpretation.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 17
Mass Communication as a discipline has drawn ideas from(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Physics
  • B.Chemistry
  • C.Philosophy
  • D.Material Science
Correct Answer: Philosophy

Mass Communication as a discipline has its intellectual roots in the social sciences and humanities, particularly Philosophy, Sociology, Psychology, Political Science, and Linguistics.

 

Philosophy contributes to understanding concepts like ethics, truth, meaning, representation, and rhetoric — all crucial for analyzing media content and communication processes.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 18
The characteristics of cool media are:A. High participationB. Low definitionC. High definitionD. Small amount of informationE. High amount of informationChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, C Only
  • B.B, C, D Only
  • C.C, D, E Only
  • D.A, B, D Only
Correct Answer: A, B, D Only

The late Canadian media theorist Marshall McLuhan classified media according to whether they were “hot” or “cool.” He argued this in a famous aphorism: “The medium is the message.” That is, the medium is more important than the textual content that the medium carries.

 

According to McLuhan, hot media have high definition, by which he means that they are full of data, which leads to low audience participation. Cool media, on the other hand, have low definition, because they have little data, and high audience participation.

 

Hot media, such as film and radio, provide a lot of information and require less audience participation, leading to a passive consumption experience. In contrast, cool media, like television and comic books, demand more active involvement from the audience, fostering engagement and interaction.

 

According to him: Cool Media Characteristics:

A. High participation

Cool media require active engagement from the audience to fill in gaps.

Example: TV, telephone, cartoons.

 

B. Low definition

"Low definition" means the media provide less data or detail, so the audience must interpret more.

 

D. Small amount of information

Cool media deliver minimal data, encouraging more audience interaction and interpretation.

 

Hence, option (D) is correct.

Question 19
Which of the following are associated with heavy use of Internet?A. Internet addictionB. DepressionC. DistractionD. AtomizationE. Media LiteracyChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, C, D Only
  • B.B, C, D, E Only
  • C.A, B, E Only
  • D.A, B, C, E Only
Correct Answer: A, B, C, D Only

Heavy or excessive use of the internet has been widely studied and is associated with several negative psychological and behavioral outcomes:

 

A. Internet addiction

– A well-documented consequence where users develop a compulsive need to be online, affecting daily life and functioning.

 

B. Depression

– Excessive screen time and social isolation due to internet overuse have been linked to increased risk of depression, especially in adolescents.

 

C. Distraction

– Constant notifications, multitasking, and endless scrolling contribute to reduced attention span and difficulty focusing.

 

D. Atomization

– Refers to social fragmentation, where individuals become isolated or disconnected from community interaction due to overreliance on online spaces.

 

Thus, option (A) is correct.

Question 20
Match the List–I with List–IIList-IA. Audience imperialismB. CatharsisC. SiloingD. Early WindowList-III. Mediated aggression to reduce people’s aggressive behaviourII. Selecting news sources based on ideologyIII. Early media exposure of the world to childrenIV. Too much preference to audience activityChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV
  • B.A-II, B-III, C-IV, D-I
  • C.A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II
  • D.A-IV, B-I, C-II, D-III
Correct Answer: A-IV, B-I, C-II, D-III

Let’s understand each term and its correct association:

 

A. Audience Imperialism → IV. Too much preference to audience activity

Audience imperialism refers to the belief that the audience has dominant power in interpreting media, sometimes overestimating their role in meaning-making.

 

B. Catharsis → I. Mediated aggression to reduce people’s aggressive behaviour

The Catharsis Theory suggests that watching violent media allows people to release pent-up aggression harmlessly, thereby reducing real-life aggression.

 

C. Siloing → II. Selecting news sources based on ideology

Siloing refers to the tendency to consume media that aligns with one’s existing beliefs, creating echo chambers and ideological bubbles.

 

D. Early Window → III. Early media exposure of the world to children

The Early Window concept relates to children’s early exposure to media, which becomes their first window to the world, shaping perceptions before real-world experience.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 21
The total value of a collection of coins of denomination Rs.20, Rs.10, Rs.5, Rs.2 and Rs.1 is Rs.570. If the number of coins of each denomination is same, then the number of 1 Rs Coin is?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.10
  • B.12
  • C.15
  • D.18
Correct Answer: 15

Let x be the number of coins.

Then, 20x + 10x + 5x + 2x + x = 570

or 38x = 570

or x = 15

Question 22
If the selling price of Rs.36 results in a discount of 25% on the marked price of an item, at what price should the item be sold to offer a discount of 20%?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Rs.37.8
  • B.Rs.38.0
  • C.Rs.38.4
  • D.Rs.39.4
Correct Answer: Rs.38.4

MP = 360.75 = 48

SP after 20% discount = 48 × 0.8

= 38.4

Question 23
Choose the missing term out of the given alternatives –AYBZC, DWEXF, GUHVI, JSKTL, ___________ ?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.MQORN
  • B.MQNRO
  • C.NQMOR
  • D.QMONR
Correct Answer: MQNRO

Odd letters are increasing while even number letters are decreasing.

Next term will be MQNRO

  • A.VQWPF
  • B.WQDGQ
  • C.WODFQ
  • D.VODGQ

Question 25
5 pumps, working 18 hours a day, can empty a tank in 12 days. How many hours a day must 6 pumps operate to empty a tank in 9 days?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.19 hours
  • B.20 hours
  • C.21 hours
  • D.22 hours
Correct Answer: 20 hours

Number of hours = 5×18×126×9 = 20 hours.

Question 26
Which of the following statements is true about the proposition – "A ship has mass. Therefore, all the parts of the ship have mass"?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.It commits the fallacy of division
  • B.It commits the fallacy of equivocation
  • C.It commits the fallacy of hasty generalisation
  • D.It is a non-fallacious statement
Correct Answer: It commits the fallacy of division

The fallacy of division occurs when one assumes that what is true of the whole must also be true of its parts.

 

The whole (ship) has mass – which is true.

 

The conclusion claims that every part of the ship must have mass – this may not necessarily follow (e.g., some parts could be hollow or made of negligible mass).

 

Therefore, the argument wrongly attributes a property of the whole to its parts, making it fallacious.

Question 27
Which of the following statements are true regarding sub-contrary propositions?A. If one is true, the other must be falseB. They cannot both be falseC. If one is false, the other must be trueD. They can both be trueChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A and C Only
  • B.B, C and D Only
  • C.A, B and C Only
  • D.A and D Only
Correct Answer: B, C and D Only

Sub-contrary propositions are pairs of propositions that cannot both be false, but can both be true. These propositions are related to each other in such a way that, if one is false, the other must be true, but if one is true, the other can be either true or false.

 

A. If one is true, the other must be false: This is false for sub-contrary propositions. If one is true, the other is undetermined

 

B. They cannot both be false: This is true. Sub-contrary propositions cannot both be false. If one is false, the other must be true.

 

C. If one is false, the other must be true: This is true. If one of the sub-contrary propositions is false, the other must be true.

 

D. They can both be true: This is true. Sub-contrary propositions can both be true.

Question 28
Which of the following statements are logically equivalent?A. All non-trees are non-animalsB. No animals are treesC. Some animals are not treesD. No trees are animalsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A and D Only
  • B.A and B Only
  • C.B and D Only
  • D.B and C Only
Correct Answer: B and D Only

No animals are trees is CONVERSION of No trees are animals.

Question 29
Which of the following are arranged in the order of decreasing denotation?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Animals, Vertebrates, Birds, Sparrows
  • B.Sparrows, Birds, Vertebrates, Animals
  • C.Animals, Birds, Vertebrates, Sparrows
  • D.Sparrows, Vertebrates, Birds, Animals
Correct Answer: Animals, Vertebrates, Birds, Sparrows

The correct answer is: (A) Animals, Vertebrates, Birds, Sparrows

 

In decreasing denotation, we go from the broadest category (most members) to the narrowest (fewest members).

 

Let’s look at option (A):

Animals – includes all animals (broadest).

Vertebrates – a subset of animals with backbones.

Birds – a subset of vertebrates.

Sparrows – a specific kind of bird.

 

So, this follows a proper descending order of denotation.

Question 30
Which of the following arguments is fallacious because the middle term is non-exclusive?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.All things are non-eternal, because they are knowable.
  • B.The hill has fire because it is knowable.
  • C.Fire is cold because it is a substance.
  • D.Sound is eternal because it is produced.
Correct Answer: All things are non-eternal, because they are knowable.

In Indian logic, a fallacy is called hetvabhasa. It means that the middle term appears to be a reason but is not a valid reason. All fallacies are material fallacies. There are 5 kinds of Fallacies. One of them is Savyabhichara or Anaikantika.

 

This is the fallacy of the irregular middle. It is also of 3 kinds:

 

(a) Sadharana: Here the middle term is too wide. It is present in both the sapaksa (positive) and the vipaksa (negative) instances and violates the rule that the middle should not be present in the negative instances (vipaksasattva). For example, ‘the hill has fire because it is knowable’. Here ‘knowable is present in fiery as well as non-fiery objects'.

 

(b) Asadharana: Here the middle term is too narrow. It is present only in the paksa and neither in the sapaksa nor in the vipaksa. It violates the rule that the middle term should be present in the sapaksa (sapaksasattva); e.g., ‘sound is eternal, because it is audible'. Here audibility belongs to sound only and is present nowhere else.

 

(c) Anupasamhari: Here the middle term is non-exclusive. The minor term is all-inclusive and leaves nothing by way of sapaksa or vipaksa; e.g., 'all things are non-eternal, because they are knowable’.

Question 31
What is the contribution of Douglas Engelbart in the evolution of computer?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Developed the first mouse
  • B.Developed the first Operating System (OS)
  • C.Developed the first Vacuum Tube
  • D.Developed the World Wide Web (WWW)
Correct Answer: Developed the first mouse

Douglas Engelbart is best known for his pioneering work in human-computer interaction. His most notable contribution is the invention of the computer mouse, which he demonstrated in 1968 during what is famously known as “The Mother of All Demos.”

Question 32
In the context of computer networking, which of the following best describes the transmission of a message using packet switching?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Data packets may follow different routes and may arrive at different times in different order.
  • B.Data packets will always follow the same route and arrive at the same time in the same order.
  • C.Data packets will always follow the same route but could arrive at different times in different order.
  • D.Data packets may follow different routes but will always arrive at the same time in the same order.
Correct Answer: Data packets may follow different routes and may arrive at different times in different order.

Packet switching is a method of data transmission where the message is broken down into small units called packets. These packets are sent independently over the network and may take different paths to reach the destination.

 

Key characteristics of packet switching:

  • They can follow different routes based on network traffic and availability.
  • Packets may arrive at different times and out of order.
  • The receiving system reassembles the packets in the correct order.
Question 33
Identify the sequence of words A–E that correctly fills the blanks in the following paragraph on computer networking:IPv4 addresses are ______ long, and IPv6 addresses are ______ long. The MAC address on the other hand, is ______ long. A MAC address is oriented - towards ______, whereas IP address is oriented - towards ______.A. 128-bitB. 32-bitC. softwareD. hardwareE. 48-bitChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.B, E, A, D, C
  • B.B, A, E, D, C
  • C.E, B, A, C, D
  • D.A, B, E, D, C
Correct Answer: B, A, E, D, C

Correct answer is option B - B, A, E, D, C.

 

Explanation of the Sentence with Correct Words Filled In:

 

IPv4 addresses are 32-bit long, and IPv6 addresses are 128-bit long. The MAC address on the other hand, is 48-bit long. A MAC address is oriented - towards hardware, whereas IP address is oriented - towards software.

Question 34
With reference to the computers, which of the following statements are correct?A. CPU follows fetch-decode-execute-store cycle to run instructions.B. Intel and AMD are two manufacturers of CPUsC. The clock speed of a CPU is usually measured in MegabytesD. Fans are required to cool down most CPUs so that they do not overheatE. CPU is the brain of the computers and modern CPUs cannot have multiple processing cores.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, C and D Only
  • B.A and B Only
  • C.C and D Only
  • D.A, B and D Only
Correct Answer: A, B and D Only

Correct answer is option D.

 

A CPU follows fetch-decode-execute-store cycle to run instructions.

Correct – This is the fundamental working cycle of a CPU:

  • Fetch the instruction from memory
  • Decode the instruction
  • Execute the instruction
  • Store the result

 

B. Intel and AMD are two manufacturers of CPUs

Correct – Intel and AMD are the two dominant companies in the consumer and business CPU market.

 

C. The clock speed of a CPU is usually measured in Megabytes

Incorrect – Clock speed is measured in Hertz (Hz), typically in GHz (Gigahertz), not in Megabytes (which is a unit of data size, not speed).

 

D. Fans are required to cool down most CPUs so that they do not overheat

Correct – CPUs generate heat and typically require cooling systems such as fans or liquid cooling to maintain safe operating temperatures.

Question 35
Match the List-I with List-II:List–I (Description)A. A storage medium that stores data on the InternetB. Internal storage where the current instructions are storedC. A solid-state storage that is used in digital camerasD. An optical storage medium that stores high-definition (HD) moviesList–II (Appropriate)I. RAMII. Cloud StorageIII. Blu-ray DiscIV. Flash MemoryOptions:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A–II, B–IV, C–I, D–III
  • B.A–III, B–IV, C–I, D–II
  • C.A–II, B–I, C–IV, D–III
  • D.A–I, B–II, C–III, D–IV
Correct Answer: A–II, B–I, C–IV, D–III

The correct match is given below.

 

A. A storage medium that stores data on the Internet → Cloud Storage (II)

Cloud storage refers to online platforms (like Google Drive, Dropbox) that allow storing and accessing data over the Internet.

 

B. Internal storage where the current instructions are stored → RAM (I)

RAM (Random Access Memory) holds data and instructions temporarily for quick access while the computer is running.

 

C. A solid-state storage that is used in digital cameras → Flash Memory (IV)

Flash memory is non-volatile and used in USB drives, SD cards, and digital cameras.

 

D. An optical storage medium that stores high-definition (HD) movies → Blu-ray Disc (III)

Blu-ray Discs are used to store HD video content, offering much higher capacity than CDs or DVDs.

Question 36
UNFCCC (United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change) was outcome of which of the following meetings?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Montreal Protocol
  • B.Stockholm Conference
  • C.Rio Summit
  • D.Kyoto Protocol
Correct Answer: Rio Summit

The United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) was an outcome of the 1992 Rio Summit, also known as the Earth Summit held in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

 

The UNFCCC is a key international treaty that laid the foundation for global cooperation on combating climate change. It set the stage for later agreements like the Kyoto Protocol (1997) and the Paris Agreement (2015).

Question 37
Which one of the following rotors is commonly used for electricity generation?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Savonius rotor
  • B.Darrious rotor
  • C.Propeller rotor
  • D.Multiblade rotor
Correct Answer: Propeller rotor

Propeller rotors are the most commonly used type of rotor in modern wind turbines for electricity generation. They are horizontal-axis wind turbines (HAWTs), which are highly efficient. They have 2 or 3 blades, similar to an airplane propeller. They are capable of generating high amounts of electricity at both low and high wind speeds.

Question 38
Which one of the following is an example of positive feedback in the context of climate change?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Warmed earth radiates more infrared energy (heat) into space
  • B.Plants remove carbon dioxide from the air
  • C.Oceans remove carbon dioxide from the air
  • D.Snow cover and ice shelf melting reduce reflection of sunlight
Correct Answer: Snow cover and ice shelf melting reduce reflection of sunlight

Option D is an example of positive feedback in climate change.

 

When snow and ice melt, they expose darker land or ocean surfaces. These darker surfaces absorb more solar radiation instead of reflecting it. This increases warming, which leads to more melting—creating a self-reinforcing loop.

 

This is a classic case of positive feedback: initial warming leads to changes that cause even more warming.

Question 39
Which one of the following is not among “three Rs” as a slogan for solid waste management?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Reduce
  • B.Recover
  • C.Recycle
  • D.Reuse
Correct Answer: Recover

The “Three Rs” commonly promoted in solid waste management are:

 

Reduce – Minimize the amount of waste generated.

 

Reuse – Use items multiple times before discarding.

 

Recycle – Process used materials into new products.

Question 40
Typhoid is a waterborne disease caused by water contaminated by(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Virus
  • B.Fungi
  • C.Bacteria
  • D.Protozoan
Correct Answer: Bacteria

Typhoid is a waterborne disease caused by the bacterium Salmonella typhi. It spreads through contaminated water or food, especially in areas with poor sanitation. Symptoms include high fever, weakness, stomach pain, and diarrhea.

Question 41
The Mashelkar Committee recommended upgradation of Regional Engineering Colleges into:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.National Institutes of Technology
  • B.National Technical Institute
  • C.National Engineering Colleges
  • D.National Technical Colleges
Correct Answer: National Institutes of Technology

The Mashelkar Committee (2004) recommended the upgradation of Regional Engineering Colleges (RECs) into National Institutes of Technology (NITs). This was done to provide a uniform standard of education and infrastructure across these institutions and to make them more aligned with the global standards of technical education.

Question 42
The National Education Policy, 2020, emphasized the need to standardize:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.The Indian tribal dialects
  • B.The vanishing languages
  • C.The Indian Sign Languages (ISL)
  • D.The classical languages
Correct Answer: The Indian Sign Languages (ISL)

The National Education Policy (NEP) 2020 emphasizes the need to standardize Indian Sign Languages (ISL) to ensure that students with hearing impairments have access to quality education. This inclusion is part of a broader effort to promote inclusive education and provide equal opportunities for all students, regardless of their abilities.

Question 43
According to Department of Higher Education, Ministry of Education (GoI), which of the following are considered as the Institutions of higher learning?A. The National Institute of Fashion Technology, New DelhiB. National Institute of DesignC. Indian Institute of Advanced Study, ShimlaD. National University of Education Planning and Administration (Neupa), DelhiE. Rashtriya Sanskrit Vidhyapeetha, TirupatiChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, C Only
  • B.B, C, D Only
  • C.A, B, D Only
  • D.C, D, E Only
Correct Answer: C, D, E Only

The correct answer is option D.

 

C. Indian Institute of Advanced Study, Shimla
D. National University of Education Planning and Administration (Neupa), Delhi
E. Rashtriya Sanskrit Vidhyapeetha, Tirupati

Question 44
Atomism was propounded by which of the following schools of Classical Indian Philosophy?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Advaita
  • B.Vaiśeṣika
  • C.Buddhists
  • D.Sāṁkhya
Correct Answer: Vaiśeṣika

The concept of atomism was primarily propounded by the Vaiśeṣika school of Classical Indian Philosophy.

 

Vaiśeṣika philosophy, founded by Kanāda, proposed that all objects in the universe are made up of atoms (called anu), which combine to form larger entities. The Vaiśeṣika school developed an early atomic theory, suggesting that these atoms are indestructible, eternal, and combine in various ways to form the diverse phenomena we observe.

Question 45
Identify the correct chronological order of the following institutions of higher learning?A. Rajkot College, RajkotB. Civil Engineering College, RoorkeeC. Sanskrit College, CalcuttaD. Sanskrit College, BenarasE. Fort Williams College, CalcuttaChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, E, D, C
  • B.C, A, B, E, D
  • C.D, E, C, B, A
  • D.B, C, A, D, E
Correct Answer: D, E, C, B, A

Here’s the correct chronological order with their years of establishment:

 

Sanskrit College, Benaras

Fort William College, Calcutta

Sanskrit College, Calcutta

Civil Engineering College, Roorkee (later IIT Roorkee)

Rajkot College, Rajkot

 

This order matches option (C).

Question 46
Read the passage and answer the following questions:We could argue that humans naturally follow rituals that keep us busy. In an unusual way, rituals permeate daily life and business practices in modern Japan. The main religions in Japan – Confucianism, Buddhism, and Shintoism – are all ones in which the rituals are more important than absolute rules. When doing business in Japan, process, manners, and how you work on something is more important than the final results. What is indisputable, though, is that finding flow in a “ritualistic workplace” is much easier than in one in which we are continually stressed out trying to achieve unclear goals set by our bosses.Rituals give us clear rules and objectives, which help us enter a state of flow. When we have only a big goal in front of us, we might feel lost or overwhelmed by it; rituals help us by giving us the process, the substeps, on the path to achieving a goal. When confronted with a big goal, try to break it down into parts and then attack each part one by one.Focus on enjoying your daily rituals, using them as tools to enter a state of flow.How do rituals influence business practices in modern Japan?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Results are prioritized over the process
  • B.Manners and processes are more important than the final outcome
  • C.Rituals are not significant in Japanese culture
  • D.Business processes are goal oriented
Correct Answer: Manners and processes are more important than the final outcome

From the passage:

 

"When doing business in Japan, process, manners, and how you work on something is more important than the final results."

 

This clearly highlights that in Japanese business culture, rituals and procedures take precedence over just achieving results. The focus is on how the work is done, not just what is achieved.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 47
Read the passage and answer the following questions:We could argue that humans naturally follow rituals that keep us busy. In an unusual way, rituals permeate daily life and business practices in modern Japan. The main religions in Japan – Confucianism, Buddhism, and Shintoism – are all ones in which the rituals are more important than absolute rules. When doing business in Japan, process, manners, and how you work on something is more important than the final results. What is indisputable, though, is that finding flow in a “ritualistic workplace” is much easier than in one in which we are continually stressed out trying to achieve unclear goals set by our bosses.Rituals give us clear rules and objectives, which help us enter a state of flow. When we have only a big goal in front of us, we might feel lost or overwhelmed by it; rituals help us by giving us the process, the substeps, on the path to achieving a goal. When confronted with a big goal, try to break it down into parts and then attack each part one by one.Focus on enjoying your daily rituals, using them as tools to enter a state of flow.What is easier to achieve in a ritualistic workplace compared to a goal-driven one?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Financial success
  • B.State of flow
  • C.Stress and anxiety
  • D.Unclear goal
Correct Answer: State of flow

The passage states:

 

"...finding flow in a 'ritualistic workplace' is much easier than in one in which we are continually stressed out trying to achieve unclear goals..."

"Rituals give us clear rules and objectives, which help us enter a state of flow."

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (B).

In an unusual way, rituals permeate daily life and business practices in modern Japan. The main religions in Japan – Confucianism, Buddhism, and Shintoism – are all ones in which the rituals are more important than absolute rules. When doing business in Japan, process, manners, and how you work on something is more important than the final results. When we have only a big goal in front of us, we might feel lost or overwhelmed by it; rituals help us by giving us the process, the substeps, on the path to achieving a goal. When confronted with a big goal, try to break it down into parts and then attack each part one by one.Focus on enjoying your daily rituals, using them as tools to enter a state of flow.How do rituals help us when we are confronted with a big goal?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)

The main religions in Japan – Confucianism, Buddhism, and Shintoism – are all ones in which the rituals are more important than absolute rules. When we have only a big goal in front of us, we might feel lost or overwhelmed by it; rituals help us by giving us the process, the substeps, on the path to achieving a goal. Question 50
Read the passage and answer the following questions:We could argue that humans naturally follow rituals that keep us busy. In an unusual way, rituals permeate daily life and business practices in modern Japan. The main religions in Japan – Confucianism, Buddhism, and Shintoism – are all ones in which the rituals are more important than absolute rules. When doing business in Japan, process, manners, and how you work on something is more important than the final results. What is indisputable, though, is that finding flow in a “ritualistic workplace” is much easier than in one in which we are continually stressed out trying to achieve unclear goals set by our bosses.Rituals give us clear rules and objectives, which help us enter a state of flow. When we have only a big goal in front of us, we might feel lost or overwhelmed by it; rituals help us by giving us the process, the substeps, on the path to achieving a goal. When confronted with a big goal, try to break it down into parts and then attack each part one by one.Focus on enjoying your daily rituals, using them as tools to enter a state of flow.Role of rituals in human life(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.is to distract us from our goals
  • B.is to keep us busy and structure our daily activities
  • C.is very important during the religious practices only
  • D.is irrelevant in contemporary life
Correct Answer: is to keep us busy and structure our daily activities

"We could argue that humans naturally follow rituals that keep us busy."

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (B).

Quiz Attempt #119718

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table shows the number of viewers of four different TV channels, namely, JIO, ZEE, SONY and COLORS in six different cities A–F, along with the ratio male (M) to females (F) among them. Based on the data in the tables, answer the questions that follow:What is the average number of female viewers of Zee TV taking all six cities together?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.1242
  • B.1262
  • C.1282
  • D.1302
Correct Answer: 1282

Average = 13×2346+917×3094+25×2610+916×2976+715×2670+611×23986

= 782+1638+1044+1674+1246+13086

= 1282

Question 2
The following table shows the number of viewers of four different TV channels, namely, JIO, ZEE, SONY and COLORS in six different cities A–F, along with the ratio male (M) to females (F) among them. Based on the data in the tables, answer the questions that follow:The total number of female viewers of COLORS TV from city C is approximately ________% of the total number of female viewers of JIO from city A.(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.82
  • B.88
  • C.96
  • D.108
Correct Answer: 88

Required percentage = 35×24001017×2778×100 ≈ 88%

Question 3
The following table shows the number of viewers of four different TV channels, namely, JIO, ZEE, SONY and COLORS in six different cities A–F, along with the ratio male (M) to females (F) among them. Based on the data in the tables, answer the questions that follow:The average number of male viewers of SONY TV from all the six cities together is approximately ________% of viewers of JIO TV from city D.(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.30
  • B.40
  • C.50
  • D.60
Correct Answer: 50

Required percentage = 12302472×100 ≈ 50%

Question 4
The following table shows the number of viewers of four different TV channels, namely, JIO, ZEE, SONY and COLORS in six different cities A–F, along with the ratio male (M) to females (F) among them. Based on the data in the tables, answer the questions that follow:The number of male viewers of ZEE TV from city C is approximately ________% more than the number of female viewers of SONY TV from city F?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.12.4
  • B.15.2
  • C.17.3
  • D.18.6
Correct Answer: 18.6

Question 5
The following table shows the number of viewers of four different TV channels, namely, JIO, ZEE, SONY and COLORS in six different cities A–F, along with the ratio male (M) to females (F) among them. Based on the data in the tables, answer the questions that follow:What is the difference between the total number of male viewers and female viewers of ZEE TV from all six cities?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.710
  • B.704
  • C.706
  • D.708
Correct Answer: 710

Difference = 8402 – 7692 = 710

Question 6
Match theList-IwithList-IIList-ITermsA. Declarative MemoryB. Procedural MemoryC. Episodic MemoryD. Semantic MemoryList-IIMeaningI. The retention of information about the where and when of life’s happeningsII. A student’s general Knowledge about the wordIII. The conscious recollection of information such as specific facts of events that can be verbally communicatedIV. Knowledge in the form of skills and cognitive operationsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-IV, B-III, C-II, D-I
  • B.A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II
  • C.A-II, B-III, C-IV, D-I
  • D.A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV
Correct Answer: A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II

The correct answer is option (B) i.e., A–III, B–IV, C–I, D–II.

 

A. Declarative Memory → III. The conscious recollection of information such as specific facts or events that can be verbally communicated

This is the memory you use to recall facts and events that you can explain in words.

Example: Remembering the formula for area of a circle.

 

B. Procedural Memory → IV. Knowledge in the form of skills and cognitive operations

This is memory for actions or skills, often done without thinking.

Example: Riding a bicycle or typing on a keyboard.

 

C. Episodic Memory → I. The retention of information about the where and when of life’s happenings

This stores personal life events, including time and place.

Example: Your memory of a birthday party or first day at school.

 

D. Semantic Memory → II. A student’s general knowledge about the world

This contains factual knowledge that is not tied to personal experiences.

Example: Knowing that India gained independence in 1947.

Question 7
Use of learning strategies and tactics reflects:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Intellectual Humility
  • B.Overlearning
  • C.Rote learning
  • D.Meta cognitive knowledge
Correct Answer: Meta cognitive knowledge

Metacognitive knowledge refers to being aware of one's own learning processes and using strategies and tactics to plan, monitor, and evaluate learning.

 

It involves understanding:

  • What you know
  • How you learn best
  • When and how to apply specific strategies

 

So, using learning strategies and tactics is a clear sign of applying metacognitive knowledge.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 8
Match the List–I with List–IILIST ISwayam Prabha DTH Channel No.A. Channel – 05B. Channel – 06C. Channel – 07D. Channel – 08LIST IIChannel NameI. VIDHIKII. ARYABHATTIII. KAUTILIYAIV. PRABANDHANChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A–II, B–IV, C–III, D–I
  • B.A–III, B–II, C–IV, D–I
  • C.A–IV, B–I, C–III, D–II
  • D.A–IV, B–III, C–II, D–I
Correct Answer: A–IV, B–I, C–III, D–II

The correct match is as follows:

List I – List II

Swayam Prabha DTH Channel No. – Channel Name

A. Channel – 05 - PRABANDHAN
B. Channel – 06 - VIDHIK
C. Channel – 07 - KAUTILIYA
D. Channel – 08 - ARYABHATT

Therefore, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 9
Which of the following are the explanations of Pedagogical Teacher's Dilemmas of constructivism in practice?A. Developing deeper knowledge of subject matterB. Managing new ideas of discourse and collaborative work in the classroomC. Honoring students attempt to think for themselves which remaining faithful to the accepted disciplinary ideasD. Mastering the art of facilitationE. Confronting issues of accountability with various stakeholders in the school communityChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B, C and D only
  • B.D, and E only
  • C.A, B and C only
  • D.B, C and E only
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D only

Pedagogical teacher dilemmas in implementing constructivism involve the practical challenges teachers face while trying to create student-centered, inquiry-based, and collaborative learning environments.

 

Let’s break down the options:

 

A. Developing deeper knowledge of subject matter

– Constructivist teaching requires teachers to go beyond surface-level facts and develop conceptual depth to guide student inquiry.

 

B. Managing new ideas of discourse and collaborative work in the classroom

– Constructivism promotes group learning, student talk, and peer collaboration, which can be challenging to manage.

 

C. Honoring students' attempts to think for themselves while remaining faithful to accepted disciplinary ideas

– Teachers must balance student exploration with accurate academic content, which is a classic constructivist dilemma.

 

D. Mastering the art of facilitation

– Teachers act as facilitators rather than lecturers, guiding rather than delivering content — a shift that requires new skills.

 

E. Confronting issues of accountability with various stakeholders

– While important in general teaching practice, this is more of an administrative or systemic challenge, not specific to the pedagogical dilemmas of constructivism.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (A).

Question 10
A physics instructor needs to create international videos demonstrating Newton's law of motion.Which tool should the instructor use to record, edit and share these videos with students?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Flipgrid
  • B.Camtasia
  • C.Padlet
  • D.Google forms
Correct Answer: Camtasia

Camtasia is a powerful tool used for recording, editing, and producing high-quality instructional videos. It is perfect for demonstrating concepts like Newton’s laws, as it allows:

  • Screen recording
  • Voice-over narration
  • Adding animations, captions, and interactive elements

 

Exporting in various formats for sharing internationally.

 

The other options are incorrect:

(A) Flipgrid

– Designed for short student video responses and discussions, not for full instructional video creation/editing.

 

(C) Padlet

– A collaboration tool where users can post text, images, links — not suited for recording/editing instructional videos.

 

(D) Google Forms

– Best for quizzes and surveys, not video creation or editing.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 11
Which of the following research designs would allow systematic elimination of extraneous variables other than those you are interested in?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Longitudinal research
  • B.Qualitative research
  • C.Correlational research
  • D.Experimental research
Correct Answer: Experimental research

To systematically eliminate extraneous variables and focus on the variables of interest, the research design that is most appropriate is (D) Experimental research.

(A) Longitudinal research: While longitudinal studies track variables over time, they are not primarily designed to control or eliminate extraneous variables. They focus on observing changes over time rather than manipulating variables.

(B) Qualitative research: Qualitative research typically explores complex phenomena in depth and is more concerned with understanding context, experiences, and perspectives rather than controlling extraneous variables.

(C) Correlational research: Correlational studies examine relationships between variables but do not involve manipulation or control of extraneous variables. These studies cannot establish causality.

(D) Experimental research: Experimental research is specifically designed to manipulate one or more independent variables and measure their effect on dependent variables, while controlling extraneous variables (often through randomization, control groups, or other techniques). This is the best approach for systematically eliminating extraneous variables.

Therefore, the correct answer is (D) Experimental research.

Question 12
Which among the following research designs are likely to suffer from the problem of sample attrition?(A) Cross-sectional studies(B) Longitudinal studies(C) Panel studies(D) Cohort studiesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A and B only
  • B.A, B and D only
  • C.A, C and D only
  • D.B, C and D only
Correct Answer: B, C and D only

Sample attrition refers to the loss of participants over time in a study, which can impact the validity of the results. This issue is most likely to occur in studies that track participants over time.

Let’s analyze each research design:

(A) Cross-sectional studies: These studies collect data at one point in time and generally do not involve tracking participants over time. Therefore, sample attrition is not a significant concern in cross-sectional studies.

(B) Longitudinal studies: These studies collect data from the same participants over an extended period, making them susceptible to sample attrition. Participants may drop out, move, or become unavailable, leading to incomplete data.

(C) Panel studies: Similar to longitudinal studies, panel studies follow the same individuals over time, making them highly vulnerable to sample attrition.

(D) Cohort studies: In cohort studies, a group of people (cohort) is followed over time. This design also involves tracking individuals over time, and participants may drop out, leading to sample attrition.

Thus, the correct answer is (D) B, C and D only, as longitudinal studies, panel studies, and cohort studies are all likely to suffer from sample attrition due to their nature of following participants over time.

Question 13
When the characteristic like age, sex or race of the researcher affect the behaviour of a participants in a study, it refers to(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Biosocial effect
  • B.Psychological effect
  • C.Hawthorn effect
  • D.Evaluation apprehension
Correct Answer: Biosocial effect

When the characteristics like age, sex, or race of the researcher affect the behavior of participants in a study, this refers to the Biosocial effect.

(A) Biosocial effect: This occurs when the personal characteristics of the researcher, such as their age, gender, race, or social background, influence how participants behave or respond. These personal characteristics may impact the dynamics of the research interaction.

(B) Psychological effect: This refers to the influence of psychological factors (such as stress, mental state, or personal biases) on the behavior of participants or the researcher, not necessarily related to the researcher's social characteristics.

(C) Hawthorne effect: This effect occurs when participants alter their behavior because they are aware that they are being observed. It doesn't relate specifically to the researcher's characteristics but to the awareness of being part of a study.

(D) Evaluation apprehension: This is when participants feel nervous or apprehensive about being judged or evaluated in a study, which might influence their behavior.

Therefore, the correct answer is (A) Biosocial effect.

Question 14
Identify the ordinal variables.(A) Rank of army personnel(B) Religion(C) Caste(D) Annoyance level(E) Temperature in CelsiusChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B, C and D only
  • B.B and C only
  • C.A and D only
  • D.D and E only
Correct Answer: A and D only

Ordinal variables are those that involve categories with a meaningful order, but the intervals between the categories are not necessarily equal.

Let’s analyze each option:

(A) Rank of army personnel: This is an ordinal variable because ranks have a meaningful order (e.g., General < Colonel < Captain), but the difference between ranks is not necessarily equal in terms of status, pay, or responsibilities.

(B) Religion: This is a nominal variable, as religion consists of categories without any inherent order or ranking.

(C) Caste: Like religion, caste is a nominal variable because it consists of categories with no inherent order.

(D) Annoyance level: This is an ordinal variable because annoyance can be ranked (e.g., not annoyed, slightly annoyed, very annoyed), but the differences between these levels are not necessarily equal.

(E) Temperature in Celsius: This is an interval variable because temperature is measured on a scale with equal intervals and no true zero point (i.e., 0°C does not mean the absence of temperature).

Thus, the correct answer is (A) Rank of army personnel and (D) Annoyance level as the ordinal variables.

Question 15
In a situation where a researcher wants to test whether the population mean is lower than some hypothesized value, the researcher would employ-(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Z-tailed test
  • B.Left tailed test
  • C.Right tailed test
  • D.F-test
Correct Answer: Left tailed test

When a researcher wants to test whether the population mean is lower than a hypothesized value, they would employ a left-tailed test.

(A) Z-tailed test: This is not a specific type of test. Typically, we refer to "Z-tests" in hypothesis testing, but the direction of the test (left, right, or two-tailed) is not described as "Z-tailed."

(B) Left-tailed test: In this case, the researcher is interested in testing if the population mean is lower than the hypothesized value, which corresponds to a left-tailed test. This test checks for values that fall in the lower tail of the distribution.

(C) Right-tailed test: This test is used when the researcher is interested in testing if the population mean is greater than the hypothesized value. It checks for values in the upper tail of the distribution.

(D) F-test: This is typically used to compare variances between two or more groups, not for testing population means.

Therefore, the correct answer is (B) Left-tailed test.

Question 16
The semiotic study of Charles Pierce is _______ in its approach:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Experimental
  • B.Historical
  • C.Quasi legal
  • D.Quasi-scientific
Correct Answer: Quasi-scientific

The correct answer is: (D) Quasi-scientific

 

Charles Sanders Peirce’s semiotics (study of signs) is quasi-scientific in approach. He developed a rigorous, logical framework for analyzing signs, grounded in his philosophy of pragmatism and scientific methodology.

Question 17
The concept of explanatory journalism attempts to answer more-(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.‘Why’ questions
  • B.‘Where’ questions
  • C.‘Which’ questions
  • D.‘Who’ questions
Correct Answer: ‘Why’ questions

Explanatory journalism focuses on making complex issues clear and understandable by going beyond just reporting facts.

 

It aims to answer the “Why” behind the news — such as:

  • Why is inflation rising?
  • Why did a policy change happen?
  • Why are certain global events connected?

 

This style of journalism adds depth and context to the news, helping the audience understand causes, implications, and background.

Question 18
Which of the following are statements made by scholars in relation to media-audience equations?A. New media are natural and socialB. People are polite to well-designed computerC. The relationship between communication gadgets and people is passiveD. The new media technology has created a kind of techno-spiritE. The techno-media environment is an ideal environmentChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, D, E only
  • B.C, D, E only
  • C.B, C, E only
  • D.A, B, C, D only
Correct Answer: A, B, C, D only

The correct answer is option (D) i.e., A, B, C, D only.

 

Let’s evaluate these statements in the context of media-audience relationship theories as discussed by media scholars:

 

A. New media are natural and social

– Scholars like Raymond Williams and Manuel Castells have argued that new media evolve from both technological developments (natural) and social practices (social).

 

B. People are polite to well-designed computer

– This comes from Byron Reeves and Clifford Nass’s Media Equation theory, which shows that humans interact with media (e.g., computers) as if they were real people, showing politeness and social behavior.

 

C. The relationship between communication gadgets and people is passive

– Some media theorists have critiqued how users often passively consume content through devices, especially in traditional media contexts. (Though this idea has evolved with interactive media, it still holds in certain critical theories.)

 

D. The new media technology has created a kind of techno-spirit

– Scholars have used terms like "techno-spirituality" or "techno-spirit" to describe how deeply people are now emotionally and spiritually connected to their devices and digital presence.

 

E. The techno-media environment is an ideal environment

– This is not a commonly held scholarly consensus. Scholars often highlight both opportunities and risks in techno-media environments — such as surveillance, digital divide, echo chambers, etc. Hence, calling it "ideal" is not a widely supported academic view.

Question 19
Identify the correct chronological order of the following inventions related to communication:A. Cable televisionB. TelegraphC. TelephoneD. MP3E. PhonographChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, C, D, B, E
  • B.B, C, E, A, D
  • C.C, A, B, D, E
  • D.E, A, C, B, D
Correct Answer: B, C, E, A, D

The correct answer is option (B), i.e., B, C, E, A, D.

 

Telegraph (B) – 1830s–1840s

Developed by Samuel Morse (Morse code), this was the first long-distance communication system.

 

Telephone (C) – 1876

Invented by Alexander Graham Bell, it revolutionized voice communication over wires.

 

Phonograph (E) – 1877

Invented by Thomas Edison, it was the first device to record and reproduce sound.

 

Cable Television (A) – 1948

Originated in the U.S. to enhance TV reception in remote areas.

 

MP3 (D) – 1990s

A digital audio format that transformed music storage and sharing.

Question 20
Match theList–IwithList–IIList–I (Concept)A. DisinformationB. Black propagandaC. White propagandaD. Gray propagandaList–II (Description)I. International suppression of contradictory ideasII. Transmission of information may be or may not be falseIII. False information about the oppositionIV. Strategic transmission of liesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV
  • B.A-II, B-III, C-IV, D-I
  • C.A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II
  • D.A-IV, B-I, C-II, D-III
Correct Answer: A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II

The correct answer is option (C), i.e., A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II.

 

A. Disinformation → III. False information about the opposition

– Disinformation is deliberately false or misleading information spread with the intent to deceive, especially about opponents or rivals.

 

B. Black propaganda → IV. Strategic transmission of lies

– Black propaganda hides the true source and spreads lies or fabricated content to mislead and manipulate.

 

C. White propaganda → I. International suppression of contradictory ideas

– White propaganda comes from an acknowledged source, often government or institutions, and aims to promote one-sided views, often suppressing opposition indirectly.

 

D. Gray propaganda → II. Transmission of information may or may not be false

– Gray propaganda is where the source is uncertain and the truthfulness of information is ambiguous — it may be true, partially true, or false.

Question 21
In an examination a student scores 4 marks for every correct answer and loses 1 mark for every wrong answer. A student attempted all the 200 questions and scores 400 marks. The number of questions he answered correctly was:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.60
  • B.100
  • C.120
  • D.150
Correct Answer: 120

Let the student did x correct answers.

Then, 4x – 1(200 – x) = 400

Or x = 120

Question 22
If the selling price of Rs 235 results in a discount of 6% on the marked price of an item, at what price should the item be sold to offer a discount of 15%?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Rs 199.5
  • B.Rs 206.5
  • C.Rs 212.5
  • D.Rs 215
Correct Answer: Rs 212.5

SP = 235

MP = 2350.94 = 250

Discount = 15%

SP = 250 × 0.85 = 212.5

Question 23
One term in the number series is wrong. Find out the wrong term?325, 259, 202, 160, 127, 105, 94(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.94
  • B.127
  • C.202
  • D.259
Correct Answer: 202

325 → 259 → –66

259 → 202 → –57

202 → 160 → –42

160 → 127 → –33

127 → 105 → –22

105 → 94 → –11

Thus, 202 is wrong term.

Question 24
In a certain coding language, if the word ‘FLOUT’ is coded as ‘IIRRW’, then the word ‘CLING’ will be coded as:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.ENKPI
  • B.EHLJK
  • C.FLILK
  • D.FILKJ
Correct Answer: FILKJ

F (6) → I (9) → +3

L (12) → I (9) → –3

O (15) → R (18) → +3

U (21) → R (18) → –3

T (20) → W (23) → +3

Similarly,

C (3) → +3 → F

L (12) → –3 → I

I (9) → +3 → L

N (14) → –3 → K

G (7) → +3 → J

Question 25
6 Pumps, working 12 hours a day, can empty a tank in 15 days. How many hours a day must 8 pumps operate to empty the tank in same number of days?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.11 hours
  • B.13 hours
  • C.9 hours
  • D.10 hours
Correct Answer: 9 hours

Required hours = 6×12×158×15 = 9 hours

Question 26
“No one has ever been able to prove that psychic powers do not exist. Therefore, it is proved that psychic powers do exist.” Identify the fallacy in the above argument.(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Appeal to ignorance
  • B.Hasty generalization
  • C.Slippery slope
  • D.Equivocation
Correct Answer: Appeal to ignorance

The fallacy in the argument "No one has ever been able to prove that psychic powers do not exist. Therefore, it is proved that psychic powers do exist" is (A) Appeal to Ignorance.

 

Appeal to Ignorance: This fallacy occurs when it is asserted that a proposition is true because it has not been proven false, or vice versa. In this case, the argument claims that because psychic powers have not been disproven, they must be true. This is a classic example of the appeal to ignorance fallacy, as the lack of evidence against something is wrongly taken as proof for its existence.

Question 27
Two propositions are contradictory ifA. They cannot both be trueB. Of the pair, exactly one is true and exactly one is falseC. They can both be falseD. They cannot both be falseChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A and C only
  • B.A, B and C only
  • C.B only
  • D.A, B and D only
Correct Answer: A, B and D only

Two propositions are contradictories when they cannot both be true and they cannot both be false. This means that for any pair of contradictory propositions, one must be true and the other must be false.

 

A. They cannot both be true: This is true for contradictory propositions. If one proposition is true, the other must be false.

 

B. Of the pair, exactly one is true and exactly one is false: This is also true. Since contradictory propositions cannot both be true or both false, exactly one must be true and the other false.

 

C. They can both be false: This is false for contradictory propositions. If both propositions were false, they would not be contradictories. Contradictory propositions must have exactly one true and one false statement.

 

D. They cannot both be false: This is true. As per the definition of contradictory propositions, they cannot both be false.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is (D) A, B, and D only.

Question 28
Which of the following statements are logically equivalent?A. Some non-intelligent animals are non-apesB. Some apes are not intelligent animalsC. Some apes are non-intelligent animalsD. Some non-intelligent animals are not non-apesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.A and C only
  • C.A and D only
  • D.B, C and D only
Correct Answer: B, C and D only

Statement “B. Some apes are not intelligent animals” is same as “C. Some apes are non-intelligent animals”

Some non-intelligent animals are not non-apes is CONTRAPOSITIPON of “Some apes are non-intelligent animals” (Type O)

Question 29
Which of the following is arranged in the order of decreasing extension?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Mathematics, arithmetic, numbers, prime numbers
  • B.Prime numbers, numbers, arithmetic, Mathematics
  • C.Arithmetic, mathematics, numbers, prime numbers
  • D.Numbers, prime numbers, arithmetic, mathematics
Correct Answer: Mathematics, arithmetic, numbers, prime numbers

The correct answer is: (A) Mathematics, arithmetic, numbers, prime numbers

 

Extension in logic refers to the scope or number of objects a concept applies to. The more general a term, the greater its extension.

 

Let’s break down option (A):

Mathematics – the broadest field; includes many branches.

Arithmetic – a branch of mathematics.

Numbers – objects studied in arithmetic.

Prime numbers – a specific subset of numbers.

Question 30
Which of the arguments is fallacious because the middle term is pervaded by the absence of the major term instead of its presence?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.The hill has fire because it is knowable
  • B.Sound is eternal because it is produced
  • C.Sound is eternal because it is audible
  • D.Sound is quality because it is visible
Correct Answer: Sound is eternal because it is produced

Given is the case of "Viruddha" fallacy.

 

Viruddha is the contradictory middle. The middle term, instead of being pervaded by the presence of the major term, is pervaded by the absence of the major term. Instead of proving the existence of the major term in the minor term, it proves its non-existence therein; e.g., 'sound is eternal, because it is produced'. Here ‘produced, instead of proving the eternality of sound, proves its non-eternality. Here the middle term itself disproves the original proposition and proves its contradictory.

Question 31
‘Web 2.0’, a second generation of the Internet, can best be described as:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A software package developed by Microsoft and available at a discount to teachers
  • B.An approach to the Internet in which users can share thoughts, opinions and ideas in a free and open forum such as blogs, wikis and podcasts
  • C.An approach to the Internet in which websites and apps can process information in a smart human-like way through technologies like Machine Learning, Big Data, Decentralized Ledger Technology, etc
  • D.Faster Internet for big business
Correct Answer: An approach to the Internet in which users can share thoughts, opinions and ideas in a free and open forum such as blogs, wikis and podcasts

Web 2.0 refers to the second generation of the Internet, emphasizing user-generated content, collaboration, and sharing. Unlike the early static web (Web 1.0), Web 2.0 allows users to interact, share opinions, and create content through platforms such as blogs, wikis, social media, and podcasts. The focus is on user participation, collaboration, and the sharing of information in dynamic, interactive environments.

Question 32
Each webpage is assigned a (n) ______, an address that identifies the location of the page on the Internet.(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Internet Protocol (IP)
  • B.Uniform Resource Locator (URL)
  • C.Top-Level Domain (TLD)
  • D.Hyper Text Transfer Protocol (HTTP)
Correct Answer: Uniform Resource Locator (URL)

A URL (Uniform Resource Locator) is the address assigned to each webpage, identifying its location on the Internet. A URL is used to access websites and pages by specifying the protocol, domain, and specific path to the resource.

 

For example: https://www.example.com/page1

 

In this URL:

 

https is the protocol,

 

www.example.com is the domain, and

 

/page1 is the specific page or path.

Question 33
Match theList-IwithList-II:List–I (File Extension)A. .docB. .jpgC. .mp3D. .movList–II (File Type)I. Image fileII. Video fileIII. MS-WORD fileIV. Audio fileChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A–III, B–I, C–II, D–IV
  • B.A–III, B–I, C–IV, D–II
  • C.A–IV, B–I, C–III, D–II
  • D.A–III, B–IV, C–I, D–II
Correct Answer: A–III, B–I, C–IV, D–II

The correct matching of the file extensions with their corresponding file types is as follows:

 

A. .doc → MS-WORD file (III)

 

B. .jpg → Image file (I)

 

C. .mp3 → Audio file (IV)

 

D. .mov → Video file (II)

 

Correct Answer is option (B) - A–III, B–I, C–IV, D–II.

Question 34
Which of the following statements are true with reference to cybersecurity?(A) Incident response in cyber security involves identifying vulnerabilities and patching them before an attack occurs(B) CERT-In acts as an early warning system for cyber threats and attacks in India(C) 'Tor' is an acronym for ‘The Onion Router’, a browser that enables anonymous communication(D) Using a Virtual Personal Network can help secure a network by encrypting transmitted dataChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A and D only
  • B.A and C only
  • C.B and D only
  • D.B and C only
Correct Answer: B and C only

The correct answer is option D - B and C.

 

(B) CERT-In acts as an early warning system for cyber threats and attacks in India – True. CERT-In (Indian Computer Emergency Response Team) provides early warnings, coordinates incident responses, and helps with cybersecurity preparedness in India.

 

(C) 'Tor' is an acronym for ‘The Onion Router’, a browser that enables anonymous communication – True. Tor is a free, open-source software that enables anonymous communication by routing internet traffic through multiple servers (layers like an onion), making it difficult to trace the user's activities.

Question 35
IfLmrepresents a number L in base-M number system, then identify the correct ascending order of the following numbers A-D when converted to decimal number system:A.(203)4B.(100001)2C.(114)5D.(1012)3Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.D, B, C, A
  • B.B, D, C, A
  • C.A, B, C, D
  • D.D, B, A, C
Correct Answer: D, B, C, A

(203)4 when converted to base 10 is 35
(100001)2 when converted to base 10 is 33
(114)5 when converted to base 10 is 34
(1012)3 when converted to base 10 is 32

Question 36
Radioactivity in drinking water can be caused due to pressure of naturally or anthropogenically occurring radionuclides.Which one of the following is a naturally occurring radionuclide with a possibility to contaminate drinking water?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Fluoride
  • B.Plutonium
  • C.Radon
  • D.Strontium
Correct Answer: Radon

The correct answer is option (C) - Radon.

 

Radon is a naturally occurring radioactive gas that can be found in soil, rock, and groundwater. It can seep into drinking water supplies, particularly groundwater, and pose health risks when consumed over time.

Question 37
Which of the following is NOT released during an earthquake?1. P-Wave2. S-WaveChoose the correct option:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Only 1
  • B.Only 2
  • C.Both 1 and 2
  • D.Neither 1 nor 2
Correct Answer: Neither 1 nor 2

The correct answer is option (D) – Neither 1 nor 2.

 

Both P-Waves and S-Waves are released during an earthquake:

 

P-Waves (Primary waves): These are the fastest seismic waves, and they travel through both solid and liquid layers of the Earth.

 

S-Waves (Secondary waves): These are slower than P-waves and can only travel through solids.

 

Since both P-Waves and S-Waves are seismic waves generated by earthquakes, neither is excluded in the question. Therefore, the correct answer is (D) Neither 1 nor 2.

Question 38
Which of the following is used to measure and monitor air pollution?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.RADAR
  • B.SONAR
  • C.LIDAR
  • D.SODAR
Correct Answer: LIDAR

The correct answer is option (C) - LIDAR.

 

LIDAR (Light Detection and Ranging) is used to measure and monitor various environmental factors, including air pollution. It uses laser light to detect and measure the concentration of pollutants in the air by analyzing the light that is scattered by particles in the atmosphere.

Question 39
In nuclear reactors, ‘moderators’ are substances:A. That slows down neutronB. That limits the chain reactionC. That helps to sustain the chain reactionD. Without which chain reaction in most nuclear reactors would stopE. Such as heavy water orD2OChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B, C and D only
  • B.A, C, D and E only
  • C.B, C and D only
  • D.A, B and E only
Correct Answer: A, C, D and E only

The correct answer is option (B) - A, C, D and E only.

 

In nuclear reactors, moderators are substances that:

 

(A) Slow down neutrons to thermal energies, which increases the probability of fission reactions when these neutrons collide with nuclear fuel (such as uranium).

 

(C) Help sustain the chain reaction by slowing neutrons down, making them more likely to cause further fission reactions.

 

(D) Without moderators, the chain reaction in most nuclear reactors would stop because fast neutrons would not effectively cause further fission in the reactor core.

 

(E) is correct because common moderators include heavy water (D₂O), graphite, and sometimes light water (H₂O), which are used to slow down the neutrons.

 

Thus, the correct options are A, C, D, and E, which make option (B) the right choice.

Question 40
What was the level of Carbon dioxide(CO)2during pre-industrial era?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.200 ppm
  • B.280 ppm
  • C.350 ppm
  • D.420 ppm
Correct Answer: 280 ppm

The correct answer is option B.

Question 41
