The ancient Grammarian Panini was a student at which of the following ancient places of learning?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Takshashila
  • B.Nalanda
  • C.Sridhanya Katak
  • D.Odantapuri
Correct Answer: Takshashila

The correct answer is option (A) - Takshashila.

 

Panini, the ancient Indian grammarian known for his work on Sanskrit grammar, was a student at Takshashila (also known as Taxila), an ancient center of learning in India. Takshashila was a major educational hub during ancient times, where many scholars, including Panini, studied and taught.

Question 42
One of the major recommendations of the National Education Policy, 2020, is the establishment of ________ for restructuring higher education in India.(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Science universities
  • B.Dance Academies
  • C.Technology clubs
  • D.Higher Education Institutions clusters
Correct Answer: Higher Education Institutions clusters

The correct answer is option (D) - Higher Education Institutions clusters.

 

One of the major recommendations of the National Education Policy (NEP), 2020, is the establishment of Higher Education Institutions (HEI) clusters. These clusters are designed to promote interdisciplinary learning and collaboration among various institutions, fostering innovation and enhancing the quality of higher education in India. The aim is to bring together institutions from various fields to create a more integrated and holistic educational experience.

Question 43
The major initiatives of the Union Government during the XI plan in the higher education sector were:A. Establishment of 14 world class universitiesB. Diversion of funds to private universities for better performanceC. Strengthening of science based higher education and research in universitiesD. Restructuring of different councilsE. Financially supporting uncovered state universities and collegesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B, C only
  • B.A, C, E only
  • C.B, C, D only
  • D.D, E only
Correct Answer: A, C, E only

The correct answer is option (B) - A, C, E only

 

During the XI Plan, the Indian government took several major initiatives to improve higher education, including:

 

A: Establishment of 14 world-class universities to enhance the quality of education and research in India.

 

C: Strengthening science-based higher education and research in universities, with a focus on improving the quality of science education and increasing research output.

 

E: Financial support to uncovered state universities and colleges, ensuring that even those institutions that were not covered under earlier schemes would receive funding to improve infrastructure and education quality.

Question 44
Which of the following are public sector funding agencies for research in India?A. TATA TrustB. ICARC. ICHRD. ICMRE. Population Foundation of India (PFI)Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B, C only
  • B.B, C, D only
  • C.D, E only
  • D.A, C, E only
Correct Answer: B, C, D only

The correct answer is option (B) - B, C, D only.

 

Public sector funding agencies for research in India include:

 

B. ICAR (Indian Council of Agricultural Research) – Funds agricultural research and education.

 

C. ICHR (Indian Council of Historical Research) – Supports research in the field of history.

 

D. ICMR (Indian Council of Medical Research) – The apex body for the formulation, coordination, and promotion of biomedical research.

 

On the other hand:

 

A. TATA Trust and E. Population Foundation of India (PFI) are private sector or non-governmental organizations, not public sector agencies.

Question 45
Match the List–I with List–IIList–I(Forerunner College)A. Muir Central CollegeB. Oriental CollegeC. University CollegeD. Canning CollegeList–II(University)I. Lucknow UniversityII. Allahabad UniversityIII. Aligarh UniversityIV. Panjab UniversityChoose the correct answer from the options below:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV
  • B.A-II, B-III, C-IV, D-I
  • C.A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II
  • D.A-IV, B-I, C-II, D-III
Correct Answer: A-II, B-III, C-IV, D-I

The correct answer is option (B) - A-II, B-III, C-IV, D-I.

 

A. Muir Central College → II. Allahabad University

(Muir Central College was a constituent of Allahabad University)

 

B. Oriental College → III. Aligarh University

(Oriental College was one of the institutions that influenced the foundation of Aligarh Muslim University)

 

C. University College → IV. Panjab University

(University College, Lahore was part of the establishment of Panjab University)

 

D. Canning College → I. Lucknow University

(Canning College played a major role in the foundation of Lucknow University)

Question 46
Read the passage below and answer the following questions:The Andaman and Nicobar Islands situated between 6° and 14° latitudes and 92° and 94° longitudes in the Bay of Bengal have been inhabited for thousands of years going back to the Middle Palaeolithic age. Through the vast majority of this time the inhabitants of these islands maintained their separated existence diversifying into distinct linguistic, cultural and territorial groups. In the mid-nineteenth century CE, for the first time they came into sustained contact with the outside world. Today, they are mainly consisted of the Great Andamanese tribes like the Jarawa, the Onge and the Sentinelese and the Nicobarese consisting of the great Nicobarese and the Shompens. Host to the tropical climate nourished by both the south-west and the north-east monsoons, the Union Territory is at present divided into three revenue districts with Port Blair as its capital.Andaman and Nicobar Islands dwellers have migrated and settled down from various parts of India and Burma as well. The culture of Andaman and Nicobar Islands is distinct and unique and comprises mainly two types of inhabitants–Indians and Natives. The former are mainly from the Indian Mainland especially from areas like Punjab, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Myanmar and Sri Lanka. The Natives are what makes Andaman and Nicobar Islands different from other parts of the country. They are the main reason why these islands have a wild aura about them.Which of the following communities has connection with the Andaman and Nicobar Islands?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Khasi
  • B.Santhal
  • C.Bodo
  • D.Jarawa
Correct Answer: Jarawa

The passage clearly mentions:

 

"Today, they are mainly consisted of the Great Andamanese tribes like the Jarawa, the Onge and the Sentinelese..."

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 47
Read the passage below and answer the following questions:The Andaman and Nicobar Islands situated between 6° and 14° latitudes and 92° and 94° longitudes in the Bay of Bengal have been inhabited for thousands of years going back to the Middle Palaeolithic age. Through the vast majority of this time the inhabitants of these islands maintained their separated existence diversifying into distinct linguistic, cultural and territorial groups. In the mid-nineteenth century CE, for the first time they came into sustained contact with the outside world. Today, they are mainly consisted of the Great Andamanese tribes like the Jarawa, the Onge and the Sentinelese and the Nicobarese consisting of the great Nicobarese and the Shompens. Host to the tropical climate nourished by both the south-west and the north-east monsoons, the Union Territory is at present divided into three revenue districts with Port Blair as its capital.Andaman and Nicobar Islands dwellers have migrated and settled down from various parts of India and Burma as well. The culture of Andaman and Nicobar Islands is distinct and unique and comprises mainly two types of inhabitants–Indians and Natives. The former are mainly from the Indian Mainland especially from areas like Punjab, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Myanmar and Sri Lanka. The Natives are what makes Andaman and Nicobar Islands different from other parts of the country. They are the main reason why these islands have a wild aura about them.Which of the following does not help the inhabitants to continue their distinctive identity in Andaman and Nicobar Islands?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Linguistic aspect
  • B.Cultural aspect
  • C.Territorial aspect
  • D.Nutritional aspect
Correct Answer: Nutritional aspect

According to the passage:

 

"...the inhabitants of these islands maintained their separated existence diversifying into distinct linguistic, cultural and territorial groups."

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 48
Read the passage below and answer the following questions:The Andaman and Nicobar Islands situated between 6° and 14° latitudes and 92° and 94° longitudes in the Bay of Bengal have been inhabited for thousands of years going back to the Middle Palaeolithic age. Through the vast majority of this time the inhabitants of these islands maintained their separated existence diversifying into distinct linguistic, cultural and territorial groups. In the mid-nineteenth century CE, for the first time they came into sustained contact with the outside world. Today, they are mainly consisted of the Great Andamanese tribes like the Jarawa, the Onge and the Sentinelese and the Nicobarese consisting of the great Nicobarese and the Shompens. Host to the tropical climate nourished by both the south-west and the north-east monsoons, the Union Territory is at present divided into three revenue districts with Port Blair as its capital.Andaman and Nicobar Islands dwellers have migrated and settled down from various parts of India and Burma as well. The culture of Andaman and Nicobar Islands is distinct and unique and comprises mainly two types of inhabitants–Indians and Natives. The former are mainly from the Indian Mainland especially from areas like Punjab, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Myanmar and Sri Lanka. The Natives are what makes Andaman and Nicobar Islands different from other parts of the country. They are the main reason why these islands have a wild aura about them.Which of the following groups of people of Andaman and Nicobar islands have migrated from Indian mainland, Myanmar and Sri Lanka?(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Indians
  • B.Natives
  • C.Nagas
  • D.Marwaris
Correct Answer: Indians

From the passage:

 

"The culture of Andaman and Nicobar Islands is distinct and unique and comprises mainly two types of inhabitants – Indians and Natives. The former are mainly from the Indian Mainland especially from areas like Punjab, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Myanmar and Sri Lanka."

 

This clearly identifies Indians (as opposed to the Natives) as the migrant settlers who came from regions including mainland India, Myanmar, and Sri Lanka.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (A).

Question 49
Read the passage below and answer the following questions:The Andaman and Nicobar Islands situated between 6° and 14° latitudes and 92° and 94° longitudes in the Bay of Bengal have been inhabited for thousands of years going back to the Middle Palaeolithic age. Through the vast majority of this time the inhabitants of these islands maintained their separated existence diversifying into distinct linguistic, cultural and territorial groups. In the mid-nineteenth century CE, for the first time they came into sustained contact with the outside world. Today, they are mainly consisted of the Great Andamanese tribes like the Jarawa, the Onge and the Sentinelese and the Nicobarese consisting of the great Nicobarese and the Shompens. Host to the tropical climate nourished by both the south-west and the north-east monsoons, the Union Territory is at present divided into three revenue districts with Port Blair as its capital.Andaman and Nicobar Islands dwellers have migrated and settled down from various parts of India and Burma as well. The culture of Andaman and Nicobar Islands is distinct and unique and comprises mainly two types of inhabitants–Indians and Natives. The former are mainly from the Indian Mainland especially from areas like Punjab, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Myanmar and Sri Lanka. The Natives are what makes Andaman and Nicobar Islands different from other parts of the country. They are the main reason why these islands have a wild aura about them.Andaman and Nicobar Islands(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.is a cluster of small beautiful countries
  • B.is a cluster of several beautiful islands
  • C.is a cluster of few villages
  • D.is cluster of deserts
Correct Answer: is a cluster of several beautiful islands

The passage describes Andaman and Nicobar Islands as:

 

"...situated between 6° and 14° latitudes and 92° and 94° longitudes in the Bay of Bengal..."

"...have been inhabited for thousands of years..."

"...divided into three revenue districts with Port Blair as its capital."

 

These details confirm that Andaman and Nicobar is a group of islands in the Bay of Bengal, not countries, villages, or deserts.

Question 50
Read the passage below and answer the following questions:The Andaman and Nicobar Islands situated between 6° and 14° latitudes and 92° and 94° longitudes in the Bay of Bengal have been inhabited for thousands of years going back to the Middle Palaeolithic age. Through the vast majority of this time the inhabitants of these islands maintained their separated existence diversifying into distinct linguistic, cultural and territorial groups. In the mid-nineteenth century CE, for the first time they came into sustained contact with the outside world. Today, they are mainly consisted of the Great Andamanese tribes like the Jarawa, the Onge and the Sentinelese and the Nicobarese consisting of the great Nicobarese and the Shompens. Host to the tropical climate nourished by both the south-west and the north-east monsoons, the Union Territory is at present divided into three revenue districts with Port Blair as its capital.Andaman and Nicobar Islands dwellers have migrated and settled down from various parts of India and Burma as well. The culture of Andaman and Nicobar Islands is distinct and unique and comprises mainly two types of inhabitants–Indians and Natives. The former are mainly from the Indian Mainland especially from areas like Punjab, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Myanmar and Sri Lanka. The Natives are what makes Andaman and Nicobar Islands different from other parts of the country. They are the main reason why these islands have a wild aura about them.Port Blair is a part of:(UGC NET 27 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Kerala
  • B.Andhra Pradesh
  • C.Sri Lanka
  • D.Andaman and Nicobar Islands
Correct Answer: Andaman and Nicobar Islands

The passage clearly states:

 

"...the Union Territory is at present divided into three revenue districts with Port Blair as its capital."

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Quiz Attempt #119719

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table shows the proportion of students passed in three different Graduation Streams, namely, Arts, Science and Commerce, from seven different cities A–G, along with the ratio of Males (M) to Females (F) for the three streams among the students. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.If the number of males who passed in Commerce from City-G is 2544, then what is the number of students who passed in Arts from City-G?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.3600
  • B.4200
  • C.4800
  • D.3400
Correct Answer: 3600

Let x be the total students.

Then, 412 ×53100×x = 2544

or x = 14400

Students in arts = 412 ×14400 = 3600

Question 2
The following table shows the proportion of students passed in three different Graduation Streams, namely, Arts, Science and Commerce, from seven different cities A–G, along with the ratio of Males (M) to Females (F) for the three streams among the students. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.For City-A, if the total number of males who passed in Arts is 2480, then what is the difference between the number of students who passed in Commerce and that in Science?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.600
  • B.1000
  • C.1400
  • D.1800
Correct Answer: 1800

Let x be the total students.

Then, 211 ×3145×x = 2480

or x = 19800

Difference = 511-411 × 19800 = 1800

Question 3
The following table shows the proportion of students passed in three different Graduation Streams, namely, Arts, Science and Commerce, from seven different cities A–G, along with the ratio of Males (M) to Females (F) for the three streams among the students. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.If the number of students who passed in Commerce from City-F is 3240, then the number of students who passed from City-F is _______% of the number of Science students who passed from City-F.(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.75
  • B.150
  • C.180
  • D.225
Correct Answer: 225

Let total students = x

39 × x = 3240

or x = 9720

Required ratio = 972049×9720 × 100 = 225%

Question 4
The following table shows the proportion of students passed in three different Graduation Streams, namely, Arts, Science and Commerce, from seven different cities A–G, along with the ratio of Males (M) to Females (F) for the three streams among the students. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.If the number of females who passed in Arts from City-C is 768, then the number of males who passed in Commerce from City-C is approximately _______% of the number of students who passed from City-C.(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.14.76
  • B.18.24
  • C.27.8
  • D.32.5
Correct Answer: 14.76

Let total students = x

Then, 17×x = 768

or x = 5376

Required Percentage = 3160×27×53765376 × 100 = 14.76%

Question 5
The following table shows the proportion of students passed in three different Graduation Streams, namely, Arts, Science and Commerce, from seven different cities A–G, along with the ratio of Males (M) to Females (F) for the three streams among the students. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.The number of males who passed in Commerce from City-F is approximately _______% more than the number of females who passed in Commerce from City-F.(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.31.25
  • B.47.47
  • C.45.45
  • D.42.67
Correct Answer: 45.45

Required Percentage = 511×100 = 45.45

Question 6
What among the following can be correctly claimed in the light of ‘Assessment Rubrics’?A. A tool used to interpret and grade students on the basis of some criterion.B. A means to increase subjective evaluation by the evaluator.C. It ensures transparency and fairness in the marking process.D. It provides an opportunity to set arbitrary standards and guidelines for moderation.E. It is an innovative evaluation system.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, C, and D only
  • B.A, B and C only
  • C.C, D, and E only
  • D.A, C, and E only
Correct Answer: A, C, and E only

Let’s examine each statement in the context of Assessment Rubrics:

A. A tool used to interpret and grade students on the basis of some criterion

 

Correct – This is the basic definition of a rubric. It provides predefined criteria and performance levels for evaluating assignments, projects, etc.

 

B. A means to increase subjective evaluation by the evaluator

Incorrect – Rubrics are actually designed to reduce subjectivity, not increase it. They bring consistency to evaluation.

 

C. It ensures transparency and fairness in the marking process

Correct – Because criteria and expectations are clearly defined, students know what is expected, and teachers follow the same standards for all.

 

D. It provides an opportunity to set arbitrary standards and guidelines for moderation

Incorrect – Rubrics aim to avoid arbitrariness by clearly outlining objective and measurable standards.

 

E. It is an innovative evaluation system

Correct – Rubrics are a modern tool in formative and summative assessment practices, promoting clarity and structured feedback.

 

Thus, option (D) is correct.

Question 7
Match List - I with List - II.List - I (Types of Teaching)A. Macro teachingB. Micro teachingC. Station teachingD. Cooperative teachingList - II (Description)(I) A teaching technique especially used in teacher’s pre-service education to train them systematically(II) An approach where the educators divide the content among themselves and students sit with one educator before moving to the other(III) A situation in a classroom where two teachers work on a class together(IV) When a teacher provides instruction to the entire class at one time for an extended period of timeChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(II), B-(III), C-(I), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(IV), B-(II), C-(III), D-(I)
  • C.A-(IV), B-(I), C-(II), D-(III)
  • D.A-(I), B-(II), C-(III), D-(IV)
Correct Answer: A-(IV), B-(I), C-(II), D-(III)

Let’s match each type of teaching with its correct description:

 

A. Macro Teaching → (IV) Instruction to the entire class for an extended period

Macro teaching is traditional full-length classroom teaching, typically used in real teaching scenarios.

 

B. Micro Teaching → (I) Used in teacher’s pre-service education

Micro teaching is a scaled-down, practice teaching technique focusing on specific skills like questioning, reinforcement, etc., used in teacher training.

 

C. Station Teaching → (II) Content is divided among educators and students rotate

In station teaching, teachers split the lesson and students move from one “station” (teacher) to another.

 

D. Cooperative Teaching → (III) Two teachers work together in a class

In cooperative or co-teaching, both teachers share the planning, instruction, and assessment in the same classroom.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option C.

Question 8
What among the following can be ascribed to learning styles?A. It is a way ‘how’ the student learnsB. They are strengths and preferences of the learners for responding to the stimuli in the environmentC. It is ‘What’ the learner learnsD. It is a behavioural pattern developed for any new learningChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A and B only
  • B.A and C only
  • C.A, B, and D only
  • D.B, C, and D only
Correct Answer: A, B, and D only

Let’s examine each statement in relation to the concept of learning styles:

 

A. It is a way ‘how’ the student learns

Correct – Learning styles refer to how learners prefer to process and engage with information (e.g., visual, auditory, kinesthetic). It focuses on the approach, not the content.

 

B. They are strengths and preferences of the learners for responding to the stimuli in the environment

Correct – Learning styles highlight a learner’s preferred mode of interaction with information and their individual strengths, such as being reflective, verbal, or practical.

 

C. It is ‘What’ the learner learns

Incorrect – Learning styles are not about the content or the “what,” but about the process of learning — the “how.”

 

D. It is a behavioural pattern developed for any new learning.

Incorrect – Learning styles are more about innate or preferred cognitive approaches, not acquired behavioral patterns like habits.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 9
What can be correctly inferred about the Traditional Teaching Method and Support System?A. Teacher is responsible to control the class and teach with the usage of blackboardB. It is also known as ‘Back-to Basics’ System.C. The student carries the responsibilities to use self-learning tools.D. Virtual labs are used as one of the Teaching tools.E. Charts, Maps and Textbooks are the prime resources and handouts are used by the teacherChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.B and C only
  • B.A, B and D only
  • C.D and E only
  • D.A, B, and E only
Correct Answer: A, B, and E only

Let’s evaluate each statement based on the Traditional Teaching Method and Support System:

 

A. Teacher is responsible to control the class and teach with the usage of blackboard

Correct – Traditional teaching is teacher-centered, with the teacher leading instruction using tools like the blackboard.

 

B. It is also known as ‘Back-to Basics’ System.

Correct – Traditional teaching focuses on fundamental skills like reading, writing, and arithmetic, hence called "Back-to-Basics."

 

C. The student carries the responsibilities to use self-learning tools.

Incorrect – This is more aligned with modern, learner-centered methods. Traditional teaching places less emphasis on self-directed learning.

 

D. Virtual labs are used as one of the Teaching tools.

Incorrect – Virtual labs are a feature of modern ICT-based teaching, not traditional methods.

 

E. Charts, Maps and Textbooks are the prime resources and handouts are used by the teacher

Correct – These are common instructional aids in traditional classrooms.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 10
What among the following is incorrect about SWAYAM Prabha?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.It was launched by Sri Abul Kalam Azad.
  • B.Satellite is used for telecasting the educational contents through DTH channels.
  • C.The web portal of SWAYAM Prabha is maintained by INFLIBNET, Gujarat.
  • D.The contents for SWAYAM Prabha are provided by NPTEL, IITs, UGC, CEC and IGNOU.
Correct Answer: It was launched by Sri Abul Kalam Azad.

Let’s assess each statement:

 

(A) It was launched by Sri Abul Kalam Azad

Incorrect – SWAYAM Prabha was not launched by Maulana Abul Kalam Azad, who passed away in 1958. It is a recent initiative of the Ministry of Education, Government of India, launched in 2017 to support digital learning via DTH channels.

 

(B) Satellite is used for telecasting the educational contents through DTH channels

Correct – SWAYAM Prabha uses GSAT-15 satellite to broadcast 34 DTH channels, each dedicated to different subjects.

 

(C) The web portal of SWAYAM Prabha is maintained by INFLIBNET, Gujarat

Correct – The Information and Library Network (INFLIBNET) Centre, located in Gujarat, manages the online content delivery system for SWAYAM Prabha.

 

(D) The contents for SWAYAM Prabha are provided by NPTEL, IITs, UGC, CEC and IGNOU

Correct – These institutions are key contributors of high-quality educational content for SWAYAM Prabha channels.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (A).

Question 11
A researcher decides to tell participants something false about a research session in order to mislead them. The researcher is using:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Naturalistic observation
  • B.Role playing
  • C.Active deception
  • D.Dehoaxing
Correct Answer: Active deception

The researcher in the scenario is deliberately misleading participants by telling them something false about the research session. This practice is known as active deception, where researchers provide participants with false or misleading information to study their reactions or behavior in a particular context, without the participants being aware of the true nature of the research.

(A) Naturalistic observation involves observing subjects in their natural environment without any manipulation or interference from the researcher.

(B) Role playing involves participants acting out certain scenarios or roles, usually as part of an experimental design.

(D) Dehoaxing refers to revealing the true nature of the study to participants after the research is completed, to clear up any misconceptions or deceptions.

Question 12
Which of the following criteria in research relates mainly to the issue of causality?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Transferability
  • B.Measurement validity
  • C.External validity
  • D.Internal validity
Correct Answer: Internal validity

In research, causality refers to the relationship between cause and effect. The criterion that is most closely related to causality is internal validity.

(A) Transferability refers to how well the findings of a study can be applied to other settings or groups, which is more about the generalizability of qualitative research.

(B) Measurement validity refers to the accuracy of the measurement tools used in the study, ensuring that they measure what they are intended to measure.

(C) External validity relates to the extent to which the results of a study can be generalized beyond the specific conditions or participants of the study.

(D) Internal validity refers to the extent to which a study accurately measures the causal relationship between variables, ensuring that the observed effects are due to the manipulation of the independent variable and not other factors.

Question 13
Arrange the data sets with following pairs of mean (x̄) and standard deviation (σ) in increasing order of their coefficient of variation.A. x̄ = 8, σ = 1.7B. x̄ = 11, σ = 2.2C. x̄ = 15, σ = 3.6D. x̄ = 16, σ = 3Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, D, C
  • B.B, D, C, A
  • C.C, B, D, A
  • D.D, B, A, C
Correct Answer: D, B, A, C

The coefficient of variation (CV) is a measure of the relative variability of a data set, calculated by the formula:

Thus, the correct answer is (D) D, B, A, C.

Question 14
According to UGC regulations 2018 on plagiarism, which of the following similarities constitute Level - 1 plagiarism?A. 12%B. 42%C. 28%D. 56%E. 37%Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.B, C and D only
  • C.A, C and E only
  • D.B, C and E only
Correct Answer: A, C and E only

According to the UGC Regulations on Plagiarism (2018), Level 1 plagiarism refers to a percentage of similarity that falls within a specific range, which typically includes a threshold of up to 40% similarity.

Question 15
Match List - I with List - II.List - I (Type of variable)A. NominalB. OrdinalC. IntervalD. RatioList - II (Example)(I) Satisfaction level(II) Weight(III) Ethnicity(IV) Year of deathChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(I), B-(II), C-(III), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(I), B-(III), C-(II), D-(IV)
  • C.A-(III), B-(IV), C-(II), D-(I)
  • D.A-(III), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(II)
Correct Answer: A-(III), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(II)

Let's carefully reanalyze the variables and their corresponding examples:

 

A. Nominal: A nominal variable is a categorical variable without any order or ranking. (III) Ethnicity fits this category, as ethnicity consists of categories (e.g., African, Asian, Caucasian) without a specific order.

 

B. Ordinal: An ordinal variable has categories with a meaningful order, but the distances between categories are not necessarily equal. (I) Satisfaction level fits this category, as satisfaction can be ranked (e.g., very satisfied, satisfied, neutral, dissatisfied), but the intervals between the ranks are not guaranteed to be equal.

 

C. Interval: An interval variable has ordered categories with equal distances between them, but no true zero point. (IV) Year of death fits this category, as the years can be ordered and the intervals between them are meaningful, but the "year 0" is arbitrary and does not imply a true absence.

 

D. Ratio: A ratio variable has ordered categories with equal distances and a true zero point. (II) Weight fits this category, as weight has a true zero point (no weight means zero) and the differences between weights are meaningful.

 

Thus, the correct answer is (B) A-(III), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(II).

Question 16
Which is the first newspaper published in India in modern times?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Hickey’s Bengal Gazzette
  • B.India Gazette
  • C.Samvad Kaumudi
  • D.Udant Martand
Correct Answer: Hickey’s Bengal Gazzette

Hickey's Bengal Gazette was the first newspaper published in modern India. It was founded by James Augustus Hickey in 1780 in Kolkata (then Calcutta).

Question 17
Which of the following cannot be treated as the folk tradition of communication in India?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Cinema
  • B.Jatra
  • C.Ramleela
  • D.Kumbh Mela
Correct Answer: Cinema

The correct answer is option (A).

 

Cinema is a modern mass media form of communication that uses technology and is produced commercially. It does not originate from folk culture or traditional oral performances.

Question 18
Which of the following best describes the purpose of using the '5 Ws' in communication?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.To ensure the message is delivered using technical language and complex structure
  • B.To analyse and communicate key details such as content, participants, timing, location, and intent
  • C.To reduce the need for feedback or interaction from the receiver
  • D.To enhance emotional appeal and persuasive impact through storytelling
Correct Answer: To analyse and communicate key details such as content, participants, timing, location, and intent

The 5 Ws are fundamental questions used in communication, journalism, and investigation to structure information clearly. These are as follows:

 

  • What – What is the message/content to be communicated?

 

  • Who – Who is involved? (Sender and receiver)

 

  • Where – Where is the communication taking place? (Context/location)

 

  • When – When is the message being sent? (Time/timing)

 

  • Why – Why is the communication happening? (Purpose/intention).

 

The '5 Ws' — What, Who, When, Where, Why — help break down and clarify a message by addressing all the essential components of any communication scenario.

Question 19
Three major actions in the process of Communication are:A. ReceivingB. SendingC. ReviewingD. InterpretingE. AnalysingChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.C, D and E only
  • B.A, C and D only
  • C.A, B and D only
  • D.A, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, B and D only

The communication process involves several key actions, but the three major and essential ones are:

 

A. Receiving

This refers to the listener or receiver getting the message. Without reception, communication cannot happen.

 

B. Sending

This is the action taken by the sender to transmit the message — spoken, written, visual, etc.

 

D. Interpreting

After receiving the message, the receiver must interpret or decode it to understand the meaning.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 20
Match List - I with List - II.List - I (Applications)A. InterviewsB. NewspaperC. ClassroomD. MeditationList - II (Communication term)(I) Group Communication(II) Intrapersonal Communication(III) Interpersonal Communication(IV) Mass CommunicationChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(I), B-(III), C-(II), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(II), B-(IV), C-(III), D-(I)
  • C.A-(IV), B-(I), C-(II), D-(III)
  • D.A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II)
Correct Answer: A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II)

The correct answer is option (D) i.e., A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II).

A. Interviews → (III) Interpersonal Communication

Interviews involve direct one-to-one interaction, which is the essence of interpersonal communication.

 

B. Newspaper → (IV) Mass Communication

Newspapers deliver information to a large, dispersed audience, which defines mass communication.

 

C. Classroom → (I) Group Communication

Classroom communication usually involves a teacher addressing a group of students, fitting under group communication.

 

D. Meditation → (II) Intrapersonal Communication

Meditation is a self-reflective internal process, which is a classic example of intrapersonal communication.

Question 21
A person sold an item at a loss of 7%. Had he sold the item at a gain of 7.5%, he would have received Rs. 87 more than his selling price. The cost price of the item is:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Rs. 500
  • B.Rs. 550
  • C.Rs. 600
  • D.Rs. 650
Correct Answer: Rs. 600

Let CP = x

SP = 0.93x

If item sold at 7.5% gain, SP = 1.075x

Then, 1.075x – 0.93x = 87

or 0.145x = 87

or x = 600

Question 22
In a race of 500 m run, A beats B by 20 m and C by 80 m. If B and C are running another race of 100 m with exactly same speed as before, then by how many meters will B beat C?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.10.0 m
  • B.8.5 m
  • C.15.0 m
  • D.12.5 m
Correct Answer: 12.5 m

In relation of A

B’s speed = 480500 = 0.96

C’s speed = 420500 = 0.84

Ratio of C and B speed = 0.840.96 = 78

When B runs 100 m, C will run = 100 × 78 87.5m

Difference = 100 – 87.5 = 12.5

Question 23
Arrange the following fractions in increasing order:A. 12/17B. 13/19C. 8/11D. 16/23Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.B, D, A, C
  • B.B, A, C, D
  • C.D, A, B, C
  • D.D, B, C, A
Correct Answer: B, D, A, C

Correct order is B, D, A, C

Question 24
Identify the numbers that occur in the series 1, 7, 17, 31, 49, ..........A. 74B. 95C. 97D. 127E. 161Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, C only
  • B.C, D, E only
  • C.E, B, A only
  • D.C, D, B only
Correct Answer: C, D, E only

The difference is increasing by 4

So, series will be 1, 7, 17, 31, 49, 71, 97, 127, 161, ------

Thus, B is the correct answer.

Question 25
Match List - I with List - II.List - I (Word)A. QUAKEB. OFTENC. PEACHD. DRIVEList - II (Unique Code)(I) KTFUL(II) VHQDU(III) IEYOU(IV) JUYWRChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(I), B-(III), C-(II), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(I), B-(IV), C-(III), D-(II)
  • C.A-(III), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(II)
  • D.A-(IV), B-(II), C-(I), D-(III)
Correct Answer: A-(III), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(II)

A. QUAKE → IEYOU → (III)

B. OFTEN → KTFUL → (I)

C. PEACH → JUYWR → (IV)

D. DRIVE → VHQDU → (II)

Question 26
Identify the pattern of the Argument in the following:“Habits are like a cable. We weave a strand of it everyday and soon it cannot be broken.”(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Causal Argument
  • B.Argument from Analogy
  • C.Argument from Authority
  • D.Argument from Definition
Correct Answer: Argument from Analogy

The statement "Habits are like a cable. We weave a strand of it everyday and soon it cannot be broken" is an example of an Argument from Analogy.

 

Argument from Analogy: This type of argument draws a comparison between two things that are alike in some respects and suggests that because they are similar in some ways, they are likely to be similar in others as well.

 

In this case, the argument is comparing habits to a cable. It suggests that just as a cable becomes strong and unbreakable through the weaving of strands, habits become ingrained and difficult to break through the repeated actions over time.

 

Thus, the correct answer is (B) Argument from Analogy.

Question 27
What in the following can be correctly inferred?“You know how I know animals have souls? Because on an average, the lowest animal is a lot nicer and kinder than most of the human beings that inhabit this Earth.”A. Premise: The lowest animal is a lot nicer and kinder than most human beings that inhabit this Earth.B. Premise: Animals have soulC. It is not an argumentD. Conclusion: The lowest animal is a lot nicer and kinder than most human beings that inhabit this EarthE. Conclusion: Animals have soulChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.B, C and D only
  • B.A, C and E only
  • C.A and E only
  • D.A, D and E only
Correct Answer: A and E only

In this case, the argument involves making a claim about animals having souls based on the premise that "the lowest animal is a lot nicer and kinder than most human beings that inhabit this Earth." The reasoning is flawed, but still an attempt at argumentation.

 

Let’s analyze the options:

 

A. Premise: The lowest animal is a lot nicer and kinder than most human beings that inhabit this Earth. This is a premise used in the argument. It serves as the supporting statement for the conclusion.

 

B. Premise: Animals have soul. This is not stated explicitly as a premise in the argument. Instead, the argument concludes that animals have souls, so it's not an additional premise.

 

C. It is not an argument. This is incorrect because it is an argument; the speaker tries to make a point that animals have souls based on a comparison with human beings.

 

D. Conclusion: The lowest animal is a lot nicer and kinder than most human beings that inhabit this Earth. This is not the conclusion. The premise supports the claim that animals have souls, so this cannot be the conclusion.

 

E. Conclusion: Animals have soul. This is the conclusion drawn from the premises. The speaker is concluding that animals have souls based on the premise about the behavior of animals and humans.

 

So, the correct answer is (C) A and E only.

Question 28
What can be inferred correctly from the following?“No musicians are Greeks. All traders are Musicians. Therefore, no traders are Greeks.”A. It represents figure II of the syllogistic argumentB. It is an EAE moodC. The term ‘Greeks’ is the major termD. The minor term of the conclusion is distributedE. The middle term is undistributedChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.B, C and D only
  • C.D and E only
  • D.A, C and E only
Correct Answer: B, C and D only

It represents figure I of the syllogistic argument and not figure II. The middle term is distributed in the premises (Musicians is distributed in “No musicians are Greeks).

Question 29
Match List - I with List - II.List - I (Forms of Non-existence)A. AnyonyābhāvaB. AtyantābhāvaC. PrāgabhāvaD. PradhvaṁsābhāvaList - II (Representation)(I) Hare’s horn(II) There is non-existence of the jar now(III) This is not that(IV) Temporary absence of a thingChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(II), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(III)
  • B.A-(I), B-(III), C-(II), D-(IV)
  • C.A-(III), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(II)
  • D.A-(IV), B-(II), C-(I), D-(III)
Correct Answer: A-(III), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(II)

The given terms are the part of Nyaya-Vaiśeṣika Philosophy which is one of the 6 orthodox systems of Indian philosophy. They are studied under abhāva-padārtha.

 

A. Anyonyābhāva (Mutual non-existence) → (III) This is not that

It denotes the mutual exclusion of one thing from another. For example, "this is not that" or "a chair is not a table".

 

B. Atyantābhāva (Absolute non-existence) → (I) Hare’s horn

This represents something that never exists anywhere at any time, like a hare's horn — an impossible entity.

 

C. Prāgabhāva (Prior non-existence) → (IV) Temporary absence of a thing

The non-existence of something before it comes into being. For instance, the jar did not exist before it was made.

 

D. Pradhvaṁsābhāva (Posterior non-existence) → (II) There is non-existence of the jar now

The non-existence of something after it has been destroyed. Like, "the jar no longer exists".

Question 30
Among the following which is correct in the context of Śabda Pramāṇa?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.For Sāṁkhya, a word signifies universal
  • B.For Jainas, a word signifies a particular
  • C.For old Nyāya, a word symbolizes universal only
  • D.For Vedantins, a word primarily means the class character of individuals
Correct Answer: For Vedantins, a word primarily means the class character of individuals

Option D is the correct answer.

 

The fourth category of valid knowledge is known as Shabda, Agama, or authoritative verbal testimony. Aapta upadesha, which translates to authoritative statement, constitutes this form of knowledge. It involves the verbal communication or testimony of individuals who are considered trustworthy or authoritative in their respective fields. These individuals, referred to as 'aapta,' impart knowledge that is recognized as reliable and credible. Shabda, or statement, is another term for this type of knowledge.

Question 31
IfLmrepresents a number L in base-M number system, then what will be the value of10716+25716?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.76210
  • B.86210
  • C.96210
  • D.66210
Correct Answer: 86210

10716 is equal to 263 in base 10. 25716 is equal to 599 in base 10. Total is 862.

Question 32
In computer networking, an IP version-6 is ______ times larger than an IP version-4 address.(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.2
  • B.4
  • C.6
  • D.8
Correct Answer: 4

In computer networking, an IP version-6 is ______ times larger than an IP version-4 address.

 

IPv4 Address:

Size = 32 bits

 

IPv6 Address:

Size = 128 bits

 

Now divide: 12832 = 4 times

Question 33
Identify the correct order of the following major technological changes A-D in the development of computers based on first to fourth generation of computers:A. TransistorsB. MicroprocessorC. Vacuum tubesD. Integrated circuitsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, C, D, B
  • B.B, A, C, D
  • C.D, A, C, B
  • D.C, A, D, B
Correct Answer: C, A, D, B

Here’s the correct chronological order of major technological changes across the four generations of computers:

 

C. Vacuum Tubes – Used in First Generation computers (1940s–1950s)

 

A. Transistors – Used in Second Generation computers (1950s–1960s)

 

D. Integrated Circuits (ICs) – Used in Third Generation computers (1960s–1970s)

 

B. Microprocessor – Used in Fourth Generation computers (1970s onwards)

 

This is the technological evolution that defines the four generations. Hence, the correct order is:

 

C → A → D → B Which matches option (D).

Question 34
To record voice narration for your Microsoft PowerPoint presentation, your computer must have:A. Sound cardB. An internet connectionC. SpeakersD. An external video portE. MicrophoneChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, C and E only
  • B.B and D only
  • C.A and E only
  • D.B, C and D only
Correct Answer: A and E only

To record voice narration in Microsoft PowerPoint, your computer must have:

 

A. Sound card – Required to process audio input/output.

 

E. Microphone – Needed to capture your voice.

 

Thus option C is correct.

Question 35
Match List - I with List - II.List - I (Internet Term)A. BlogsB. PodcastsC. TaggingD. WikisList - II (Description)(I) Allows users to create and edit web pages using a browser(II) A type of bookmarking where a user “marks” a webpage or photo using text to describe its contents(III) A series of digital media files(IV) Personal internet journalsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(I), B-(II), C-(III), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II)
  • C.A-(IV), B-(III), C-(II), D-(I)
  • D.A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I)
Correct Answer: A-(IV), B-(III), C-(II), D-(I)

Correct answer is option C.

 

Let’s match each Internet term with its correct description:

 

A. Blogs → (IV) Personal internet journals

Blogs are regularly updated websites or web pages, typically run by an individual or small group, written in an informal or conversational style.

 

B. Podcasts → (III) A series of digital media files

Podcasts are audio or video files available for streaming or download, often released as a series.

 

C. Tagging → (II) A type of bookmarking where a user “marks” a webpage or photo using text to describe its contents

Tagging helps categorize and search content based on user-defined keywords or labels.

 

D. Wikis → (I) Allows users to create and edit web pages using a browser

Wikis are collaborative websites like Wikipedia, where multiple users can create and edit content directly in a browser.

Question 36
The amount of biomass produced by the plants through photosynthesis minus respiration losses in a given time period is known as:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Gross Primary Productivity
  • B.Net Primary Productivity
  • C.Gross Ecological Productivity
  • D.Net Secondary Productivity
Correct Answer: Net Primary Productivity

Correct answer is option B - Net Primary Productivity.

 

Gross Primary Productivity (GPP):

Total amount of energy captured by plants through photosynthesis.

 

Net Primary Productivity (NPP):

The biomass left after plants use some of that energy for respiration.

 

NPP = GPP - Respiration Losses

Question 37
Which among the following fuels produces least amount of soot particles during combustion?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Petrol
  • B.Kerosene
  • C.Diesel
  • D.Compressed Natural Gas (CNG)
Correct Answer: Compressed Natural Gas (CNG)

Correct answer is option D.

 

Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) burns more cleanly than other fossil fuels. It consists mainly of methane (CH₄), which has a simple molecular structure and leads to complete combustion, producing very little soot or particulate matter.

 

In contrast:

  • Diesel produces the most soot due to incomplete combustion and complex hydrocarbons.
  • Kerosene and petrol also produce more soot compared to CNG, though less than diesel.
Question 38
Arrange the following states in ascending order according to their area under forest cover:A. Arunachal PradeshB. ChhattisgarhC. MaharashtraD. OdishaE. Madhya PradeshChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, C, D, B, E
  • B.C, D, B, A, E
  • C.B, A, C, E, D
  • D.D, B, A, E, C
Correct Answer: C, D, B, A, E

The correct order is given below.

 

Maharashtra (C) < Odisha (D) < Chhattisgarh (B) < Arunachal Pradesh (A) < Madhya Pradesh (E).

Question 39
Eye irritation is the common phenomenon during smog. It is mostly caused by:A. FormaldehydeB. Per-oxy Acetyl NitrateC. OzoneD. AcrolinChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.A, B and D only
  • C.C, D and A only
  • D.B, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, B and D only

Eye irritation during smog is mainly caused by certain photochemical pollutants that are strong eye irritants:

 

Formaldehyde (A): It is a volatile organic compound and a common component in smog. It irritates the eyes and respiratory tract.

 

Peroxyacetyl Nitrate (PAN) (B): A major photochemical oxidant found in smog; it is well-known for causing severe eye irritation.

 

Acrolein (D): A potent eye and respiratory irritant found in smoke and smog.

Question 40
Match List - I with List - II.List - I (International Treaties)A. Sendai FrameworkB. Monterry ConsensusC. Beijing DeclarationD. Brundtland ReportList - II (Key Objectives)(I) Equality between men and women(II) Our common future(III) Disaster Risk Reduction(IV) Financing for developmentChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II)
  • B.A-(IV), B-(I), C-(II), D-(III)
  • C.A-(I), B-(II), C-(III), D-(IV)
  • D.A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I)
Correct Answer: A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II)

Let’s match each international treaty with its objective:

 

A. Sendai Framework – (III) Disaster Risk Reduction

 

The Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction (2015–2030) is a UN agreement that focuses on reducing disaster risks and building resilience.

 

B. Monterrey Consensus – (IV) Financing for Development

 

The Monterrey Consensus (2002) emerged from the International Conference on Financing for Development. It focuses on mobilizing financial resources for development, especially in developing countries.

 

C. Beijing Declaration – (I) Equality between men and women

 

The Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action (1995) is a key global policy document on gender equality and women’s empowerment.

 

D. Brundtland Report – (II) Our Common Future

 

The Brundtland Report (1987), titled Our Common Future, introduced the concept of sustainable development and emphasized environmental responsibility for future generations.

Question 41
Arrange the following ancient Indian Institutes from East to West direction:A. TakshashilaB. NalandaC. VikramshilaD. ShardapeethChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, D, C, B
  • B.B, C, A, D
  • C.D, A, B, C
  • D.C, B, D, A
Correct Answer: C, B, D, A

The correct answer is C, B, D, A.

 

Vikramshila – Buddhist University, East of Nalanda, Situated in Bihar, Specialized in Tantric Studies.

 

Nalanda – Situated in Modern-day Bihar, Established by Gupta Emperor Kumaragupta in the 5th century CE.

 

Sharada Peeth is a ruined Hindu temple and ancient centre of learning located in the Neelum Valley of Pakistan-occupied Azad Kashmir.

 

Takshashila – Located in Taxila, Punjab (present-day Pakistan), near the banks of the Indus River; Destroyed in 5th Century.

Question 42
Which of the following universities were set up in 1916?A. Osmania UniversityB. S.N.D.T Women’s UniversityC. Mysore UniversityD. Patna UniversityE. Benaras Hindu UniversityChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.B, C and E only
  • C.B, C and D only
  • D.A, D and E only
Correct Answer: B, C and E only

The Universities setup in 1916 –

  • B. S.N.D.T Women’s University
  • C. Mysore University
  • E. Benaras Hindu University

 

Osmania University – established in April 1917

Patna University – established in 1917.

Question 43
Match List - I with List - II.List - I (Constitutional Provision of Education)A. Women’s EducationB. Education of MinoritiesC. Secular EducationD. Right to EducationList - II (Article)(I) 28(II) 21-A(III) 15 (Part-II)(IV) 29 (Part-III)Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(III), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(II)
  • B.A-(I), B-(II), C-(IV), D-(III)
  • C.A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II)
  • D.A-(I), B-(IV), C-(II), D-(III)
Correct Answer: A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II)

A. Women’s Education – (III) Article 15 (Part II)

 

Article 15 allows the State to make special provisions for women and children, including education. So, women’s education is constitutionally supported under Article 15.

 

B. Education of Minorities – (IV) Article 29 (Part III)

 

Article 29 protects the interests of minorities, allowing them to preserve their language, script, and culture, which includes the right to establish and maintain educational institutions.

 

C. Secular Education – (I) Article 28

 

Article 28 ensures that religious instruction is not imparted in government-funded educational institutions, affirming the secular character of education in India.

 

D. Right to Education – (II) Article 21-A

 

Article 21-A, inserted by the 86th Constitutional Amendment Act (2002), provides free and compulsory education to all children aged 6 to 14 years.

Question 44
Which of the following is known as “One Nation One Student ID” card?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Aadhar card
  • B.Pan card
  • C.APAAR card
  • D.Voter’s ID card
Correct Answer: APAAR card

The Automated Permanent Academic Account Registry (APAAR) is a transformative initiative introduced in alignment with the National Education Policy (NEP) of 2020 and the National Credit and Qualifications Framework (NCrF). It aims to provide a unified and accessible academic experience for students across India by assigning a unique and permanent 12-digit ID to every student, consolidating their academic achievements in one place.

Question 45
According to National Credit Framework (NCrF) the credit level earned after Doctoral degree (Ph.D.) will be:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.7
  • B.8
  • C.9
  • D.10
Correct Answer: 8

National Credit Framework is designed to integrate the credits earned through school education, higher education, vocational, and skill education, and provide lifelong learning opportunities. According to the framework, an academic year will be defined by the number of hours a student puts in and credits will be provided to them accordingly at the end of each academic year.

 

NCrF is a meta-framework that consists of three verticals:

(i) National School Education Qualification Framework (NSEQF)

(ii) National Higher Education Qualification Framework (NHEQF), and

(iii) National Skills Qualification Framework (NSQF)

 

Credit Levels:

  • The NCrF has proposed several levels within this framework ranging from level 1 to level 8.
  • The credit level that can be attained after completion of school education, i.e., grade 5th will be level 1, grade 8th will be level 2, grade 10th will be level 3, and grade 12th will be level 4.
  • Higher education shall be from credit levels of 4.5 to level 8 (8 being Doctoral).
  • The NCrF credit levels for school education are upto level 4, while for higher education
  • For vocational education & training level 1 to level 8.
Question 46
Read the following passage and answer the questions that follow:Odisha has colourful fairs and festivals and are as numerous as the days of the year. The sacred journey of Lord Jagannath with brother Balabhadra and sister Subhadra from the Jagannath Temple to the divine shrine called the Gundicha Temple is known as the Car Festival or the Rath Yatra. On this occasion, the deities adorn three chariots named Nandigosha, Taladhwaja and Darpadalana respectively. They stay in the divine shrine for nine days and then return to the Jagannath Temple. This journey is called Bahuda Jatra. This grand festival of Odisha is visited by lakhs of devotees from India and abroad who pull the sacred chariots from the Jagannath Temple to the Gundicha Temple and back on a broad road called Badadanda. The festival begins from the second day of Shukla Paksha (bright half) in the month of Ashadha (June-July) every year. This festival of Lord Jagannath, who is worshipped as the Lord of the Universe, is celebrated not only in Puri, but also in many other places in India and abroad.Whereas the festival of Lord Jagannath is celebrated in many places in India and abroad, it is primarily associated with which city?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Bhuvaneswar
  • B.Puri
  • C.Cuttack
  • D.Konark
Correct Answer: Puri

The passage clearly states:

“This festival of Lord Jagannath... is celebrated not only in Puri, but also in many other places..."

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 47
Read the following passage and answer the questions that follow:Odisha has colourful fairs and festivals and are as numerous as the days of the year. The sacred journey of Lord Jagannath with brother Balabhadra and sister Subhadra from the Jagannath Temple to the divine shrine called the Gundicha Temple is known as the Car Festival or the Rath Yatra. On this occasion, the deities adorn three chariots named Nandigosha, Taladhwaja and Darpadalana respectively. They stay in the divine shrine for nine days and then return to the Jagannath Temple. This journey is called Bahuda Jatra. This grand festival of Odisha is visited by lakhs of devotees from India and abroad who pull the sacred chariots from the Jagannath Temple to the Gundicha Temple and back on a broad road called Badadanda. The festival begins from the second day of Shukla Paksha (bright half) in the month of Ashadha (June-July) every year. This festival of Lord Jagannath, who is worshipped as the Lord of the Universe, is celebrated not only in Puri, but also in many other places in India and abroad.What are the names of the deities who accompany Lord Jagannath in the Rath Yatra?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Subhadra and Balabhadra
  • B.Balabhadra and Shiva
  • C.Subhadra and Hidimba
  • D.Balabhadra and Hidimba
Correct Answer: Subhadra and Balabhadra

From the passage:

 

"The sacred journey of Lord Jagannath with brother Balabhadra and sister Subhadra from the Jagannath Temple to the divine shrine..."

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (A).

Question 48
Read the following passage and answer the questions that follow:Odisha has colourful fairs and festivals and are as numerous as the days of the year. The sacred journey of Lord Jagannath with brother Balabhadra and sister Subhadra from the Jagannath Temple to the divine shrine called the Gundicha Temple is known as the Car Festival or the Rath Yatra. On this occasion, the deities adorn three chariots named Nandigosha, Taladhwaja and Darpadalana respectively. They stay in the divine shrine for nine days and then return to the Jagannath Temple. This journey is called Bahuda Jatra. This grand festival of Odisha is visited by lakhs of devotees from India and abroad who pull the sacred chariots from the Jagannath Temple to the Gundicha Temple and back on a broad road called Badadanda. The festival begins from the second day of Shukla Paksha (bright half) in the month of Ashadha (June-July) every year. This festival of Lord Jagannath, who is worshipped as the Lord of the Universe, is celebrated not only in Puri, but also in many other places in India and abroad.The sacred journey of Lord Jagannath is traditionally undertaken onward to which divine shrine?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Jagannath Temple
  • B.Subhadra Temple
  • C.Balabhadra Temple
  • D.Gundicha Temple
Correct Answer: Gundicha Temple

The passage states:

 

"The sacred journey of Lord Jagannath with brother Balabhadra and sister Subhadra from the Jagannath Temple to the divine shrine called the Gundicha Temple is known as the Car Festival or the Rath Yatra."

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 49
Read the following passage and answer the questions that follow:Odisha has colourful fairs and festivals and are as numerous as the days of the year. The sacred journey of Lord Jagannath with brother Balabhadra and sister Subhadra from the Jagannath Temple to the divine shrine called the Gundicha Temple is known as the Car Festival or the Rath Yatra. On this occasion, the deities adorn three chariots named Nandigosha, Taladhwaja and Darpadalana respectively. They stay in the divine shrine for nine days and then return to the Jagannath Temple. This journey is called Bahuda Jatra. This grand festival of Odisha is visited by lakhs of devotees from India and abroad who pull the sacred chariots from the Jagannath Temple to the Gundicha Temple and back on a broad road called Badadanda. The festival begins from the second day of Shukla Paksha (bright half) in the month of Ashadha (June-July) every year. This festival of Lord Jagannath, who is worshipped as the Lord of the Universe, is celebrated not only in Puri, but also in many other places in India and abroad.The Car Festival is conducted on a broad road that is called _________.(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Darpadalana
  • B.Ashadha
  • C.Badadanda
  • D.Taladhwaja
Correct Answer: Badadanda

From the passage:

 

"...devotees from India and abroad who pull the sacred chariots from the Jagannath Temple to the Gundicha Temple and back on a broad road called Badadanda."

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 50
Read the following passage and answer the questions that follow:Odisha has colourful fairs and festivals and are as numerous as the days of the year. The sacred journey of Lord Jagannath with brother Balabhadra and sister Subhadra from the Jagannath Temple to the divine shrine called the Gundicha Temple is known as the Car Festival or the Rath Yatra. On this occasion, the deities adorn three chariots named Nandigosha, Taladhwaja and Darpadalana respectively. They stay in the divine shrine for nine days and then return to the Jagannath Temple. This journey is called Bahuda Jatra. This grand festival of Odisha is visited by lakhs of devotees from India and abroad who pull the sacred chariots from the Jagannath Temple to the Gundicha Temple and back on a broad road called Badadanda. The festival begins from the second day of Shukla Paksha (bright half) in the month of Ashadha (June-July) every year. This festival of Lord Jagannath, who is worshipped as the Lord of the Universe, is celebrated not only in Puri, but also in many other places in India and abroad.What is the name assigned to the journey wherein the deities return to the Jagannath Temple after nine days?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Rath Yatra
  • B.Wapsi Yatra
  • C.Maha Yatra
  • D.Bahuda Jatra
Correct Answer: Bahuda Jatra

The passage states:

 

"They stay in the divine shrine for nine days and then return to the Jagannath Temple. This journey is called Bahuda Jatra."

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Quiz Attempt #119720

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of population in five different age groups for five different cities A–E. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Note: a
  • A.21120
  • B.24280
  • C.23680
  • D.19350
Correct Answer: 21120

Let x be the total population in city A.

Then x = 31680.24 = 132000

Population age >60 in city A = 132000 × 0.16 = 21120

Question 2
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of population in five different age groups for five different cities A–E. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Note: a
  • A.60
  • B.75
  • C.90
  • D.120
Correct Answer: 120

Required percentage = 16200162000.18×0.15×100

= 120%

Question 3
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of population in five different age groups for five different cities A–E. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Note: a
  • A.2.4 lakh
  • B.2.8 lakh
  • C.3.2 lakh
  • D.4.8 lakh
Correct Answer: 2.8 lakh

Total population = 240000.15+ 240000.20

= 1.6 lakhs + 1.2 lakh

= 2.8 lakh

Question 4
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of population in five different age groups for five different cities A–E. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Note: a
  • A.2:3
  • B.3:4
  • C.4:5
  • D.5:6
Correct Answer: 3:4

Required ratio = 172800.24211200.22 = 34 = 3 : 4

Question 5
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of population in five different age groups for five different cities A–E. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Note: a
  • A.47.24
  • B.49.67
  • C.52.34
  • D.57.5
Correct Answer: 52.34

City-E in the age group of (0,13] = 130000 × 0.18 = 23400

City-B in the age group of (0,13] = 96000 × 0.16 = 15360

Required ratio = 23400-1536015360×100 = 52.34%

Question 6
Which of the following teaching techniques do not represent modern and ICT based teaching method.A. Recitation and MemorizationB. Flipped ClassroomC. Mind mapsD. Chalk and Talk MethodE. GamificationChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.B and C Only
  • B.C and D Only
  • C.A and D Only
  • D.D and E Only
Correct Answer: A and D Only

Let’s evaluate each option in terms of modern and ICT-based teaching methods:

 

A. Recitation and Memorization – This is a traditional technique focused on rote learning, not involving any digital tools or interactive ICT-based strategies. Not modern/ICT-based

 

B. Flipped Classroom – A modern teaching method where students learn content online at home and do activities in class. It uses videos, LMS, and online resources. ICT-based

 

C. Mind Maps – Though mind maps can be drawn on paper, modern versions often use software like XMind or MindMeister, making them part of ICT tools. Modern/ICT-based

 

D. Chalk and Talk Method – A classic lecture method using a blackboard and chalk. It lacks interactivity and digital components. Not modern/ICT-based

 

E. Gamification – Involves applying game-like elements in learning, often through apps and digital platforms. ICT-based

 

Hence, A (Recitation and Memorization) and D (Chalk and Talk) are not modern or ICT-based methods.

Thus, the correct answer is option (C) i.e., A and D Only.

Question 7
Match the List–I with List–IIList–I (Concept)A. Academic yearB. Credit PointC. CreditD. CourseList–II (Description)I. A unit by which the course work is measured. It defines the number of hours of instruction required per weekII. Papers taught under the programme duly defining the learning objectives and outcomesIII. Two consecutive (one odd and one even) semestersIV. The product of grade point and number of credits for a courseChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-III, B-II, C-IV, D-I
  • B.A-IV, B-I, C-III, D-II
  • C.A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II
  • D.A-II, B-III, C-IV, D-I
Correct Answer: A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II

Let’s match each item correctly:

 

A. Academic year → III. Two consecutive (one odd and one even) semesters

This is the standard definition of an academic year in most education systems.

 

B. Credit Point → IV. The product of grade point and number of credits for a course

Credit Point = Grade Point × Credits (used for calculating SGPA/CGPA).

 

C. Credit → I. A unit by which the course work is measured. It defines the number of hours of instruction required per week

For example, a 3-credit course typically means 3 hours of instruction per week.

 

D. Course → II. Papers taught under the programme duly defining the learning objectives and outcomes

Each "course" is a subject/paper in the curriculum with specific objectives.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C), i.e., A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II.

Question 8
What among the following cannot be treated as the role of a teacher?A. To be strict and fair but not harshB. Openly criticize colleagues in public, especially in front of studentsC. Hard workingD. Motivates students and encourages themE. Reports theories and content but avoids explanationChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A and B Only
  • B.A, C and D Only
  • C.B, C and D Only
  • D.B and E Only
Correct Answer: B and E Only

Let’s assess each statement based on what is expected from a professional teacher:

 

A. To be strict and fair but not harsh

This is a valid role of a teacher. A teacher should maintain discipline (strict), be fair in judgments, and avoid being harsh.

 

B. Openly criticize colleagues in public, especially in front of students

This is not acceptable professional behaviour. It undermines the team and affects students’ respect for the teaching community.

 

C. Hard working

A teacher must be dedicated and sincere — a desirable role.

 

D. Motivates students and encourages them

Clearly a core role of a teacher.

 

E. Reports theories and content but avoids explanation

This is not desirable in a teacher. Just reading without explaining defeats the purpose of teaching.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D), i.e., B and E only.

Question 9
Match the List–I with List–IIList–I (Jackson's learning style)A. High sensation seekerB. Goal oriented achieversC. Emotionally Intelligent AchieverD. Conscientious AchieverList–II (Description)I. Responsible, rational learners, endowed with an urge to explore the world so that positive goals can be achievedII. Learns from their mistakes, possess a scientific, detached and autonomous learning style, processes information in an emotionally intelligent-mannerIII. Gets involved in new challenging activitiesIV. One who sets learning goal which are generally hard and specific and has confidence to achieve the goalsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-II, B-III, C-I, D-IV
  • B.A-III, B-IV, C-II, D-I
  • C.A-IV, B-I, C-III, D-II
  • D.A-I, B-III, C-IV, D-II
Correct Answer: A-III, B-IV, C-II, D-I

Let’s go through each pair:

A. High Sensation Seeker → III. Gets involved in new challenging activities

High sensation seekers are adventurous, seek stimulation, and are naturally drawn to challenging or novel experiences.

 

B. Goal Oriented Achievers → IV. One who sets learning goals which are generally hard and specific and has confidence to achieve the goals

These learners set clear goals and are motivated by achievement; they show high self-efficacy.

 

C. Emotionally Intelligent Achiever → II. Learns from their mistakes, possess a scientific, detached and autonomous learning style, processes information in an emotionally intelligent-manner

These learners are self-aware, manage emotions, and adapt learning styles accordingly.

 

D. Conscientious Achiever → I. Responsible, rational learners, endowed with an urge to explore the world so that positive goals can be achieved

These individuals are disciplined, methodical, and driven by purpose and responsibility.

Question 10
Which of the following are correct in the context of Artificial Intelligence as one of the innovations in the evaluation system?A. It is a software system used for automated scoringB. ‘AI’ technique is applied to learn how an instructor grades a problem/responseC. It is the final authority about the student's performanceD. The instructor evaluates a sample set of students’ responses and ‘AI’ system creates a computer model incorporating rules inferredE. Presently, most of the higher educational institutions in the country employ ‘AI’ based evaluation systemChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A and B Only
  • B.A, B and C Only
  • C.C, D and E Only
  • D.A, B and D Only
Correct Answer: A, B and D Only

Let’s analyze each statement in the context of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in evaluation systems:

 

A. It is a software system used for automated scoring

Correct – AI can automatically evaluate answers, especially in MCQs, short answers, and even essays through natural language processing.

 

B. ‘AI’ technique is applied to learn how an instructor grades a problem/response

Correct – This refers to machine learning, where AI is trained using human-evaluated responses to predict or replicate the grading pattern.

 

C. It is the final authority about the student's performance

Incorrect – AI is used as a support tool, but the final authority remains with the instructor, especially in high-stakes assessments. AI cannot override human judgment entirely.

 

D. The instructor evaluates a sample set of students’ responses and ‘AI’ system creates a computer model incorporating rules inferred

Correct – This is how supervised learning works in AI-based evaluation systems. A model is trained on teacher-graded responses.

 

E. Presently, most of the higher educational institutions in the country employ ‘AI’ based evaluation system

Incorrect – While AI is emerging, most institutions in India still rely on manual or traditional evaluation methods. AI adoption is limited and not yet widespread.

Thus, the correct answer is option (D), i.e., A, B and D only.

Question 11
The process of telling research participants of any deception or ruses used in a study, is known as:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Active deception
  • B.Passive deception
  • C.Dehoaxing
  • D.Desensitization
Correct Answer: Dehoaxing

The process of informing research participants about any deception or ruses used during a study is known as dehoaxing.

(A) Active deception involves deliberately misleading participants during the research without their knowledge.

(B) Passive deception involves withholding information from participants, but not actively providing false information.

(C) Dehoaxing is the correct term, referring to the process of revealing the true nature of the study to participants after the study has been completed, especially in cases where deception was used.

(D) Desensitization refers to the process of reducing the emotional response of participants to certain stimuli or experiences during the study.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is (C) Dehoaxing.

Question 12
In qualitative research, which of the following criteria is concerned with the question ______ do the findings apply to other contexts?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Transferability
  • B.Credibility
  • C.Internal validity
  • D.Confirmability
Correct Answer: Transferability

In qualitative research, the criterion concerned with the question "Do the findings apply to other contexts?" is (A) Transferability.

(A) Transferability refers to the extent to which the findings of a qualitative study can be applied or generalized to other settings, contexts, or groups. It is about the applicability of the study's findings in different circumstances.

(B) Credibility relates to the trustworthiness and believability of the findings, ensuring that the study accurately reflects the experiences or perspectives it aims to represent.

(C) Internal validity is more applicable to quantitative research, and it refers to the degree to which a study accurately measures the relationship between the variables, without interference from other factors.

(D) Confirmability refers to the degree to which the results of the study can be corroborated or verified by others, ensuring that the findings are based on the data rather than the researcher's biases.

 

Thus, the correct answer is (A) Transferability.

Question 13
Arrange the datasets with following pairs of mean (x̄) and standard deviation (σ) in increasing order of their coefficient of variation.A. x̄ = 14 , σ = 2.8B. x̄ = 9 , σ = 1.5C. x̄ = 12 , σ = 2.1D. x̄ = 8 , σ = 1.2Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.B, C, D, A
  • C.D, B, C, A
  • D.C, D, A, B
Correct Answer: D, B, C, A

To determine the coefficient of variation (CV) for each dataset, we use the formula:

 

Therefore, the correct answer is (C) D, B, C, A.

Question 14
According to UGC regulations 2018 on plagiarism a faculty will be denied two successive annual increments for which of the following similarities in research publications?A. 42%B. 58%C. 76%D. 62%E. 52%Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B and E Only
  • B.B, C and D Only
  • C.A, B, D and E Only
  • D.C and D Only
Correct Answer: C and D Only

According to the UGC Regulations 2018 on plagiarism, a faculty member will be denied two successive annual increments if their research publication has a similarity percentage above 60%.

Let's analyze the given options:

A. 42%: This is below the 60% threshold, so it does not qualify.

B. 58%: This is also below the 60% threshold, so it does not qualify.

C. 76%: This is above the 60% threshold, so it qualifies.

D. 62%: This is above the 60% threshold, so it qualifies.

E. 52%: This is below the 60% threshold, so it does not qualify.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is (D) C and D Only, as both 76% and 62% exceed the 60% threshold and would result in the faculty being denied two successive annual increments.

Question 15
Match the List–I with List–IIList–I (Type of variable)A. NominalB. OrdinalC. IntervalD. RatioList–II (Example)I. Happiness levelII. HeightIII. Blood groupIV. Year of birthChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV
  • B.A-II, B-III, C-IV, D-I
  • C.A-III, B-I, C-IV, D-II
  • D.A-IV, B-III, C-I, D-II
Correct Answer: A-III, B-I, C-IV, D-II

Let's match the types of variables with their corresponding examples based on the characteristics of each type:

 

A. Nominal: A nominal variable involves categories that have no particular order or ranking. (III) Blood group is a nominal variable because blood groups (A, B, AB, O) are distinct categories with no inherent ranking.

 

B. Ordinal: An ordinal variable has categories with a meaningful order, but the intervals between the categories are not necessarily equal.
