(I) Happiness level fits this category because happiness can be ranked (e.g., very happy, happy, neutral, unhappy), but the differences between the ranks are not necessarily equal.

 

C. Interval: An interval variable has ordered categories with equal distances between them, but no true zero point. (IV) Year of birth fits this category because years can be ordered and the intervals between them are meaningful, but the "year 0" does not represent the absence of time.

 

D. Ratio: A ratio variable has ordered categories with equal distances and a true zero point. (II) Height fits this category because height has a true zero (i.e., zero height means no height) and the differences between heights are meaningful.

 

Thus, the correct answer is (C) A-III, B-I, C-IV, D-II.

Question 16
First printing press in India was established at:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Goa
  • B.Kerala
  • C.Tamil Nadu
  • D.Bengal
Correct Answer: Goa

The first Printing Press was established in Goa in September, 1556 by Jesuit Missionaries and it functioned in the colegio de Sao Paulo at Old Goa. Thereafter, due to its inactivity, the same was shifted to the Major Seminary at Rachol, Salcete, in 1616 and it functioned there upto 1660.

Question 17
The main purpose of establishing Television in India at the initial stage was:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.News
  • B.Entertainment
  • C.Education and awareness among the rural population
  • D.Scientific development
Correct Answer: Education and awareness among the rural population

The early broadcasts under the "Television Instructional Programmes" focused on school education, community development, and agricultural awareness. Hence, the main purpose at the initial stage was education and awareness among the rural population, not entertainment or news.

Question 18
Arrange the sequence the 5 Cs (Elements) of communication:A. CompassionateB. CuriousC. CompellingD. ConciseE. ClearChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B, C, D and E
  • B.B, A, C, D and E
  • C.E, D, C, B and A
  • D.D, E, C, A and B
Correct Answer: E, D, C, B and A

The correct answer is option (C).

The Correct Sequence is as follows:

E (Clear) → D (Concise) → C (Compelling) → B (Curious) → A (Compassionate)

 

The 5 Cs of Effective Communication (in logical sequence):

  • Clear – The message should be easy to understand and free of ambiguity.
  • Concise – Keep it brief, avoiding unnecessary words or repetition.
  • Compelling – The message should capture attention and engage the audience.

 

  • Curious – Invite questions, show openness, and be willing to explore more.
  • Compassionate – Show empathy, understanding, and sensitivity in tone and content.
Question 19
Basic factors of listening are:A. Self interestB. SpeakerC. FactsD. Style of speakingE. AtmosphereChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B and D Only
  • B.A, C and E Only
  • C.B, C and E Only
  • D.B, D and E Only
Correct Answer: A, B and D Only

The basic factors of effective listening relate to both external and internal elements that affect how a listener receives and processes information.

 

Let’s evaluate each:

 

A. Self-interest –

Self-interest is treated as a motivating factor that determines attention and receptivity. A listener is more engaged when the topic aligns with their own interest or need.

 

B. Speaker –

The speaker's clarity, tone, and delivery impact the listener’s understanding. The credibility and articulation of the speaker matter greatly.

 

C. Facts –

Facts are part of content, not a factor of listening. Listening involves more than just identifying facts—it involves interpreting tone, emotion, and intent.

 

D. Style of speaking –

The speaker’s style (e.g., tone, pace, modulation) influences listener engagement and comprehension.

 

E. Atmosphere –

Atmosphere is not a basic factor for listening because it is an external condition, not an inherent element of the listening process itself.

Question 20
Match the List-I with List-IIList-I (Mass Media)A. FMB. NewspaperC. TV ChannelD. InternetList-II (Example)I. The TribuneII. Rediff.comIII. Radio MircheeIV. CNBCChoose the correct answer.(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-III, B-II, C-I, D-IV
  • B.A-III, B-I, C-IV, D-II
  • C.A-I, B-II, C-IV, D-III
  • D.A-II, B-I, C-III, D-IV
Correct Answer: A-III, B-I, C-IV, D-II

The correct answer is option (B), i.e., A-III, B-I, C-IV, D-II.

Question 21
The cost price of two articles is same, one of them is sold at a profit of 13% while the other one is sold at a profit of 19%. If the difference between their selling price is Rs. 126, the cost price of each article is:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Rs.1800
  • B.Rs.1900
  • C.Rs.2000
  • D.Rs.2100
Correct Answer: Rs.2100

Let CP = x

1.19x – 1.13x = 126

or x = 2100

Question 22
A ship is approaching towards a shore, when it is 32 miles from the shore, a plane having speed 15 times that of the ship is sent to deliver supplies. How far from the sea shore does the sea plane catch up with the ship?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.30 miles
  • B.25 miles
  • C.15 miles
  • D.10 miles
Correct Answer: 30 miles

Let x be the speed of ship

And the plane meets the ship at distance ‘d’ from the shore.

Then, d15x = 32-dx

or d = 30

Question 23
Arrange the following fractions in increasing order–A. 7/11B. 11/17C. 9/13D. 13/21Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.A, D, B, C
  • C.D, A, B, C
  • D.B, D, C, A
Correct Answer: D, A, B, C

The correct order will be D, A, B, C

Question 24
Identify the numbers that occur in the given series:0, 3, 10, 21, 36,........A. 55B. 78C. 99D. 105E. 136Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B, C and D Only
  • B.B, C and E Only
  • C.C, D, E and A Only
  • D.D, E, A and B Only
Correct Answer: D, E, A and B Only

0, 3, 10, 21, 36, 55, 78, 105, 136... will be the extended series.

Question 25
Match the List–I with List–IIList–I (Word)A. QUAKEB. OFTENC. PEACHD. DRIVEList–II (Unique code)I. QDBBIII. EQJUFIII. RTBJFIV. PEUDOChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV
  • B.A-II, B-III, C-IV, D-I
  • C.A-IV, B-I, C-II, D-III
  • D.A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II
Correct Answer: A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II

Q → R

U → T

A → B

K → J

E → F

Similarly. We can check for others.

Question 26
What can be correctly claimed about the following?“I ate because I was hungry”(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.It is an argument.
  • B.It is a Non-argument
  • C.It is a non-argument, it's an Explanation
  • D.It is a non-argument, it's an Illustration
Correct Answer: It is a non-argument, it's an Explanation

The statement "I ate because I was hungry" is not an argument, but rather an explanation. In an explanation, the speaker is providing a reason or justification for why something occurred, but it does not present a claim that is supported by evidence or reasoning aimed at proving something.

Argument: Involves presenting reasons or evidence to support a conclusion.

Explanation: Offers a reason or cause for something happening, but does not attempt to prove anything.

Question 27
Name the fallacy committed in the following:“All the textbooks are books intended for careful study. Some reference books are books intended for careful study. Therefore, some reference books are textbooks”(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Fallacy of Illicit Minor
  • B.Fallacy of Illicit Major
  • C.Undistributed Middle
  • D.Fallacy of four terms
Correct Answer: Undistributed Middle

The middle term in the argument is "books intended for careful study". This term is not distributed in either of the premises. Hence we have fallacy of Undistributed Middle.

Question 28
Identify the fallacy committed in the following:“Ford cars are lemons, I have owned two and they gave me nothing but trouble”.(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Inappropriate appeal to authority
  • B.False alternative
  • C.No fallacy
  • D.Hasty Generalization
Correct Answer: Hasty Generalization

The fallacy committed in the statement "Ford cars are lemons, I have owned two and they gave me nothing but trouble" is Hasty Generalization.

 

Hasty Generalization: This occurs when a conclusion is drawn based on a small or unrepresentative sample size. In this case, the speaker is making a general statement about all Ford cars (that they are lemons) based on the experience with only two cars. Two cars are not enough to make a broad generalization about the quality of all Ford cars.

Question 29
Which of the following is incorrect claim in the context of Vyapti?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.For Cārvākas, it is possible to ascertain that smoke is invariably and universally attended with fire all the time
  • B.For Buddhists, the universal relation between smoke and fire can be ascertained even without examining all the possible cases
  • C.For Vedantins, Vyāpti between smoke and fire is known to co-exist and at the same time it is never known not to accompany smoke
  • D.For Naiyayikas, it is neither easy nor necessary for the formation of a universal proposition to ascertain any relation of causality or identity between the two phenomenon
Correct Answer: For Cārvākas, it is possible to ascertain that smoke is invariably and universally attended with fire all the time

Vyāpti refers to the invariable and universal concomitance between the hetu (reason) and the sādhya (conclusion) in Indian logic. It's crucial in inference (anumāna).

 

Option A is incorrect.

 

The Cārvākas are empiricists and skeptics. They reject inference (anumāna) because they believe that universal concomitance (vyāpti) between two phenomena like smoke and fire cannot be established with certainty. One cannot observe all cases to confirm it. So they deny that we can ever be sure that smoke always implies fire.

Question 30
In the context of sentence meaning relationship which of the following refers to 'Expectancy'?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Āsatti
  • B.Ākankṣā
  • C.Yogyatā
  • D.Tātparya Jñāna
Correct Answer: Ākankṣā

In the Mīmāṃsā and Navya-Nyāya, sentence meaning is understood through certain conditions that must be fulfilled for śābdabodha (verbal cognition).

 

Ākankṣā (Expectation / Expectancy) refers to the need or expectation among words to combine meaningfully. For example, in the sentence “Rāma eats”, the word “eats” creates an expectation for an object (what does he eat?), and “Rāma” creates an expectation for an action (what does Rāma do?). Until the expectancy is fulfilled, the sentence is incomplete in meaning.

Question 31
IfL16represents a number L in base - 16 number system, then4AC16+9BF16=(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.E6B16
  • B.A7BF16
  • C.CFC16
  • D.D6816
Correct Answer: E6B16

Converting 4AC16 into Base 10, we get = 1196

9BF16 into Base 10, we get = 2495

Total is 3691, which is equal E6B to in Base 16.

Question 32
Microsoft PowerPoint comes with several categories of built-in transition effects. Which of the following is not a type of transition effect supported by Microsoft PowerPoint?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Subtle
  • B.Speed
  • C.Exciting
  • D.Dynamic Content
Correct Answer: Speed

Microsoft PowerPoint offers transition effects that control how slides change during a presentation. These transitions are grouped into the following main categories:

 

Subtle – Simple transitions like Fade, Push, or Wipe that create smooth changes.

 

Exciting – More dynamic and attention-grabbing transitions like Shape, Wheel, or Checkerboard.

 

Dynamic Content – Transitions that only affect the content (text, images) on the slide, not the background.

Question 33
Identify the largest of the following computer storage capacities A–E (1 K = 1000).A. 1000000 K BytesB. 100000 M BytesC. 1 T BytesD. 1000000000000 BytesE. 100 G BytesChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A
  • B.E
  • C.D
  • D.C
Correct Answer: C

Question 34
In cloud computing, which of the following are the advantages of using cloud storage?A. Data files of customers stores on the cloud can be accessed at any time from any device anywhere in the world provided internet access is available.B. There is no need for customers to carry an external storage device with them or use same computer to store and retrieve informationC. If the computers have slow internet connection, then they would not face any problems accessing or downloading their data filesD. Cloud storage is typically delivered by a cloud service providerChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B and C Only
  • B.A, B and D Only
  • C.A and C Only
  • D.B and C Only
Correct Answer: A, B and D Only

Let’s analyze each statement:

 

A. "Data files of customers stored on the cloud can be accessed at any time from any device anywhere in the world provided internet access is available."

 

Correct. This is a core benefit of cloud storage — universal accessibility via the internet.

 

B. "There is no need for customers to carry an external storage device with them or use the same computer to store and retrieve information."

 

Correct. Since files are stored online, users don’t need physical storage devices or the same machine.

 

C. "If the computers have slow internet connection, then they would not face any problems accessing or downloading their data files."

 

Incorrect. Slow internet can indeed affect cloud access and file download speed. So this claim is false.

 

D. "Cloud storage is typically delivered by a cloud service provider."

 

Correct. Services like Google Drive, Dropbox, AWS, and OneDrive are examples of cloud service providers.

Question 35
Match the List–I with List–II.List–I (Digital India Theme)A. e-ShodhSindhuB. e-YantraC. e-VidwanD. e-KalpaList–II (Purpose)I. Subscription-based scholarly information (e-books and e-journals) at lower ratesII. Robotics outreach project run by IIT, MumbaiIII. Expert database and National Researcher's NetworkIV. Digital-learning environment for designChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-IV, B-II, C-III, D-I
  • B.A-III, B-II, C-I, D-IV
  • C.A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV
  • D.A-II, B-IV, C-III, D-I
Correct Answer: A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV

Let’s match each Digital India Theme with its correct purpose:

 

A. e-ShodhSindhu → I. Subscription-based scholarly information (e-books and e-journals)

A project that provides access to high-quality academic content (e-journals, databases, e-books) at subsidized rates for Indian institutions.

 

B. e-Yantra → II. Robotics outreach project run by IIT, Mumbai

A flagship project by IIT Bombay to promote education in embedded systems and robotics through competitions, labs, and training.

 

C. e-Vidwan → III. Expert database and National Researcher's Network

A platform that provides detailed profiles of experts and researchers in various fields for academic and administrative use.

 

D. e-Kalpa → IV. Digital-learning environment for design

An initiative by IIT Bombay to support design education through digital content, courses, and virtual classrooms.

Question 36
The amount of rainfall required to saturate the soil is known as.(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Field Capacity
  • B.Soil Moisture content
  • C.Soil Moisture deficit
  • D.Wilting Coefficient
Correct Answer: Soil Moisture deficit

Soil moisture deficit refers to the difference between the actual water content in the soil and the amount it could hold at field capacity

Question 37
Groundwater is specially prone to excessive hardness due to:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Calcium and Sodium ions
  • B.Calcium and Magnesium ions
  • C.Sodium and Magnesium ions
  • D.Potassium and Calcium ions
Correct Answer: Calcium and Magnesium ions

Hardness in groundwater is primarily caused by the presence of divalent metal cations, especially: Calcium (Ca²⁺); Magnesium (Mg²⁺).

 

These ions enter groundwater naturally when water passes through limestone, chalk, or gypsum deposits, which are rich in calcium carbonate (CaCO₃) and magnesium salts.

Question 38
Arrange the following events in the order of their occurrence starting from oldest to the recent.A. Bhopal gas tragedyB. Fukushima disasterC. Chernobil disasterD. California SmogE. London SmogChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.D, E, B, A, C
  • B.E, C, A, B, D
  • C.D, E, A, C, B
  • D.E, D, A, B, C
Correct Answer: D, E, A, C, B

Let’s look at the actual years in which each event occurred:

 

D. California Smog – 1940s–50s

 

Notably in Los Angeles, due to automobile emissions and industrial activity. One of the earliest documented modern smog issues.

 

E. London Smog – 1952

 

Known as the Great Smog of London, it caused thousands of deaths due to coal pollution and fog.

 

A. Bhopal Gas Tragedy – 1984

 

Leakage of methyl isocyanate gas from the Union Carbide plant in India; one of the world’s worst industrial disasters.

 

C. Chernobyl Disaster – 1986

 

Nuclear reactor explosion in the USSR (now Ukraine), releasing large amounts of radioactive particles.

 

B. Fukushima Disaster – 2011

 

Triggered by a tsunami and earthquake in Japan, causing a meltdown in a nuclear plant.

Question 39
Which of the following National missions come under the National Action Plan for climate change?A. National Solar missionB. National Water missionC. National Green Hydrogen missionD. National Mission for Sustainable AgricultureE. National Mission on Sustainable HabitatChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B, C and D Only
  • B.B, C and E Only
  • C.C, D, E andAOnly
  • D.D, E, A and B Only
Correct Answer: D, E, A and B Only

The National Action Plan on Climate Change (NAPCC), launched by the Government of India in 2008, originally includes 8 National Missions focused on promoting sustainable development and addressing climate change.

 

These are given below.

 

A. National Solar Mission: Promotes the use of solar energy to reduce carbon emissions.

 

B. National Water Mission: Focuses on conserving water and minimizing wastage.

 

D. National Mission for Sustainable Agriculture: Aims to make agriculture more resilient to climate change.

 

E. National Mission on Sustainable Habitat: Promotes energy efficiency in urban planning, housing, and transport.

Question 40
Match the List–I with List–II.List–I (Organism)A. LionB. TreesC. FishD. GrasshopperList–II (Trophic Level)I. First Trophic levelII. Second Trophic LevelIII. Third Trophic levelIV. Fourth Trophic levelChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-I, B-IV, C-II, D-III
  • B.A-IV, B-I, C-III, D-II
  • C.A-II, B-III, C-I, D-IV
  • D.A-III, B-II, C-IV, D-I
Correct Answer: A-IV, B-I, C-III, D-II

Trophic levels represent the position of organisms in the food chain, based on their feeding behavior.

 

Match Each Organism:

A. Lion → IV. Fourth Trophic Level

 

Top carnivore or apex predator. Feeds on other carnivores (e.g., secondary consumers like deer-eating animals).

 

B. Trees → I. First Trophic Level

 

Producers. Convert solar energy into food through photosynthesis.

 

C. Fish → III. Third Trophic Level

 

Many fish are secondary consumers that eat insects or smaller aquatic life (which are primary consumers).

 

D. Grasshopper → II. Second Trophic Level

 

Primary consumer. Feeds on producers (plants/grass).

Question 41
According to National Credit Framework (NCrF), the credit level earned after obtaining Bachelor's degree (three years of undergraduate programme) will be(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.7
  • B.5.5
  • C.6.5
  • D.5
Correct Answer: 5.5

National Credit Framework is designed to integrate the credits earned through school education, higher education, vocational, and skill education, and provide lifelong learning opportunities. According to the framework, an academic year will be defined by the number of hours a student puts in, and credits will be provided to them accordingly at the end of each academic year.

 

NCrF is a meta-framework that consists of three verticals:

(i) National School Education Qualification Framework (NSEQF)

(ii) National Higher Education Qualification Framework (NHEQF), and

(iii) National Skills Qualification Framework (NSQF)

 

Credit Levels:

  • The NCrF has proposed several levels within this framework ranging from level 1 to level 8.
  • The credit level that can be attained after completion of school education, i.e., grade 5th will be level 1, grade 8th will be level 2, grade 10th will be level 3, and grade 12th will be level 4.
  • Higher education shall be from credit levels of 4.5 to level 8 (5.5 being Bachelor).
  • The NCrF credit levels for school education are up to level 4, while for higher education
  • For vocational education & training level 1 to level 8.
Question 42
The acronym ‘APAAR’ for the student ID stands for:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Authentic Permanent Academic Account Registry
  • B.Automatic Personal Academic Account Registry
  • C.Automated Permanent Academic Account Registry
  • D.Authentic Personal Academic Account Registry
Correct Answer: Automated Permanent Academic Account Registry

The Automated Permanent Academic Account Registry (APAAR) is a transformative initiative introduced in alignment with the National Education Policy (NEP) of 2020 and the National Credit and Qualifications Framework (NCrF). It aims to provide a unified and accessible academic experience for students across India by assigning a unique and permanent 12-digit ID to every student, consolidating their academic achievements in one place.

Question 43
Arrange the following flagship programmes in chronological order according to their years of launch.A. Naya Savera – Free coaching and Allied SchemeB. USTTADC. Maulana Azad National FellowshipChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, C, B
  • B.A, B, C
  • C.C, B, A
  • D.C, A, B
Correct Answer: A, C, B

The Naya Savera Scheme was launched in the year 2007 to assist students/candidates belonging to the notified minority communities by way of special coaching for qualifying examinations for admission in technical/professional courses and competitive examination for recruitment to Group ‘A, ‘B’ & ‘C’ services and other equivalent posts under the Central and State Governments including public sector undertakings, banks, railways, etc.

 

Upgrading the Skills and Training in Traditional Arts/Crafts for Development (USTTAD) scheme was launched in May, 2015 to preserve the rich heritage of traditional arts/crafts of minorities. The scheme aims at capacity building and updating the traditional skills of master craftsmen/artisans, documentation of identified traditional arts/crafts of minorities, set standards for traditional skills, training of minority youths in various identified traditional arts/crafts through master craftsmen, and develop national and international market linkages.

 

Maulana Azad National Fellowship For Minority Students was launched in 2009 by the Ministry of Minority Affairs for providing financial aid to students for their higher studies.

Question 44
A major defect of the Sargeant Plan was:(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Integration of education with economic institutions
  • B.Emphasis on social sector
  • C.Too much importance to technical education
  • D.Highly selective admission to colleges
Correct Answer: Highly selective admission to colleges

The Sargeant Plan (1944), formally titled the Report by the Central Advisory Board of Education on Post-War Educational Development in India, was a comprehensive blueprint for the educational reconstruction of India.

 

The plan proposed highly selective admissions at the college level, allowing only a small percentage of students to enter higher education. This was criticized as being elitist and exclusionary, especially in a country where access to education was already limited.

Question 45
Which of the following recommended the linkages of Universities with outside autonomous research organisations?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Indian Council of Medical Research
  • B.Education Commission (1964–66)
  • C.Indian Council of Agricultural Research
  • D.Calcutta University Commission
Correct Answer: Education Commission (1964–66)

The Education Commission (1964–66), also known as the Kothari Commission, recommended linking universities with autonomous research organizations to enhance the quality of research and academic output. It emphasized the importance of building collaborative relationships between universities and research institutions, particularly in fields like science, technology, and applied research, to advance knowledge and solve national problems.

Question 46
Read the passage and answer the following questions:Assamese or ‘Asomiya’ is the most commonly spoken language in the state of Assam. Besides, it also serves the purpose of a link language in the whole region. As a language, it is considered to have evolved out of Magadhi, a form of old Prakrit language. However, on account of various influences over the years the language has come to acquire some variations in its form of speech. These are called the groups of dialects of Assamese. Of these, the eastern group of dialects is spoken mainly in the Sibsagar district and its adjoining areas. Similarly, the central group of dialects is mostly spoken in the Nagaon district and the areas adjacent to it. In the west, on the other hand, there are two distinct groups of dialects. These are called the Goalparia and the Kamrupi groups.Bodo or ‘Bo-Ro’ is another important spoken language of the state. It belongs to the Tibeto-Burman language family and is mostly spoken in the areas coming under the Bodoland Territorial Council, where it is the official language. By the 92nd Amendment of the Constitution of India 2003, Bodo has also become one of the 22 scheduled languages of the country.From which language is Asomiya considered to have evolved?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Tibetan
  • B.Magadhi
  • C.Angika
  • D.Thai
Correct Answer: Magadhi

The passage clearly states:

 

"As a language, it (Assamese or Asomiya) is considered to have evolved out of Magadhi, a form of old Prakrit language."

 

So, the correct answer is option (B) Magadhi.

Question 47
Read the passage and answer the following questions:Assamese or ‘Asomiya’ is the most commonly spoken language in the state of Assam. Besides, it also serves the purpose of a link language in the whole region. As a language, it is considered to have evolved out of Magadhi, a form of old Prakrit language. However, on account of various influences over the years the language has come to acquire some variations in its form of speech. These are called the groups of dialects of Assamese. Of these, the eastern group of dialects is spoken mainly in the Sibsagar district and its adjoining areas. Similarly, the central group of dialects is mostly spoken in the Nagaon district and the areas adjacent to it. In the west, on the other hand, there are two distinct groups of dialects. These are called the Goalparia and the Kamrupi groups.Bodo or ‘Bo-Ro’ is another important spoken language of the state. It belongs to the Tibeto-Burman language family and is mostly spoken in the areas coming under the Bodoland Territorial Council, where it is the official language. By the 92nd Amendment of the Constitution of India 2003, Bodo has also become one of the 22 scheduled languages of the country.Which group of dialects is spoken in Sibsagar and adjoining areas?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Southern
  • B.Eastern
  • C.Western
  • D.Northern
Correct Answer: Eastern

The passage clearly states:

 

"The eastern group of dialects is spoken mainly in the Sibsagar district and its adjoining areas."

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option (B) Eastern.

Question 48
Read the passage and answer the following questions:Assamese or ‘Asomiya’ is the most commonly spoken language in the state of Assam. Besides, it also serves the purpose of a link language in the whole region. As a language, it is considered to have evolved out of Magadhi, a form of old Prakrit language. However, on account of various influences over the years the language has come to acquire some variations in its form of speech. These are called the groups of dialects of Assamese. Of these, the eastern group of dialects is spoken mainly in the Sibsagar district and its adjoining areas. Similarly, the central group of dialects is mostly spoken in the Nagaon district and the areas adjacent to it. In the west, on the other hand, there are two distinct groups of dialects. These are called the Goalparia and the Kamrupi groups.Bodo or ‘Bo-Ro’ is another important spoken language of the state. It belongs to the Tibeto-Burman language family and is mostly spoken in the areas coming under the Bodoland Territorial Council, where it is the official language. By the 92nd Amendment of the Constitution of India 2003, Bodo has also become one of the 22 scheduled languages of the country.Which groups of dialects are spoken in the western regions of Assam?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Goalparia and Dimasa
  • B.Kamrupi and Karbi
  • C.Goalparia and Nalbaria
  • D.Goalparia and Kamrupi
Correct Answer: Goalparia and Kamrupi

From the passage:

 

"In the west, on the other hand, there are two distinct groups of dialects. These are called the Goalparia and the Kamrupi groups."

 

So, the correct answer is option (D) Goalparia and Kamrupi.

Question 49
Read the passage and answer the following questions:Assamese or ‘Asomiya’ is the most commonly spoken language in the state of Assam. Besides, it also serves the purpose of a link language in the whole region. As a language, it is considered to have evolved out of Magadhi, a form of old Prakrit language. However, on account of various influences over the years the language has come to acquire some variations in its form of speech. These are called the groups of dialects of Assamese. Of these, the eastern group of dialects is spoken mainly in the Sibsagar district and its adjoining areas. Similarly, the central group of dialects is mostly spoken in the Nagaon district and the areas adjacent to it. In the west, on the other hand, there are two distinct groups of dialects. These are called the Goalparia and the Kamrupi groups.Bodo or ‘Bo-Ro’ is another important spoken language of the state. It belongs to the Tibeto-Burman language family and is mostly spoken in the areas coming under the Bodoland Territorial Council, where it is the official language. By the 92nd Amendment of the Constitution of India 2003, Bodo has also become one of the 22 scheduled languages of the country.What is the official language of the areas under the Bodoland Territorial Council?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Rava
  • B.Asomiya
  • C.Bo-Ro
  • D.Garo
Correct Answer: Bo-Ro

From the passage:

 

"Bodo or ‘Bo-Ro’ is another important spoken language of the state. It belongs to the Tibeto-Burman language family and is mostly spoken in the areas coming under the Bodoland Territorial Council, where it is the official language."

 

Therefore, the official language of the Bodoland Territorial Council is Bo-Ro (Bodo).

Question 50
Read the passage and answer the following questions:Assamese or ‘Asomiya’ is the most commonly spoken language in the state of Assam. Besides, it also serves the purpose of a link language in the whole region. As a language, it is considered to have evolved out of Magadhi, a form of old Prakrit language. However, on account of various influences over the years the language has come to acquire some variations in its form of speech. These are called the groups of dialects of Assamese. Of these, the eastern group of dialects is spoken mainly in the Sibsagar district and its adjoining areas. Similarly, the central group of dialects is mostly spoken in the Nagaon district and the areas adjacent to it. In the west, on the other hand, there are two distinct groups of dialects. These are called the Goalparia and the Kamrupi groups.Bodo or ‘Bo-Ro’ is another important spoken language of the state. It belongs to the Tibeto-Burman language family and is mostly spoken in the areas coming under the Bodoland Territorial Council, where it is the official language. By the 92nd Amendment of the Constitution of India 2003, Bodo has also become one of the 22 scheduled languages of the country.What is the link language of the region as mentioned in the passage?(UGC NET 23 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Asomiya
  • B.Bodo
  • C.Nagamese
  • D.Kamrupi
Correct Answer: Asomiya

The passage clearly states:

 

"Assamese or ‘Asomiya’ is the most commonly spoken language in the state of Assam. Besides, it also serves the purpose of a link language in the whole region."

 

Therefore, Asomiya (Assamese) is the link language of the region.

Quiz Attempt #119721

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of the number of students (Boys and Girls) and the number of girls who are enrolled in five different games, namely, Basketball, Soccer, Badminton, Cricket and Tennis, in a School during the session 2022-23. A total number of 6000 students are enrolled in all the five games in the school in which the number of girls is 3500. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.What is the number of boys who are enrolled in the game Basketball?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.805
  • B.430
  • C.840
  • D.470
Correct Answer: 470

Students enrolled in Basketball = 16% of 6000 = 960

Girls enrolled in Basketball = 14% of 3500 = 490

Boys = 960 – 490 = 470

Question 2
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of the number of students (Boys and Girls) and the number of girls who are enrolled in five different games, namely, Basketball, Soccer, Badminton, Cricket and Tennis, in a School during the session 2022-23. A total number of 6000 students are enrolled in all the five games in the school in which the number of girls is 3500. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.What is the difference between the number of girls and the number of boys who are enrolled in the game of Tennis?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.340
  • B.370
  • C.390
  • D.320
Correct Answer: 340

Total = 20% of 6000 = 1200

Girls = 22% of 3500 = 770

Boys = 430

Difference = 770 – 430 = 340

Question 3
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of the number of students (Boys and Girls) and the number of girls who are enrolled in five different games, namely, Basketball, Soccer, Badminton, Cricket and Tennis, in a School during the session 2022-23. A total number of 6000 students are enrolled in all the five games in the school in which the number of girls is 3500. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Number of boys who are enrolled in Cricket is approximately ________% more than the number of students who are enrolled in Badminton.(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.21.79
  • B.22.71
  • C.23.81
  • D.25.91
Correct Answer: 23.81

Boys in cricket = 29% of 6000 – 20% of 3500 = 1040

Students in Badminton = 14% of 6000 = 840

Required percentage = 1040-840840×100 = 23.81%

Question 4
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of the number of students (Boys and Girls) and the number of girls who are enrolled in five different games, namely, Basketball, Soccer, Badminton, Cricket and Tennis, in a School during the session 2022-23. A total number of 6000 students are enrolled in all the five games in the school in which the number of girls is 3500. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Number of boys who are enrolled in Soccer is ________% of the number of boys who are enrolled in all the five sports games.(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.10.2
  • B.11.2
  • C.12.2
  • D.13.2
Correct Answer: 11.2

Boys in soccer = 21% of 6000 – 28% of 3500 = 280

Required percentage = 2802500×100 = 11.2%

Question 5
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of the number of students (Boys and Girls) and the number of girls who are enrolled in five different games, namely, Basketball, Soccer, Badminton, Cricket and Tennis, in a School during the session 2022-23. A total number of 6000 students are enrolled in all the five games in the school in which the number of girls is 3500. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.How many boys are enrolled in Soccer and Tennis together?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.610
  • B.640
  • C.720
  • D.710
Correct Answer:

Required number = 41% of 6000 – 50% of 3500

= 710

Question 6
‘I never teach my pupils; I only attempt to provide the conditions in which they can learn’ is a statement by:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Swami Vivekananda
  • B.Albert Einstein
  • C.Sri Aurobindo
  • D.Aristotle
Correct Answer: Albert Einstein

The quote given in the question reflects Einstein’s philosophy of education, emphasizing creating an environment that fosters learning rather than direct instruction. He believed in encouraging curiosity and independent thinking in students.

 

Thus, option (B) is correct.

Question 7
In the context of learning, which of the following DOES NOT represent the self-concept?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.It is what an individual feels about others.
  • B.It is what an individual feels how others think/perceive of him/her.
  • C.It is an awareness of the individual about his/her strengths.
  • D.It is an awareness of the individual about his/her weaknesses.
Correct Answer: It is what an individual feels about others.

Self-concept refers to how an individual perceives themselves, including their strengths, weaknesses, and how they believe others perceive them. Feeling about others does not define self-concept; it reflects interpersonal perception, not self-awareness.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (A).

Question 8
Which of the following correctly represent characteristics of teaching?A. To provide guidance and training to studentsB. Interaction between authoritiesC. To provide formal and informal educationD. An art to import knowledge to students in an effective wayE. To prepare policies for corporate bodiesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A and B Only
  • B.A, D and E Only
  • C.A, C and D Only
  • D.C, D and E Only
Correct Answer: A, C and D Only

The correct and incorrect statements are as follows:

 

A. Teaching involves guidance and training – Correct.

 

C. It can be both formal (classroom) and informal (life experience) – Correct.

 

D. Teaching is an art of delivering knowledge effectively – Correct.

 

B. Interaction between authorities is administrative, not a core feature of teaching – Incorrect.

 

E. Preparing policies for corporate bodies is related to management or governance, not teaching – Incorrect.

Question 9
Match the following.List - I (Learning Style)A. ConvergerB. DivergerC. AssimilatorD. AccommodatorList - II (Characteristic)(I) They are best at concrete experience and reflective observation. Their strength is their imaginative ability. They tend to be interested in people and emotional elements.(II) They are good at Abstract Conceptualization and Active Experimentation like solving problems; practical application of ideas.(III) They enjoy and seek new experiences and adapt to new situations; are intuitive, risk-takers, open-minded.(IV) Ability to create theoretical models; possess sound logic, inductive reasoning, analytic; less interested in people.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(IV), B-(III), C-(II), D-(I)
  • B.A-(III), B-(II), C-(I), D-(IV)
  • C.A-(II), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(III)
  • D.A-(I), B-(II), C-(III), D-(IV)
Correct Answer: A-(II), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(III)

The correct match is as follows:

 

A. Converger → (II): Good at abstract conceptualization and active experimentation. Focus on problem-solving and practical application.

 

B. Diverger → (I): Strong in concrete experience and reflective observation. Known for imagination and emotional awareness.

 

C. Assimilator → (IV): Excel in creating theoretical models, logical reasoning, and less focus on people.

 

D. Accommodator → (III): Enjoy new experiences, are intuitive, flexible, and open to risk-taking.

Question 10
“Education is the manifestation of perfection already in man” is a statement by:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Rabindranath Tagore
  • B.M.K. Gandhi
  • C.Sri Aurobindo
  • D.Swami Vivekananda
Correct Answer: Swami Vivekananda

Swami Vivekananda believed that education should bring out the inherent perfection in every individual. His philosophy emphasized self-realization, moral development, and inner strength as the true goals of education.

Question 11
Survey research on a single case with a view to revealing important features about its nature, corresponds to which of the following research designs?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Cross-sectional
  • B.Longitudinal
  • C.Case study
  • D.Comparative
Correct Answer: Case study

Survey research on a single case aimed at revealing important features about its nature corresponds to a case study research design. A case study focuses on in-depth analysis of a single case or a small number of cases, often to understand complex phenomena in their real-life context.

Cross-sectional (A) involves collecting data at one point in time across multiple cases or variables.

Longitudinal (B) refers to research that follows the same case(s) over a period of time to observe changes.

Comparative (D) involves comparing two or more cases to identify similarities and differences.

Therefore, the correct answer is (C) Case study.

Question 12
Which of the following is concerned with the question whether the measure of a concept truly represents that concept?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Internal validity
  • B.External validity
  • C.Construct validity
  • D.Transferability
Correct Answer: Construct validity

Construct validity (C) is concerned with whether the measure of a concept truly represents that concept. It ensures that the test or measurement tool accurately measures the theoretical construct it is intended to measure.

Internal validity (A) refers to the extent to which an experiment or study accurately measures the relationship between variables, free from external factors.

External validity (B) refers to the extent to which the results of a study can be generalized to other settings, populations, or times.

Transferability (D) refers to the degree to which the results of qualitative research can be applied to other contexts or settings.

Therefore, the correct answer is (C) Construct validity.

Question 13
Arrange the data sets with following pairs of mean (x̄) and standard deviation (σ) in increasing order of their coefficient of variation.A. x̄ = 50, σ = 12B. x̄ = 55, σ = 10C. x̄ = 60, σ = 14D. x̄ = 70, σ = 15Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.B, D, C, A
  • C.C, D, A, B
  • D.D, B, A, C
Correct Answer: B, D, C, A

The coefficient of variation (CV) is calculated using the formula:

The correct answer is (B) B, D, C, A.

Question 14
According to UGC Regulations 2018 on plagiarism, a student’s registration in the Ph.D. Program will be cancelled for which of the following similarities percentage in the thesis?A. 37%B. 46%C. 58%D. 62%E. 78%Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, C, D Only
  • B.B, C, D, E Only
  • C.A, C, D, E Only
  • D.D and E Only
Correct Answer: D and E Only

As per UGC Regulations 2018 on Plagiarism, the guidelines for submitting a revised thesis depend on the level of similarity detected.

Plagiarism would be quantified into the following levels in ascending order of severity for its definition:

Level 0: Similarities up to 10%

Level 1: Similarities above 10% to 40%

Level 2: Similarities above 40% to 60

Level 3: Similarities above 60%

 

Penalties in case of plagiarism in the submission of thesis and dissertations

Level 0: works with similarities up to 10% - Minor Similarities, no liability.

Level 1: works with similarities above 10% to 40% - Such student will be asked to re-submit a revised script within a stipulated period not exceeding six months.

Level 2: works with similarities above 40% to 60% - Such student shall be banned from submitting the revised script for a duration of one year.

Level 3: Similarities above 60% -Such student registration for that program shall be canceled.

Question 15
Match List – I with List – IIList – I (Type of variable)A. NominalB. OrdinalC. IntervalD. RatioList – II (Example)(I) Distance(II) Marital status(III) Movie ratings(IV) Location of places in Latitude degreesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(III), B-(II), C-(I), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(II), B-(III), C-(I), D-(IV)
  • C.A-(III), B-(IV), C-(II), D-(I)
  • D.A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I)
Correct Answer: A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I)

Let's match each type of variable with the correct example:

Nominal (A): Nominal variables categorize data without any order. Marital status (II) fits as it categorizes people as married, single, etc.

Ordinal (B): Ordinal variables have a meaningful order, but the intervals between values are not equal. Movie ratings (III) fit here because the ratings have a ranked order (e.g., 1 star, 2 stars, etc.), but the difference between ratings is not necessarily equal.

Interval (C): Interval variables have ordered values with equal intervals, but no true zero. Location of places in Latitude degrees (IV) fits, as latitude is measured on an interval scale where the differences between values are consistent, but 0° latitude does not imply the absence of latitude.

Ratio (D): Ratio variables have all the properties of interval variables, but they also have a true zero. Distance (I) fits, as it has a true zero and allows for meaningful comparisons (e.g., 10 km is twice as far as 5 km).

Thus, the correct matching is (D) A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I).

Question 16
Devarshi Narada is treated as the first communicator, because:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.He always speaks against the others.
  • B.He reports from the spot, mediates among the parties and thinks for the betterment of society.
  • C.He is not everywhere every time.
  • D.He is faithful to his lord.
Correct Answer: He reports from the spot, mediates among the parties and thinks for the betterment of society.

Devarshi Narada is considered the first communicator in ancient Indian tradition because he gathered and conveyed information, mediated between parties, and aimed to promote harmony and societal welfare—all essential qualities of an effective communicator.

 

Thus, option (B) is correct.

Question 17
Who invented the Printing Press?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.G. Marconi
  • B.Tang Dynasty
  • C.William Caxton
  • D.Johannes Gutenberg
Correct Answer: Johannes Gutenberg

Johannes Gutenberg is credited with inventing the printing press with movable type around 1440 in Germany. His invention revolutionized the spread of knowledge by making books more accessible and affordable.

 

Thus, option (D) is correct.

Question 18
Write the following types of communication in proper sequence:A. GroupB. PublicC. Mass communicationD. IntrapersonalE. InterpersonalChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.D, E, A, B and C
  • B.E, D, C, B and A
  • C.A, B, C, E and D
  • D.D, C, A, B and E
Correct Answer: D, E, A, B and C

The correct sequence is based on the increasing size and reach of communication:

 

D. Intrapersonal – Communication within oneself

 

E. Interpersonal – One-on-one communication

 

A. Group – Small group interaction

 

B. Public – One-to-many communication in a public setting

 

C. Mass communication – Communication to a large audience via media (TV, radio, internet, etc.)

 

The correct answer is option (A).

Question 19
Who sends what to whom in a communication process?A. Channel sends the message to sender.B. Sender sends messages to receiver.C. Sender sends the feedback receiver.D. Receiver sends messages to sender.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A Only
  • B.B Only
  • C.A and D Only
  • D.B and C Only
Correct Answer: B Only

In a standard communication process, the sender sends a message to the receiver. The channel is the medium used, not the sender, and feedback flows from receiver back to sender, not the other way around initially. So only option B is correct.

Question 20
Match List – I with List – IIList – I (Communication terms)A. Effective verbal communicationB. Effective communicationC. Effective non-verbal communicationD. Barrier of communicationList – II (Features)(I) Knowledge and skills(II) Effective speaking(III) Body language(IV) Insufficient knowledgeChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(I), B-(II), C-(IV), D-(III)
  • B.A-(II), B-(III), C-(I), D-(IV)
  • C.A-(II), B-(I), C-(III), D-(IV)
  • D.A-(III), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(II)
Correct Answer: A-(II), B-(I), C-(III), D-(IV)

The correct match is as follows:

A. Effective verbal communication → (II) Effective speaking – Verbal communication depends on how clearly and effectively one speaks.

 

B. Effective communication → (I) Knowledge and skills – Overall communication effectiveness requires both subject knowledge and communication skills.

 

C. Effective non-verbal communication → (III) Body language – Non-verbal cues like gestures, posture, and facial expressions play a key role.

 

D. Barrier of communication → (IV) Insufficient knowledge – Lack of understanding or knowledge is a major barrier in communication.

Question 21
‘A’ takes twice as much time as ‘B’ to complete a work and ‘C’ does itinthe same time as both ‘A’ and ‘B’ together do it. If all three of them work together and complete the work in 5 days, then the time taken by ‘B’ to complete the work alone is:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.12 days
  • B.14 days
  • C.15 days
  • D.18 days
Correct Answer: 15 days

Let B takes x days to complete the word.

B’s 1 day work = 1x

A’s 1 day work = 12x

C’s 1 day work = 1x + 12x = 32x

Then, 1x + 12x + 32x = 15

or x = 15

Thus, B will complete the work in 15 days.

Question 22
90 persons consume 810 kg of food in 27 days. In how many days will 60 persons consume 300 kg of food?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.12 days
  • B.13 days
  • C.15 days
  • D.18 days
Correct Answer: 15 days

81027×90 = 300x×60

or x = 15 days

Question 23
Arrange the following fraction in decreasing order:A. 12/19B. 7/12C. 11/17D. 17/28Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.C, A, D, B
  • C.B., C, D, A
  • D.D, A, B, C
Correct Answer: C, A, D, B

A. 12/19 ≈ 0.6316

B. 7/12 ≈ 0.5833

C. 11/17 ≈ 0.6471

D. 17/28 ≈ 0.6071

Thus, correct order is C, A, D, B

Question 24
Identify the number that occurs in the series 2, 10, 30, 68, 130,.......(A) 738(B) 349(C) 520(D) 222Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B and C Only
  • B.B, C and D Only
  • C.A, C and D Only
  • D.A, B and D Only
Correct Answer: A, C and D Only

222, 349 and 520 will be in the series

Question 25
Match List – I with List – IIList – I (Word)A. PRIMEB. SIGHTC. QUITED. RHYMEList – II (Unique Code)(I) 69(II) 72(III) 63(IV) 61Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(I), B-(II), C-(III), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I)
  • C.A-(IV), B-(III), C-(II), D-(I)
  • D.A-(III), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(II)
Correct Answer: A-(IV), B-(III), C-(II), D-(I)

P = 16, R = 18, I = 9, M = 13, E = 5

Sum = 16 + 18 + 9 + 13 + 5 = 61 → Matches (IV)

 

S = 19, I = 9, G = 7, H = 8, T = 20
Sum = 19 + 9 + 7 + 8 + 20 = 63 → Matches (III)

 

Q = 17, U = 21, I = 9, T = 20, E = 5

Sum = 17 + 21 + 9 + 20 + 5 = 72 → Matches (II)

 

R = 18, H = 8, Y = 25, M = 13, E = 5

Sum = 18 + 8 + 25 + 13 + 5 = 69 → Matches (I)

Question 26
What can be inferred from the following?"Because x = 3 and y = 5, then x + y = 8"It is a:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Deductive argument based on elimination
  • B.Deductive argument based on Mathematics
  • C.Inductive argument from Authority
  • D.Inductive argument from Principle of Charity
Correct Answer: Deductive argument based on Mathematics

The statement "Because x = 3 and y = 5, then x + y = 8" is a deductive argument based on mathematics (B). In this case, the conclusion follows necessarily from the premises using basic mathematical principles. The relationship between x and y is clearly defined, and the conclusion that x + y = 8 is an inevitable result of those values.

Question 27
Which among the following is NOT a common pattern of Deductive Reasoning?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Hypothetical Syllogism
  • B.Categorical Syllogism
  • C.Argument from Definition
  • D.Predictive Argument
Correct Answer: Predictive Argument

Deductive reasoning involves reasoning from general principles to specific conclusions, where the conclusion necessarily follows from the premises.

(A) Hypothetical Syllogism is a common pattern of deductive reasoning. It involves conditional (if-then) statements. For example: If P, then Q; If Q, then R; Therefore, if P, then R.

(B) Categorical Syllogism is another common deductive reasoning pattern, where statements are categorized in a form like: All A are B, All B are C, Therefore, all A are C.

(C) Argument from Definition is also a common pattern of deductive reasoning. It involves reasoning based on the definitions of terms. For example: A bachelor is an unmarried man. John is a bachelor. Therefore, John is an unmarried man.

(D) Predictive Argument is not a common pattern of deductive reasoning. Predictive arguments are more associated with inductive reasoning, where conclusions are based on past experiences or patterns to predict future events, not necessarily with certainty.

Therefore, the correct answer is (D) Predictive Argument.

Question 28
What among the following can be claimed of Deductive argument correctly?A. If the premises are true, then the conclusion is probably true.B. If the premises are true, then the conclusion must be true.C. It is unlikely for the premises to be true and the conclusion false.D. The conclusion follows necessarily from the premises.E. It is impossible for all the premises to be true and the conclusion false.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B and C Only
  • B.A and C Only
  • C.B, D and E Only
  • D.A, D and E Only
Correct Answer: B, D and E Only

A deductive argument is one in which, if the premises are true, the conclusion must be true. In other words, the conclusion follows necessarily from the premises. Let’s evaluate the given options:

 

A. If the premises are true, then the conclusion is probably true.

This is incorrect for deductive reasoning. It applies more to inductive reasoning, where conclusions are probable but not guaranteed.

 

B. If the premises are true, then the conclusion must be true.

This is correct. In a deductive argument, the conclusion must logically follow from the premises if the premises are true.

 

C. It is unlikely for the premises to be true and the conclusion false.

This is correct. In a deductive argument, if the premises are true, it is highly unlikely that the conclusion will be false.

 

D. The conclusion follows necessarily from the premises.

This is correct. This is a key characteristic of deductive arguments, where the conclusion is guaranteed to follow from the premises.

 

E. It is impossible for all the premises to be true and the conclusion false.

This is correct. In a valid deductive argument, if all premises are true, the conclusion cannot be false.

 

Thus, the correct answer is (C) B, D, and E Only.

Question 29
Match List – I with List – IIList – I (Concept)A. StatementB. PremiseC. ConclusionD. ArgumentList – II (Description)(I) A statement in an argument that is intended to be proved or supported by the premises.(II) A sentence that can be viewed as True or False.(III) Group of statements intended to prove or support another statement.(IV) Reason why we should accept another statement or conclusion.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(III), B-(I), C-(II), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(II), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(III)
  • C.A-(IV), B-(I), C-(II), D-(III)
  • D.A-(II), B-(III), C-(IV), D-(I)
Correct Answer: A-(II), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(III)

Let's match the concepts in List-I with their corresponding descriptions in List-II:

A. Statement: A statement is a sentence that can be viewed as either true or false. This corresponds to (II).

B. Premise: A premise is the reason or evidence given to support a conclusion. This corresponds to (IV).

C. Conclusion: The conclusion is the statement that is intended to be proven or supported by the premises. This corresponds to (I).

D. Argument: An argument is a group of statements intended to prove or support another statement (the conclusion). This corresponds to (III).

Thus, the correct answer is (B) A-(II), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(III).

Question 30
Match List – I with List – II.List – I (Term/concept)A. UpanayaB. ParāmarśaC. VyāptiD. PakṣadharmatāList – II (Description)(I) The knowledge of Pakṣadharmatā as qualified by Vyāpti(II) The invariable relation or association of the Middle term in the minor term(III) The application of the universal concomitance to the present case(IV) The invariable association of the middle term with the major termChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(II), B-(I), C-(III), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(III), B-(II), C-(IV), D-(I)
  • C.A-(IV), B-(III), C-(I), D-(II)
  • D.A-(III), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(II)
Correct Answer: A-(III), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(II)

Option D is the correct answer.

 

The presence of the middle term in the minor term is called paksadharmata.

 

The invariable association of the middle term with the major term is called vyapti.

 

The knowledge of paksadharmata as qualified by vyapti is called paramarsha or inference.

 

Upanaya is a form of Proposition is the application of the universal concomitance to the present case.

Question 31
ChatGPT is an AI chatbot developed by OpenAI and was launched in November 2022. What does ChatGPT stand for?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Chat Generative Pre-trained Transmission
  • B.Chat General Pre-trained Technology
  • C.Chat Generalized Pre-trained Technique
  • D.Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer
Correct Answer: Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer

The Full Form of ChatGPT AI chatbot from Open AI is Chat Generative Pre-Trained Transformer.

Question 32
Consider the following snapshot of MS-EXCEL worksheet:What will be the value of the cell C1 containing the formula =SUMIF(A1:A6,">100",B1:B6) in the above worksheet ?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.90
  • B.390
  • C.50
  • D.420
Correct Answer: 50

Correct answer is option D – 420.

Question 33
IfLmrepresents a number L in base – M number system, then identify the correct descending order of the following number A-D, when converted to base-10 number system.A.9C16B.2338C.3137D.100111102Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.C, D, B, A
  • B.D, C, A, B
  • C.B, C, A, D
  • D.D, C, B, A
Correct Answer: D, C, A, B

(9C)16 is equal to 156 in base 10.

(233)8 is equal to 155 in base 10.

(313)7 is equal to 157 in base 10.

(10011110)16 is equal to 158 in base 10.

Question 34
What are the advantages of using Cloud Computing word processing software?A. The user does not have to install word processing software on the computer.B. The user does not have to allocate space to install software in the hard disk.C. Storage space to save the document is provided by the cloud provider. The user can open or edit the document from any computer which has Internet facility.D. If the user has slow Internet connection, then he/she would not face any problems accessing or downloading his/her documents.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A and B Only
  • B.A and C Only
  • C.B, C and D Only
  • D.A, B and C Only
Correct Answer: A, B and C Only

The correct answer is option (D) A, B and C Only.

 

The advantages of using Cloud Computing word processing software are:

 

A. The user does not have to install word processing software on the computer: Cloud word processing software is accessible via a browser, so no local installation is needed.

 

C. Storage space to save the document is provided by the cloud provider. The user can open or edit the document from any computer which has Internet facility: The cloud provides storage, and users can access their documents from anywhere with an internet connection.

 

B. The user does not have to allocate space to install software in the hard disk: This is correct as data can be stored online.

Question 35
Match List – I with List – II.List – I (Initiatives in Higher Education)A. GIANB. IMPRINT-2C. DIGILOCKERD. SWAYAMList – II (Description)(I) Translation of research knowledge into viable technology (products and processes)(II) Achieve three Cardinal principles of Education policy namely, access, equity and quality(III) Tap the talent pool of scientists and entrepreneurs internationally(IV) Issuance and verification of documents and certificates in a digital wayChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(III), B-(I), C-(II), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(II), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(III)
  • C.A-(I), B-(III), C-(II), D-(IV)
  • D.A-(III), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(II)
Correct Answer: A-(III), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(II)

The correct answer is option (A) A-(III), B-(I), C-(II), D-(IV)

 

A. GIAN (Global Initiative of Academic Networks) aims to tap the talent pool of scientists and entrepreneurs internationally (III). It involves inviting international experts to enhance the quality of education in India.

 

B. IMPRINT-2 (Impacting Research Innovation and Technology) focuses on the translation of research knowledge into viable technology (products and processes) (I). It aims to promote research in areas that are of national importance.

 

C. DIGILOCKER aims to facilitate the issuance and verification of documents and certificates in a digital way (IV), making document management simpler and more secure.

 

D. SWAYAM (Study Webs of Active Learning for Young Aspiring Minds) aims to achieve the three cardinal principles of the Education policy, namely, access, equity, and quality (II). It provides online education across a variety of subjects.

Question 36
Based on the source of their food, organisms occupy a specific place in the food chain, known as:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Trophic level
  • B.Standing crop
  • C.Top level organism
  • D.Species level
Correct Answer: Trophic level

The correct answer is option (A) - Trophic level.

 

Organisms in an ecosystem occupy specific positions in the food chain based on their role in the flow of energy. These positions are called trophic levels. For example, producers (plants) occupy the first trophic level, herbivores occupy the second, and carnivores occupy higher levels in the food chain.

Question 37
Which of the following is NOT a primary air pollutant?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.CO
  • B.NO
  • C.O₃
  • D.SO₂
Correct Answer: O₃

The correct answer is option (C) - O₃ (Ozone).

 

Primary air pollutants are emitted directly from a source into the atmosphere (e.g., CO, NO, SO₂).

 

Ozone (O₃) is a secondary pollutant, formed in the atmosphere through chemical reactions involving primary pollutants like NOx and VOCs in the presence of sunlight (photochemical smog).

Question 38
Arrange the following gases in ascending order of their Global Warming Potential (GWP).A. CO₂B. CH₄C. SF₆D. CFC-11E. N₂OChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, C, E, D
  • B.A, B, E, D, C
  • C.B, C, A, E, D
  • D.A, E, B, D, C
Correct Answer: A, B, E, D, C

The correct answer is option (B) - A, B, E, D, C.

 

Global Warming Potential (GWP) in ascending order:

  • CO₂ (Carbon dioxide) – GWP = 1 (baseline)
  • CH₄ (Methane) – GWP
  • N₂O (Nitrous oxide)
  • CFC-11 (Chlorofluorocarbon-11)
  • SF₆ (Sulphur hexafluoride) – GWP

 

These values reflect their warming potential relative to CO₂ over a 100-year time horizon

Question 39
Which among the followings are global scale Phenomenon?A. Ozone layer depletionB. Global warmingC. Forest FireD. Sea level riseE. Air pollutionChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, C and D Only
  • B.A, B, C and D Only
  • C.B, C and E Only
  • D.A, B and D Only
Correct Answer: A, B and D Only

The correct answer is option (D) - A, B and D Only.

 

A. Ozone layer depletion – Global-scale phenomenon affecting the entire planet.

 

B. Global warming – A global phenomenon due to greenhouse gas emissions.

 

D. Sea level rise – A global effect of climate change, impacting coastal regions worldwide.

Question 40
Match List – I with List – IIList – I (International Meetings)A. Kyoto ProtocolB. Montreal ProtocolC. Rio SummitD. Paris AgreementList – II (Key objectives)(I) Global warming(II) Biodiversity conservation(III) Ozone depletion(IV) Solar AllianceChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(I), B-(III), C-(II), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(II), B-(III), C-(I), D-(IV)
  • C.A-(III), B-(I), C-(IV), D-(II)
  • D.A-(IV), B-(II), C-(I), D-(III)
Correct Answer: A-(I), B-(III), C-(II), D-(IV)

The correct answer is option (A) - A-(I), B-(III), C-(II), D-(IV).

 

A. Kyoto Protocol – (I) Global warming

→ Aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

 

B. Montreal Protocol – (III) Ozone depletion

→ Focuses on phasing out substances that deplete the ozone layer.

 

C. Rio Summit – (II) Biodiversity conservation

→ The 1992 Earth Summit addressed biodiversity, sustainable development, and climate.

 

D. Paris Agreement – (IV) Solar Alliance

→ Though mainly focused on climate change, it also led to the formation of the International Solar Alliance (ISA) by India and France.

Question 41
Arrange the following open Universities according to their year of establishment in Chronological order (Older → New):A. Yashwant Rao Chavan Maharashtra Open UniversityB. Karnataka State Open UniversityC. U.P. Rajarshi Tandon Open UniversityD. Kota Open UniversityE. Madhya Pradesh Bhoj Open UniversityChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B, D, C, E
  • B.D, A, E, B, C
  • C.B, C, E, A, D
  • D.D, A, B, C, E
Correct Answer: D, A, E, B, C

Option B is the correct answer.

Question 42
Match List – I with List – IIList – I (MOOCs Quadrant)A. Quadrant IB. Quadrant IIC. Quadrant IIID. Quadrant IVList – II (Component)(I) e-Tutorial(II) e-Content(III) Web Resources(IV) Self-AssessmentChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A-(I), B-(II), C-(III), D-(IV)
  • B.A-(I), B-(III), C-(II), D-(IV)
  • C.A-(II), B-(IV), C-(I), D-(III)
  • D.A-(IV), B-(I), C-(III), D-(II)
Correct Answer: A-(I), B-(II), C-(III), D-(IV)

The correct answer is option (A) - A-(I), B-(II), C-(III), D-(IV).

 

Explanation (SWAYAM MOOCs Four Quadrants):

Quadrant I – e-Tutorial

→ Video lectures/tutorials explaining concepts.

 

Quadrant II – e-Content

→ Digitally formatted reading materials such as PDFs, eBooks, presentations.

 

Quadrant III – Web Resources

→ Links to other online learning materials, references, and related resources.

 

Quadrant IV – Self-Assessment

→ Quizzes, assignments, tests for learners to evaluate understanding.

Question 43
Where did nuns and monks meditate, debate and discuss with learned for their quest for knowledge?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Monasteries
  • B.Basadis
  • C.Churches
  • D.Ghatika
Correct Answer: Monasteries

The correct answer is option (A) - Monasteries.

 

Monasteries were religious institutions where nuns and monks lived, meditated, debated, and discussed scholarly and spiritual topics. They were centers of learning and education in ancient times, especially in Buddhist and Jain traditions.

Question 44
Arrange the following themes of Sustainable Development Goals according to their goal number in increasing order.A. Gender EqualityB. Zero HungerC. Peace and JusticeD. Climate ActionE. Quality EducationChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.B, E, A, D, C
  • B.A, B, D, C, E
  • C.C, D, A, E, B
  • D.B, A, E, D, C
Correct Answer: B, E, A, D, C

The correct answer is option (D) - B, E, A, D, C.

 

Explanation (Based on SDG Numbers):

 

B. Zero Hunger – SDG 2

 

E. Quality Education – SDG 4

 

A. Gender Equality – SDG 5

 

D. Climate Action – SDG 13

 

C. Peace and Justice – SDG 16

Question 45
Which of following are the parts of AYUSH undergraduate education?A. SiddhaB. Sowa - RigpaC. Yoga-ShastraD. HomoeopathyE. SanjeevaniChoose the correct answerfrom the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A, B and E Only
  • B.B, C and D Only
  • C.A, B and D Only
  • D.A, C and E Only
Correct Answer: A, B and D Only

The correct answer is option (C) - A, B and D Only.

 

AYUSH stands for:

  • Ayurveda
  • Yoga and Naturopathy
  • Unani
  • Siddha
  • Homoeopathy

 

These are officially recognized systems under AYUSH for undergraduate education in India.

 

A. Siddha – Yes, recognized system under AYUSH

 

B. Sowa-Rigpa – Yes, added later to the AYUSH systems

 

C. Yoga-Shastra – Yoga is part of AYUSH but not as a standalone undergraduate medical degree

 

D. Homoeopathy – Yes, one of the core AYUSH systems

 

E. Sanjeevani – Not a recognized system under AYUSH; it's a mythical term, not an academic stream

Question 46
Read the passage below and answer the following questions.After being constituted into a separate State, Jharkhand has been consistently making progress in all fields including culture. Its efforts to create awareness among the people about the State’s built heritage by organising archaeological workshops have been particularly helpful. There are also initiatives taken to organise State level festivals to promote the arts and crafts of the local people. With its natural endowments also the State has become a favourite destination for visitors from all over the country and abroad. Places like Baba Baidyanath Temple, Suraj Kund, Maithon Dam, Noori Masjid are some such places which witness large number of visitors. The State Government is particularly committed to enrich the bamboo and wood crafts of the State along with tribal paintings and the stone carving activities. In the field of education, Ranchi, once considered to be a hub of quality education, is regaining its reputation. In the field of sports too the State has earned national recognition. This is specially so in the case of games like hockey, archery and cricket at both the national and the international levels.The organisation of archaeological workshops has helped to create awareness about:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Arts and Crafts
  • B.Built heritage
  • C.Bamboo and woodcraft
  • D.Games and sports
Correct Answer: Built heritage

The passage clearly states that archaeological workshops have been particularly helpful in creating awareness about the State’s built heritage, making option (B) the correct answer.

Question 47
Read the passage below and answer the following questions.After being constituted into a separate State, Jharkhand has been consistently making progress in all fields including culture. Its efforts to create awareness among the people about the State’s built heritage by organising archaeological workshops have been particularly helpful. There are also initiatives taken to organise State level festivals to promote the arts and crafts of the local people. With its natural endowments also the State has become a favourite destination for visitors from all over the country and abroad. Places like Baba Baidyanath Temple, Suraj Kund, Maithon Dam, Noori Masjid are some such places which witness large number of visitors. The State Government is particularly committed to enrich the bamboo and wood crafts of the State along with tribal paintings and the stone carving activities. In the field of education, Ranchi, once considered to be a hub of quality education, is regaining its reputation. In the field of sports too the State has earned national recognition. This is specially so in the case of games like hockey, archery and cricket at both the national and the international levels.Jharkhand has become a favourite destination for visitors from India and abroad because of its:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Stone carving activities
  • B.Mineral wealth
  • C.Natural attractions
  • D.Central location
Correct Answer: Natural attractions

The passage states that “with its natural endowments also the State has become a favourite destination for visitors from all over the country and abroad.” This clearly refers to natural attractions, making option (C) the correct answer.

Question 48
Read the passage below and answer the following questions.After being constituted into a separate State, Jharkhand has been consistently making progress in all fields including culture. Its efforts to create awareness among the people about the State’s built heritage by organising archaeological workshops have been particularly helpful. There are also initiatives taken to organise State level festivals to promote the arts and crafts of the local people. With its natural endowments also the State has become a favourite destination for visitors from all over the country and abroad. Places like Baba Baidyanath Temple, Suraj Kund, Maithon Dam, Noori Masjid are some such places which witness large number of visitors. The State Government is particularly committed to enrich the bamboo and wood crafts of the State along with tribal paintings and the stone carving activities. In the field of education, Ranchi, once considered to be a hub of quality education, is regaining its reputation. In the field of sports too the State has earned national recognition. This is specially so in the case of games like hockey, archery and cricket at both the national and the international levels.Which of the following activities is NOT included with state government initiative for enrichment?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Bamboo and woodcraft
  • B.Tribal painting
  • C.Stone carving
  • D.Rock Painting
Correct Answer: Rock Painting

The passage specifically mentions that the State Government is committed to enriching, bamboo and wood crafts, tribal paintings and stone carving activities. The passage does not mention about rock painting, thus, making option (D) correct.

Question 49
Read the passage below and answer the following questions.After being constituted into a separate State, Jharkhand has been consistently making progress in all fields including culture. Its efforts to create awareness among the people about the State’s built heritage by organising archaeological workshops have been particularly helpful. There are also initiatives taken to organise State level festivals to promote the arts and crafts of the local people. With its natural endowments also the State has become a favourite destination for visitors from all over the country and abroad. Places like Baba Baidyanath Temple, Suraj Kund, Maithon Dam, Noori Masjid are some such places which witness large number of visitors. The State Government is particularly committed to enrich the bamboo and wood crafts of the State along with tribal paintings and the stone carving activities. In the field of education, Ranchi, once considered to be a hub of quality education, is regaining its reputation. In the field of sportstoothe State has earned national recognition. This is specially so in the case of games like hockey, archery and cricket at both the national and the international levels.In which combination of sports has Jharkhand gained national and international recognition?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Cricket, archery and hockey
  • B.Cricket, archery and shooting
  • C.Croquet, Cricket and archery
  • D.Cricket, football and hockey
Correct Answer: Cricket, archery and hockey

The passage clearly states that Jharkhand has earned national recognition in sports, “especially in the case of games like hockey, archery and cricket at both the national and the international levels,” making option (A) the correct choice.

Question 50
Read the passage below and answer the following questions.After being constituted into a separate State, Jharkhand has been consistently making progress in all fields including culture. Its efforts to create awareness among the people about the State’s built heritage by organising archaeological workshops have been particularly helpful. There are also initiatives taken to organise State level festivals to promote the arts and crafts of the local people. With its natural endowments also the State has become a favourite destination for visitors from all over the country and abroad. Places like Baba Baidyanath Temple, Suraj Kund, Maithon Dam, Noori Masjid are some such places which witness large number of visitors. The State Government is particularly committed to enrich the bamboo and wood crafts of the State along with tribal paintings and the stone carving activities. In the field of education, Ranchi, once considered to be a hub of quality education, is regaining its reputation. In the field of sports too the State has earned national recognition. This is specially so in the case of games like hockey, archery and cricket at both the national and the international levels.Which city was once considered the hub of education in Jharkhand?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Deoghar
  • B.Ranchi
  • C.Jamshedpur
  • D.Koderma
Correct Answer: Ranchi

The passage states: "Ranchi, once considered to be a hub of quality education, is regaining its reputation." Hence, Ranchi is the correct answer.

Quiz Attempt #119722

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table embodies the details about the profits (in Rupees Lakhs) earned by five Retail Stores A-E during the years 2018–2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:Note: Profit = Income – InvestmentThe profit earned by Store A in 2023 is approximately ______ % more than that in 2019.(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.40
  • B.66.67
  • C.266
  • D.33.33
Correct Answer: 66.67

Required percentage = 30-1818×100 = 66.67%

Question 2
