The following table embodies the details about the profits (in Rupees Lakhs) earned by five Retail Stores A-E during the years 2018–2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:Note: Profit = Income – InvestmentConsider the percentage change in profit for the stores A, B, D and E for the pair of years {2018 and 2019}, {2018 and 2019}, {2018 and 2022} and {2018 and 2022}, respectively. Which store has maximum percentage change in profits for the pair of years mentioned?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A
  • B.B
  • C.D
  • D.E
Correct Answer: B

A (2018 and 2019) = 18-1212×100 = 50%

B (2018 and 2019) = 15-99×100 = 66.67%

D (2018 and 2022) = 21-1515×100 = 40%

There is decrease for E (2018 and 2022)

Thus, it is maximum for B.

Question 3
The following table embodies the details about the profits (in Rupees Lakhs) earned by five Retail Stores A-E during the years 2018–2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:Note: Profit = Income – InvestmentWhat should be the income of store D in 2020, so that its profit percent is 30%?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Rs. 33 lakh
  • B.Rs. 42 lakh
  • C.Rs. 60 lakh
  • D.Rs. 78 lakh
Correct Answer: Rs. 78 lakh

Income-InvestmentInvesement  = 30100

or 18Investment = 30100

or Investment = 60

Income = 60 + 18 = 78 lakh

Question 4
The following table embodies the details about the profits (in Rupees Lakhs) earned by five Retail Stores A-E during the years 2018–2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:Note: Profit = Income – InvestmentIn the year 2019, to earn a profit of 20% by each of the stores C and E, what is the ratio of investments made by C to that of E?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.7 : 11
  • B.1 : 5
  • C.5 : 1
  • D.11 : 7
Correct Answer: 11 : 7

33Ic = 21IE

or IcIE = 33 : 21 = 11 : 7

Question 5
The following table embodies the details about the profits (in Rupees Lakhs) earned by five Retail Stores A-E during the years 2018–2023. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow:Note: Profit = Income – InvestmentOwner of store C invests Rs. 9 lakh in 2021. What should be the investment of D in the same year to get an income double than that of Store C?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.₹51 lakh
  • B.₹6 lakh
  • C.₹50,000
  • D.₹33 lakh
Correct Answer: ₹51 lakh

Income of C in 2021 = 21 + 9 = 30 lakh

9 = 60 – Income

Income = 60 – 9 = 51

Question 6
Match the List-I with List-IIList I (Kinds of Classroom Resources)A. Simple ResourcesB. Compound ResourcesC. Complex ResourcesD. Abstract ResourcesLIST II (Description)I. Resources which are not easily bought, measured or adjusted, e.g. instructional approaches and teaching philosophiesII. Resources difficult to discern and measure and often embedded via web of relationship and practices, decision making, teacher accountability etc.III. Physical object and can be directly bought, adjusted and measured e.g. textbooks, blackboards and chalks etc.IV. Use of two or more than two resources such as class, size reduction and use of technology.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV
  • B.A-IV, B-III, C-II, D-I
  • C.A-IV, B-III, C-I, D-II
  • D.A-III, B-IV, C-II, D-I
Correct Answer: A-III, B-IV, C-II, D-I

The correct match is as follows:

A. Simple Resources → III: These are tangible, easily measurable items like textbooks, blackboards, chalks, etc.

 

B. Compound Resources → IV: These involve a combination of resources such as technology use and class size reduction.

 

C. Complex Resources → II: These are difficult to measure and often involve relationships, decision-making, accountability.

 

D. Abstract Resources → I: These are intangible like teaching philosophies and instructional approaches.

Question 7
What cannot be held as the correct motive of Question-Answer technique in Teaching?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.To test the knowledge
  • B.To locate the difficulty
  • C.To intimidate and hamper self-confidence
  • D.To promote thinking and originality
Correct Answer: To intimidate and hamper self-confidence

The question-answer technique in teaching is used to engage students, assess understanding, encourage critical thinking, and address learning difficulties. Intimidation or reducing a student's self-confidence is not a legitimate educational goal and goes against the principles of effective teaching.

 

Thus, option (C) is correct.

Question 8
The acronym ‘SWAYAM’ represents:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Scopus Web of Attentive learning for Youth and Apt Minds
  • B.Social Web of Agent learning for Youth and Adult Minds
  • C.Study Webs of Active learning for Young Aspiring Minds
  • D.Science Web of Aspirants and Young Active Minds
Correct Answer: Study Webs of Active learning for Young Aspiring Minds

The acronym ‘SWAYAM’ represents Study Webs of Active learning for Young Aspiring Minds.

Question 9
Which of the following can be considered as components of development of ability of critical and logical thinking?A. To identify the problemsB. To analyze the problemsC. To establish subjective truthsD. To select relevant facts and principlesE. To draw inferences and conclusionsChoose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A and C only
  • B.A, B and C only
  • C.A, B and D only
  • D.A, B, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, B, D and E only

Critical and logical thinking involves:

 

A. Identifying problems – recognizing what needs to be solved.

 

B. Analyzing problems – breaking down issues for better understanding.

 

D. Selecting relevant facts and principles – using appropriate data and concepts.

 

E. Drawing inferences and conclusions – forming logical outcomes based on analysis.

 

Establishing subjective truths is not part of logical thinking, as it relies on personal beliefs rather than objective reasoning.

Question 10
Match the List-I with List-II.List I (Myers Briggs Type Learner)A. Judging learnersB. Extrovert learnersC. The intuitorsD. The thinkersList II (Indicator)I. Depend on outside simulation and interaction for engaging in learningII. They choose to decide things impersonally based on analysis, self-discipline, logic, prefer clear course and outcomesIII. Concerned with knowing the essentials and take actions quickly, intolerant to ambiguityIV. Seek out patterns and relationships among the facts they gather, inferences, guesses from contextChoose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-II, B-III, C-I, D-IV
  • B.A-IV, B-I, C-III, D-II
  • C.A-III, B-I, C-IV, D-II
  • D.A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV
Correct Answer: A-III, B-I, C-IV, D-II

The correct match is as follows:

 

A. Judging learners → III: They prefer structure, quick decisions, clear outcomes, and dislike ambiguity.

B. Extrovert learners → I: They rely on external interaction and stimulation for learning.

C. The intuitors → IV: They look for patterns, relationships, and make inferences from the context.

D. The thinkers → II: They are analytical, logical, and prefer impersonal decision-making.

 

This matches the Myers-Briggs learning type indicators accurately.

Question 11
Qualitative research is generally associated with –(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Inductive approach
  • B.Deductive approach
  • C.Positivism
  • D.Objectivism
Correct Answer: Inductive approach

Qualitative research is generally associated with the inductive approach (A). In this approach, researchers begin with observations and data collection and then develop theories or patterns based on the data. This contrasts with the deductive approach (B), which starts with a hypothesis or theory and tests it using data.

Positivism (C) and Objectivism (D) are more commonly associated with quantitative research, which emphasizes objective measurements and testing predefined hypotheses.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is (A) Inductive approach.

Question 12
Qualitative content analysis of documents relating to different time periods corresponds to which of the following research designs?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Cross-sectional
  • B.Longitudinal
  • C.Case study
  • D.Comparative
Correct Answer: Longitudinal

Qualitative content analysis of documents relating to different time periods corresponds to a longitudinal research design (B). A longitudinal study involves examining data or information over an extended period of time, allowing researchers to analyze changes or trends over time.

Cross-sectional (A) refers to data collected at a single point in time.

Case study (C) focuses on an in-depth analysis of a single case or a small number of cases.

Comparative (D) involves comparing different groups or entities but does not necessarily involve the aspect of time.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is (B) Longitudinal

Question 13
Arrange the datasets with following pairs of mean (𝑥̄) and standard deviation (σ) in increasing order of their coefficient of variation:A.𝑥̄ = 25, σ = 9B.𝑥̄ = 40, σ = 12C.𝑥̄ = 30, σ = 10D.𝑥̄ = 35, σ = 11Choose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.B, C, D, A
  • C.A, C, D, B
  • D.B, D, C, A
Correct Answer: B, D, C, A

The coefficient of variation (CV) is calculated as the ratio of the standard deviation (σ) to the mean (𝑥̄), multiplied by 100. It is used to measure the relative variability of a dataset. The formula for CV is:

Thus, the correct order is B, D, C, A.

Question 14
According to UGC Regulations 2018 on Plagiarism, a student will have to submit a revised thesis for which of the following similarities of thesis?A. 12%B. 27%C. 46%D. 66%E. 70%Choose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.B, C and D only
  • C.C, D and E only
  • D.A and B only
Correct Answer: A, B and C only

As per UGC Regulations 2018 on Plagiarism, the guidelines for submitting a revised thesis depend on the level of similarity detected. Here’s a breakdown:

12% similarity (A) falls under Level 1 (10%-40%) plagiarism. In this case, the student must revise and resubmit the thesis within a specified time to reduce the similarity.

27% similarity (B) also falls under Level 1 (10%-40%), meaning the student is required to revise and resubmit the thesis.

46% similarity (C) falls under Level 2 (40%-60%), where the student must submit a revised thesis and may face additional penalties such as grade reduction or suspension.

 

For higher levels of similarity, such as 66% (D) and 70% (E), which fall under Level 3 (above 60%), more severe penalties apply, including cancellation of the student’s registration. However, for 12%, 27%, and 46% similarity, the requirement is only to revise and resubmit the thesis.

Question 15
Match the List-I with List-IIList I (Type of Variables)A. NominalB. OrdinalC. IntervalD. RatioList II (Example)I. Anger levelII. Crop yieldIII. Type of forestIV. Temperature in FahrenheitChoose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-I, B-II, C-IV, D-III
  • B.A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV
  • C.A-III, B-I, C-IV, D-II
  • D.A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II
Correct Answer: A-III, B-I, C-IV, D-II

Here’s the correct match between the types of variables and their examples:

A. Nominal: Nominal variables categorize data without any order. The Type of forest (III) is an example, as it simply classifies forests into categories such as tropical, temperate, etc.

B. Ordinal: Ordinal variables represent data that has a meaningful order but the intervals between categories are not necessarily equal. The Anger level (I) is an example, as it can be ranked (e.g., low, medium, high), but the difference between levels is not fixed.

C. Interval: Interval variables have ordered categories with equal intervals, but no true zero. The Temperature in Fahrenheit (IV) is an example because the difference between temperatures is consistent, but zero doesn’t represent a complete lack of temperature.

D. Ratio: Ratio variables have all the characteristics of interval variables, but they also have a true zero point. Crop yield (II) is an example because it can have a true zero (no crop yield) and allows for meaningful ratios (e.g., 20 units is twice as much as 10 units).

 

Therefore, the correct answer is (C) A-III, B-I, C-IV, D-II.

Question 16
Which one of the following ancient sites in India is known for oldest forms of human communication?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Dholavira
  • B.Bhimbetka
  • C.Ropar
  • D.Sinauli
Correct Answer: Bhimbetka

Bhimbetka caves in Madhya Pradesh are known for prehistoric cave paintings, which are among the oldest forms of human communication in India. These paintings date back to the Paleolithic and Mesolithic periods, depicting scenes of hunting, dancing, and daily life.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 17
Without whom the communication process cannot be completed?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Receiver
  • B.Media
  • C.Writer
  • D.Expert
Correct Answer: Receiver

In any communication process, the receiver is essential because communication is only complete when the message is received and understood. Without a receiver, the sender's message has no purpose or effect.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (A).

Question 18
Arrange the following four stages of communication in a proper sequence:A. TransmissionB. EncodingC. SenderD. FeedbackChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.C, B, A, D
  • B.B, A, C, D
  • C.D, C, B, A
  • D.A, B, C, D
Correct Answer: C, B, A, D

The correct orders is as follows:

 

A. Sender: The person who initiates the communication.

 

B. Encoding: The sender converts the idea into a message (words, symbols, etc.).

 

A. Transmission: The message is sent through a medium.

 

D. Feedback: The receiver responds, completing the communication loop.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (A).

Question 19
Which of the following are the correct definitions of communication?A. Process of ideating, searching and telling.B. Process of sending, receiving, and interpreting the message.C. Communication is social interaction through messages.D. Process of thinking, writing, and channelising the messages.Choose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A and B only
  • B.A and C only
  • C.B and D only
  • D.B and C only
Correct Answer: B and C only

Following definitions are correct:

 

B. Process of sending, receiving, and interpreting messages.

 

C. Social interaction through messages.

 

A and D focus too narrowly on individual activities like ideation or writing, which are parts of communication but not complete definitions.

 

Thus, option (D) is correct.

Question 20
Match the List-I with List-IIList I (Communication Term)A. Formal CommunicationB. Informal CommunicationC. Group CommunicationD. Intra-personal CommunicationList II (Examples)I. Religious discoursesII. Questioning oneself after doing a mistakeIII. Taking part in meetingIV. Conversation in canteenChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV
  • B.A-II, B-III, C-I, D-IV
  • C.A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II
  • D.A-IV, B-I, C-II, D-III
Correct Answer: A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II

The correct match is as follows:

 

A. Formal Communication → III (Taking part in meeting): Happens in official settings like meetings.

 

B. Informal Communication → IV (Conversation in canteen): Casual and unstructured, like chatting during breaks.

 

C. Group Communication → I (Religious discourses): Involves one-to-many or many-to-many interaction in a group.

 

D. Intra-personal Communication → II (Questioning oneself after doing a mistake): Internal dialogue within a person.

Question 21
A shopkeeper first increased the price of an item by 12% and then announces a discount of 20%. The actual discount on the original price is:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.12.6%
  • B.10.4%
  • C.14.2%
  • D.12%
Correct Answer: 10.4%

Let x be the original price

MP = 1.12x

SP = 1.12x × 0.8 = 0.896x

Actual discount = x – 0.896x = 0.104x

Discount Percentage = 10.4%

Question 22
A 200 m long train is travelling at a constant speed of 20 m/s. How long will it take to completely cross a 1000 m long railway platform?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.1 minute
  • B.1.5 minute
  • C.2 minutes
  • D.2.5 minutes
Correct Answer: 1 minute

Time = 1200m20m/s = 60 sec = 1 min

Question 23
Arrange the following fractions in decreasing order?A. 17/21B. 15/19C. 13/16D. 14/17Choose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.D, C, B, A
  • B.A, B, C, D
  • C.C, D, B, A
  • D.D, C, A, B
Correct Answer: D, C, A, B

1721 = 0.8095

1519 = 0.7895

1316 = 0.8125

1417 = 0.8235

Thus, correct order is D, C, A, B

Question 24
Identify the numbers that occur in the series 0, 7, 26, 63, 124..............A. 344B. 511C. 215D. 730Choose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A and B only
  • B.B and C only
  • C.C and D only
  • D.A and D only
Correct Answer: B and C only

The series is 13-1, 23-1, 33-1, 43-1, 53-1

So, next terms will be 63-1, 73-1 and 83-1 i.e. 215, 342 and 511.

Question 25
Match the List-I with List-II.List I (Word)A. PRIMEB. SIGHTC. QUITED. RHYMEList II (Unique Code)I. NPGKCII. QGEFRIII. OSGRCIV. PFWKCChoose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV
  • B.A-II, B-III, C-IV, D-I
  • C.A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II
  • D.A-IV, B-I, C-II, D-III
Correct Answer: A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV

Similarly, we can check for others also

Thus, A is the correct answer.

Question 26
Which of the following is NOT a fallacy of Relevance?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Ad Hominem (Personal Attack)
  • B.Attacking the Motive
  • C.Tu Quoque (Look who's talking)
  • D.False Alternatives
Correct Answer: False Alternatives

A fallacy of relevance occurs when the argument presented is irrelevant to the issue being discussed, distracting from the main point.

Ad Hominem (Personal Attack) (A) is a fallacy of relevance because it attacks the character of the person making the argument rather than addressing the argument itself.

Attacking the Motive (B) is also a fallacy of relevance, where one attacks the motives of the person making the argument instead of addressing the argument itself.

Tu Quoque (Look who's talking) (C) is a fallacy of relevance because it distracts by pointing out hypocrisy rather than addressing the actual issue.

False Alternatives (D) is not a fallacy of relevance. This is actually a fallacy of presumption, where only limited options are presented when more alternatives exist, misleading the audience into thinking there are only two choices.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is (D) False Alternatives.

Question 27
What can be inferred correctly from the following?“Science is based on experiment, on a willingness to challenge old dogma, on an openness to see the universe as it really is. Accordingly, science sometimes requires courage at the very least the courage to question the conventional wisdom.”A. Premise: Science sometimes requires courage.B. Premise: Science is based on experiment, as a willingness to see the universe as it really is.C. It is merely an Illustration.D. Conclusion: Science sometimes requires courage.E. Conclusion: Science is based on experiment, on a willingness to see the universe as it really is.Choose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, C and D only
  • B.A and D only
  • C.B and D only
  • D.B, C and E only
Correct Answer: B and D only

The statement is:

“Science is based on experiment, on a willingness to challenge old dogma, on an openness to see the universe as it really is. Accordingly, science sometimes requires courage at the very least the courage to question the conventional wisdom.”

 

Premise (B): "Science is based on experiment, on a willingness to see the universe as it really is." This is a description of what science is based on, so it qualifies as a premise.

 

Premise (A): "Science sometimes requires courage." This is another premise stating that science demands courage.

 

Conclusion (D): "Science sometimes requires courage." This is the conclusion drawn from the argument.

 

Conclusion (E): "Science is based on experiment, on a willingness to see the universe as it really is." This could be part of the general argument but not the final conclusion.

 

Since B and D are correct premises and conclusions, the correct answer is (C) B and D only.

Question 28
Observe the following argument and find the correct form:"A" has characteristics of ‘X’ and ‘Y’."B" has characteristics of ‘X’ and ‘Y’."A" has characteristics of ‘Z’.Therefore, B has characteristics of ‘Z’.Choose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Statistical Argument
  • B.An argument from Authority
  • C.Mathematical Argument
  • D.Argument from Analogy
Correct Answer: Argument from Analogy

The argument presented is based on a comparison between two things ("A" and "B") that share similar characteristics. The structure of the argument is as follows:

"A" has characteristics of ‘X’ and ‘Y’.

"B" has characteristics of ‘X’ and ‘Y’.

"A" has characteristics of ‘Z’.

Therefore, "B" has characteristics of ‘Z’.

 

This is an argument from analogy (D) because it infers that because "A" and "B" share similarities in characteristics 'X' and 'Y', "B" should also share characteristic 'Z' with "A". This type of reasoning draws a conclusion based on the similarity between two things.

Statistical Argument (A) involves using statistical data to support a claim.

Argument from Authority (B) relies on the opinion or authority of an expert to validate a claim.

Mathematical Argument (C) involves reasoning based on mathematical principles or equations.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is (D) Argument from Analogy.

Question 29
Match the List-I with List-II.List I (Fallacy)A. StrawmanB. Red HerringC. EquivocationD. Begging the QuestionList II (Description)I. When an arguer tries to sidetrack his audience by raising an irrelevant issue and claims the original issue is settled.II. When an arguer states or assumes as a premise the very thing he/she is trying to prove as a conclusion.III. When arguer distorts an opponent’s claim to make it easier to attack.IV. When a key word is used in two or more senses in the same argument.Choose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-IV, B-I, C-III, D-II
  • B.A-II, B-III, C-IV, D-I
  • C.A-I, B-II, C-IV, D-III
  • D.A-III, B-I, C-IV, D-II
Correct Answer: A-III, B-I, C-IV, D-II

Here’s the correct match between the fallacies and their descriptions:

A. Strawman (III): The strawman fallacy occurs when an arguer distorts or oversimplifies an opponent’s argument to make it easier to attack, instead of addressing the actual argument.

B. Red Herring (I): The red herring fallacy occurs when an arguer introduces an irrelevant issue to distract from the original topic and falsely claims the original issue is settled.

C. Equivocation (IV): The equivocation fallacy occurs when a key word is used in two or more senses within the same argument, leading to confusion or misinterpretation.

D. Begging the Question (II): The begging the question fallacy occurs when an argument assumes or states the conclusion within its premises, essentially trying to prove the conclusion by using it as evidence.

Question 30
In the light of Nyaya’s Syllogism, which of the following are correct?A. Sādhya is the major termB. Linga is the minor termC. Hetu is the middle termD. Pakṣa is the minor termE. Anumāna is the inferential knowledgeChoose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.A, C, D and E only
  • C.B and D only
  • D.B, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, C, D and E only

The correct answer is option (B) - A, C, D and E only.

 

In the context of Nyaya's syllogism, the terms have specific roles:

 

Sādhya is the major term (A), which is the conclusion or the fact that is being inferred.

 

Hetu is the middle term (C), which is the reason or the cause for the inference.

 

Pakṣa is the minor term (D), which is the subject of the inference (the specific case or instance).

 

Anumāna is the inferential knowledge (E), which is the result of the reasoning process.

 

So, the correct set of terms includes A, C, D, and E.

Question 31
In MS-EXCEL, a formula =B$1 + C$3 + 5 in cell D9 when copied to cell F12 will become:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.=D1 + E3 + 5
  • B.=B$2 + C$4 + 5
  • C.=C$1 + D$3 + 5
  • D.=D$1 + E$3 + 5
Correct Answer: =D$1 + E$3 + 5

Correct answer is option D.

Question 32
A webpage displays the following information, in which the underlined word is a link to another webpage:For digital devices, the bandwidth is usually expressed in bits per second (bps). For analog devices, the bandwidth is expressed in Hertz (Hz).Which method of data organization is being used?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.HTML
  • B.Hypertext
  • C.Storyboard
  • D.Data Scheme
Correct Answer: Hypertext

In the given scenario, the webpage contains a link (indicated by the underlined word) that leads to another webpage. This is a classic example of hypertext, where text is organized in a way that includes links (or hyperlinks) to other content. Hypertext allows users to navigate through different pieces of information via hyperlinks.

Question 33
Identify the correct logical sequence of the following four randomly ordered sentences A–D about the discovery of Computer Mouse?A. We use the mouse today because it is the pointing device that is easiest to use compared to others such as joysticks, trackballs etc.B. Doug Engelbart was bored at a conference and started thinking about tracking movement of a plane using two sets of wheels moving in orthogonal directions.C. Doug Engelbart remembered these notes when he was trying to come up with a device to select objects on a computer screen.D. Doug Engelbart tells the story of how he invented the mouse.Choose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.D, C, B, A
  • B.A, B, C, D
  • C.B, C, D, A
  • D.D, B, C, A
Correct Answer: D, B, C, A

D: Doug Engelbart tells the story of how he invented the mouse.

 

B: He was inspired by thinking about tracking movement using two sets of wheels, leading to his invention.

 

C: Engelbart remembered this idea when working on a device for selecting objects on a computer screen.

 

A: The mouse became widely used because it is the easiest pointing device compared to alternatives like joysticks or trackballs.

Question 34
IfLmrepresents a number L in base-M number system, then which of the following equalities are true?A.512.12510=1000000000.0012B.512.12510=1000.18C.512.12510=200.216D.512.12510=2000.024Choose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A and B only
  • B.A and C only
  • C.B, C and D only
  • D.A, B and C only
Correct Answer: A, B and C only

512.12510 is equal to 1000000000.001 in base 2.

512.12510 is equal to 1000.1 in base 8.

512.12510 is equal to 200.2 in base 16.

512.12510 is equal to 20000.02 in base 4.

Question 35
Match the List-I with List-II.List I (ICT Term)A. AuthenticationB. BiometricsC. IP AddressD. MAC AddressList II (Description)I. Identifies which device is connected at a given IP address.II. Relies on certain unique characteristics of human beings such as retina scans.III. Verifies that data comes from a secure and trusted source and works with encryption to strengthen internet security.IV. Identifies where on the network a device is located.Choose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-I, B-II, C-IV, D-III
  • B.A-III, B-II, C-IV, D-I
  • C.A-II, B-III, C-I, D-IV
  • D.A-IV, B-III, C-II, D-I
Correct Answer: A-III, B-II, C-IV, D-I

The correct answer is option (B) - A-III, B-II, C-IV, D-I.

 

A. Authentication: Verifies that data comes from a secure and trusted source and works with encryption to strengthen internet security (III).

 

B. Biometrics: Relies on certain unique characteristics of human beings, such as retina scans (II).

 

C. IP Address: Identifies where on the network a device is located (IV).

 

D. MAC Address: Identifies which device is connected at a given IP address (I).

Question 36
Indigenous Knowledge and Resource Management System is at best can be considered as –(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Mitigation Response
  • B.Adaptation Response
  • C.Decarbonization Response
  • D.Ethical Response
Correct Answer: Adaptation Response

The correct answer is option (B) - Adaptation Response.

 

Indigenous Knowledge and Resource Management Systems are primarily adaptation responses to environmental changes. They involve traditional practices, strategies, and knowledge passed down through generations that help communities adapt to their local environments and manage natural resources sustainably. These systems focus on adaptation rather than mitigation or decarbonization.

Question 37
Cloudless night with low wind speed indicates:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Turbulent Atmosphere
  • B.Unstable Atmosphere
  • C.Neutral Atmosphere
  • D.Stable Atmosphere
Correct Answer: Stable Atmosphere

The correct answer is option (D) - Stable Atmosphere.

 

A cloudless night with low wind speed typically indicates a stable atmosphere. In such conditions, the ground cools quickly, and the air near the surface becomes cooler and denser, inhibiting vertical mixing and leading to a stable atmospheric condition. This can result in calm weather with little turbulence.

Question 38
Arrange the following Indian States in descending order according to their climate vulnerability (Starting from most vulnerable to least vulnerable):A. Uttar PradeshB. JharkhandC. MaharashtraD. ManipurE. PunjabChoose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.D, B, C, A, E
  • B.C, E, A, D, B
  • C.B, A, D, E, C
  • D.A, E, B, C, D
Correct Answer: B, A, D, E, C

The correct answer is option C.

Question 39
Which among the followings are the renewable energy resources?A. BiodieselB. Nuclear EnergyC. Solar EnergyD. Hydroelectric EnergyE. Wind EnergyChoose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B, C, D only
  • B.B, C, D, E only
  • C.C, D, E, A only
  • D.E, A, B only
Correct Answer: C, D, E, A only

The correct answer is option C.

 

Solar Energy (C): Solar energy is a renewable resource as it is derived from the sun, which is an infinite source.

 

Hydroelectric Energy (D): Hydroelectric power is renewable as it uses water flow, which is replenished naturally.

 

Wind Energy (E): Wind energy is a renewable resource as it is powered by wind, which is a naturally occurring phenomenon.

 

Biodiesel (A): Biodiesel is a renewable resource It is derived from organic materials such as plant oils or animal fats, making it renewable as these resources can be replenished.

Question 40
Match the List-I with List-II.List I (Sustainable Development Goals - SDG)A. Zero HungerB. Sustainable Cities and CommunitiesC. Affordable and Clean EnergyD. Climate ActionList II (Goal Number)I. SDG-13II. SDG-7III. SDG-2IV. SDG-11Choose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A-III, B-IV, C-II, D-I
  • B.A-I, B-II, C-IV, D-III
  • C.A-II, B-III, C-I, D-IV
  • D.A-IV, B-I, C-III, D-II
Correct Answer: A-III, B-IV, C-II, D-I

The correct answer is option (A) – A-III, B-IV, C-II, D-I.

 

A. Zero Hunger corresponds to SDG-2 (III), which focuses on ending hunger, achieving food security, and improved nutrition.

 

B. Sustainable Cities and Communities corresponds to SDG-11 (IV), which aims to make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient, and sustainable.

 

C. Affordable and Clean Energy corresponds to SDG-7 (II), which aims to ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable, and modern energy for all.

 

D. Climate Action corresponds to SDG-13 (I), which focuses on taking urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts.

Question 41
In ancient India, Ujjain was famous for the study of:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Anthropology
  • B.Astronomy
  • C.Archaeology
  • D.Geology
Correct Answer: Astronomy

In ancient India, Ujjain was a major center for astronomical studies. It housed famous astronomers like Varāhamihira and was considered a prime meridian for astronomical calculations in India.

Question 42
The Sanskrit Commission (1956–57) was headed by:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Sukumar Sen
  • B.U.N. Dhebar
  • C.Suniti Kumar Chatterji
  • D.V.T. Krishnamachari
Correct Answer: Suniti Kumar Chatterji

The Sanskrit Commission was headed by Suniti Kumar Chatterji.

Question 43
Which of the following agencies launched the “International Environmental Education Programme”?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.UNESCO
  • B.UNEP
  • C.IUCN
  • D.GEF
Correct Answer: UNESCO

The correct answer is option (A) UNESCO.

 

The International Environmental Education Programme was launched by UNESCO (United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization) and UNEP. The program aims to promote environmental awareness and education across the globe to foster sustainable development.

Question 44
Arrange the following institutions according to their year of establishment (from earliest to the most recent):A. National Council of Rural Institutes (NCRI)B. Indian Council of Social Science Research (ICSSR)C. Indian Institute of Advanced Study (IIAS)D. Indian Council of Historical Research (ICHR)E. Indian Council of Philosophical Research (ICPR)Choose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A, B, C, D, E
  • B.C, D, B, E, A
  • C.B, E, A, C, D
  • D.C, B, D, E, A
Correct Answer: C, B, D, E, A

The correct answer is option (D) - C, B, D, E, A.

 

Here is the correct order of the institutions based on their year of establishment:

 

Indian Institute of Advanced Study (IIAS) - Established in 1965.

 

Indian Council of Social Science Research (ICSSR) - Established in 1969.

 

Indian Council of Historical Research (ICHR) - Established in 1972.

 

Indian Council of Philosophical Research (ICPR) - Established in 1977.

 

National Council of Rural Institutes (NCRI) - Established in 1995.

Question 45
According to NEP-2020, which is/are not under curriculum framework of adult education?A. Critical Life SkillsB. Vocational Skills DevelopmentC. Continuing EducationD. Art in EducationE. Basic EducationChoose the correct answer:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.A only
  • B.B and C only
  • C.D only
  • D.A, D and E only
Correct Answer: D only

The correct answer is option (C) - D only.

 

According to the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, the curriculum framework for adult education focuses on the following key areas:

 

Critical Life Skills (A) are part of adult education, helping individuals manage life challenges.

 

Vocational Skills Development (B) is emphasized to help adults gain skills for employment.

 

Continuing Education (C) promotes lifelong learning for adults.

 

Basic Education (E) is a fundamental part of adult education, particularly for those who missed out on formal schooling.

Question 46
Read the following passage and answer the questions that follow:Stone carvings are other impressive pieces of visual art of Gujarat. The State is also a repository of numerous places of historical importance, which attract thousands of people from all over the world. The city Junagadh is adorned with beautiful shrines of Hindus, Jains and Muslims. In Junagarh caves, a huge boulder preserves to this day fourteen rock edicts inscribed by Emperor Ashoka in the 3rd century BCE. Besides, one can also see here classic examples of rock cut architecture in the Chitya Halls and the sculpted pillars of the caves. Maru-Gurjara or Chalukyan style architecture can also be seen in the Sun Temple of Modhera. Similarly, one can see architecture belonging to the Chalukya (Solanki) period at Adalaj, a heritage site protected by the Archaeological Survey of India in the Gandhinagar district. Hence an interesting depiction of ‘Ami Khumbor’ (symbolic pot with water of life) and ‘Kalp Vriksha’ (tree of life) carved from a single block of stone present a marvellous example of the State’s sculptural heritage.Copper has been in use in Gujarat since the times of the Chalcolithic Age. Its traces are found in the ruins of the Indus Valley Civilisation at Lothal and Dholavira. The town of Shihor is still continuing that glorious tradition of metal craft with its 'Kansa' (Bell metal) works especially pots and pitchers of various sizes.Junagarh is known for beautiful shrines of which of the following combination of religions?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Hinduism, Buddhism, Christianity
  • B.Christianity, Hinduism, Jainism
  • C.Hinduism, Buddhism, Islam
  • D.Islam, Hinduism, Jainism
Correct Answer: Islam, Hinduism, Jainism

The passage clearly states that Junagadh is adorned with beautiful shrines of Hindus, Jains, and Muslims, making option (D) the correct one.

Question 47
Read the following passage and answer the questions that follow:Stone carvings are other impressive pieces of visual art of Gujarat. The State is also a repository of numerous places of historical importance, which attract thousands of people from all over the world. The city Junagadh is adorned with beautiful shrines of Hindus, Jains and Muslims. In Junagarh caves, a huge boulder preserves to this day fourteen rock edicts inscribed by Emperor Ashoka in the 3rd century BCE. Besides, one can also see here classic examples of rock cut architecture in the Chitya Halls and the sculpted pillars of the caves. Maru-Gurjara or Chalukyan style architecture can also be seen in the Sun Temple of Modhera. Similarly, one can see architecture belonging to the Chalukya (Solanki) period at Adalaj, a heritage site protected by the Archaeological Survey of India in the Gandhinagar district. Hence an interesting depiction of ‘Ami Khumbor’ (symbolic pot with water of life) and ‘Kalp Vriksha’ (tree of life) carved from a single block of stone present a marvellous example of the State’s sculptural heritage.Copper has been in use in Gujarat since the times of the Chalcolithic Age. Its traces are found in the ruins of the Indus Valley Civilisation at Lothal and Dholavira. The town of Shihor is still continuing that glorious tradition of metal craft with its 'Kansa' (Bell metal) works especially pots and pitchers of various sizes.How many edicts of Ashoka are preserved on a boulder inside the Junagarh caves?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Ten
  • B.Twelve
  • C.Fourteen
  • D.Thirteen
Correct Answer: Fourteen

The passage states that "a huge boulder preserves to this day fourteen rock edicts inscribed by Emperor Ashoka in the 3rd century BCE." Hence, the correct number is fourteen.

Question 48
Read the following passage and answer the questions that follow:Stone carvings are other impressive pieces of visual art of Gujarat. The State is also a repository of numerous places of historical importance, which attract thousands of people from all over the world. The city Junagadh is adorned with beautiful shrines of Hindus, Jains and Muslims. In Junagarh caves, a huge boulder preserves to this day fourteen rock edicts inscribed by Emperor Ashoka in the 3rd century BCE. Besides, one can also see here classic examples of rock cut architecture in the Chitya Halls and the sculpted pillars of the caves. Maru-Gurjara or Chalukyan style architecture can also be seen in the Sun Temple of Modhera. Similarly, one can see architecture belonging to the Chalukya (Solanki) period at Adalaj, a heritage site protected by the Archaeological Survey of India in the Gandhinagar district. Hence an interesting depiction of ‘Ami Khumbor’ (symbolic pot with water of life) and ‘Kalp Vriksha’ (tree of life) carved from a single block of stone present a marvellous example of the State’s sculptural heritage.Copper has been in use in Gujarat since the times of the Chalcolithic Age. Its traces are found in the ruins of the Indus Valley Civilisation at Lothal and Dholavira. The town of Shihor is still continuing that glorious tradition of metal craft with its 'Kansa' (Bell metal) works especially pots and pitchers of various sizes.Which style of architecture is seen in the Sun Temple of Modhera?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Maru-Gurjara
  • B.Solanki
  • C.Cholan
  • D.Khamboj
Correct Answer: Maru-Gurjara

The passage mentions that Maru-Gurjara or Chalukyan style architecture can be seen in the Sun Temple of Modhera, making option (A) the correct choice.

Question 49
Read the following passage and answer the questions that follow:Stone carvings are other impressive pieces of visual art of Gujarat. The State is also a repository of numerous places of historical importance, which attract thousands of people from all over the world. The city Junagadh is adorned with beautiful shrines of Hindus, Jains and Muslims. In Junagarh caves, a huge boulder preserves to this day fourteen rock edicts inscribed by Emperor Ashoka in the 3rd century BCE. Besides, one can also see here classic examples of rock cut architecture in the Chitya Halls and the sculpted pillars of the caves. Maru-Gurjara or Chalukyan style architecture can also be seen in the Sun Temple of Modhera. Similarly, one can see architecture belonging to the Chalukya (Solanki) period at Adalaj, a heritage site protected by the Archaeological Survey of India in the Gandhinagar district. Hence an interesting depiction of ‘Ami Khumbor’ (symbolic pot with water of life) and ‘Kalp Vriksha’ (tree of life) carved from a single block of stone present a marvellous example of the State’s sculptural heritage.Copper has been in use in Gujarat since the times of the Chalcolithic Age. Its traces are found in the ruins of the Indus Valley Civilisation at Lothal and Dholavira. The town of Shihor is still continuing that glorious tradition of metal craft with its 'Kansa' (Bell metal) works especially pots and pitchers of various sizes.A heritage site, protected by ASI in Gandhinagar district is known as:(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Adalaj
  • B.Khumbor
  • C.Dholavira
  • D.Shihor
Correct Answer: Adalaj

The passage clearly states that Adalaj, located in the Gandhinagar district, is a heritage site protected by the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI).

Question 50
Read the following passage and answer the questions that follow:Stone carvings are other impressive pieces of visual art of Gujarat. The State is also a repository of numerous places of historical importance, which attract thousands of people from all over the world. The city Junagadh is adorned with beautiful shrines of Hindus, Jains and Muslims. In Junagarh caves, a huge boulder preserves to this day fourteen rock edicts inscribed by Emperor Ashoka in the 3rd century BCE. Besides, one can also see here classic examples of rock cut architecture in the Chitya Halls and the sculpted pillars of the caves. Maru-Gurjara or Chalukyan style architecture can also be seen in the Sun Temple of Modhera. Similarly, one can see architecture belonging to the Chalukya (Solanki) period at Adalaj, a heritage site protected by the Archaeological Survey of India in the Gandhinagar district. Hence an interesting depiction of ‘Ami Khumbor’ (symbolic pot with water of life) and ‘Kalp Vriksha’ (tree of life) carved from a single block of stone present a marvellous example of the State’s sculptural heritage.Copper has been in use in Gujarat since the times of the Chalcolithic Age. Its traces are found in the ruins of the Indus Valley Civilisation at Lothal and Dholavira. The town of Shihor is still continuing that glorious tradition of metal craft with its 'Kansa' (Bell metal) works especially pots and pitchers of various sizes.Which one of the following places is not associated with either traces of copper or with copper works?(UGC NET 22 Aug 2024 Evening)
  • A.Shihor
  • B.Lothal
  • C.Dholavira
  • D.Modhera
Correct Answer: Modhera

Modhera is not associated with copper in the passage, making option (D) as correct.

Quiz Attempt #119723

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of students in M. Tech. (Computer Science) class, who got employment in the areas of Hardware, Software Quality Assurance (SQA), Software Development and others during the five years from 2019 to 2023, along with the average starting salaries of students per month (in Rs.) in these areas during the same years. The total numbers of students who passed out in the years 2019-2023 are 800, 600, 1100, 1200, and 1000, respectively. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Where I represents percentage distribution of students who got employment and II represents the average starting salary of students per month (in ₹)In all the five years, the number of students getting employment in Hardware is ____________ less than the number of students getting employment in SQA.(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.826
  • B.650
  • C.734
  • D.548
Correct Answer: 734

Students in Hardware 22% of 800 + 17% of 600 + 23% of 1100 + 19% of 1200 = 228 + 32% of 1000

= 176 + 102 + 253 + 228 + 320 = 1079

 

Students in SQA = 36% of 800 + 48% of 600 + 43% of 1100 + 37% of 1200 + 32% of 1000

= 288 + 288 + 473 + 444 + 320 = 1813

 

Difference = 1813 - 1079 = 734

Question 2
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of students in M. Tech. (Computer Science) class, who got employment in the areas of Hardware, Software Quality Assurance (SQA), Software Development and others during the five years from 2019 to 2023, along with the average starting salaries of students per month (in Rs.) in these areas during the same years. The total numbers of students who passed out in the years 2019-2023 are 800, 600, 1100, 1200, and 1000, respectively. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Where I represents percentage distribution of students who got employment and II represents the average starting salary of students per month (in ₹)What is the percentage increase in the average starting salary (per month) of employment in Hardware in the year 2023 with reference to the year 2019?(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.60%
  • B.32%
  • C.96%
  • D.80%
Correct Answer: 80%

Required Percentage = 98100-5450054500×100 = 80%

Question 3
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of students in M. Tech. (Computer Science) class, who got employment in the areas of Hardware, Software Quality Assurance (SQA), Software Development and others during the five years from 2019 to 2023, along with the average starting salaries of students per month (in Rs.) in these areas during the same years. The total numbers of students who passed out in the years 2019-2023 are 800, 600, 1100, 1200, and 1000, respectively. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Where I represents percentage distribution of students who got employment and II represents the average starting salary of students per month (in ₹)What is the average monthly salary offered to an M. Tech. (Computer Science) student in 2020?(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.₹ 60750
  • B.₹ 63300
  • C.₹ 63333
  • D.₹ 62438
Correct Answer: ₹ 63333

Total students in 2020 = 600

Required salary = (102×63800+288×63900+138×64400+72×50900)102+288+138+72 = 62438

Question 4
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of students in M. Tech. (Computer Science) class, who got employment in the areas of Hardware, Software Quality Assurance (SQA), Software Development and others during the five years from 2019 to 2023, along with the average starting salaries of students per month (in Rs.) in these areas during the same years. The total numbers of students who passed out in the years 2019-2023 are 800, 600, 1100, 1200, and 1000, respectively. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Where I represents percentage distribution of students who got employment and II represents the average starting salary of students per month (in ₹)In 2021, students getting employment in Hardware earned ₹ ______ lakhs more than those getting employment in Software Development (per annum).(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.430
  • B.337.92
  • C.284.12
  • D.324.3
Correct Answer: 337.92

Required difference = 23 × 11 × 75500 – 21 × 11 × 70500

= 2816000

Annual salary difference = 2816000 × 12 = Rs. 33792000 = 337.92 lakh

Question 5
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of students in M. Tech. (Computer Science) class, who got employment in the areas of Hardware, Software Quality Assurance (SQA), Software Development and others during the five years from 2019 to 2023, along with the average starting salaries of students per month (in Rs.) in these areas during the same years. The total numbers of students who passed out in the years 2019-2023 are 800, 600, 1100, 1200, and 1000, respectively. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Where I represents percentage distribution of students who got employment and II represents the average starting salary of students per month (in ₹)The average monthly salary offered to an M. Tech (Computer Science) student in 2023 is approximately ____________% more than that in 2022.(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.12.17
  • B.17.14
  • C.25
  • D.5.43
Correct Answer: 12.17

Required Percentage = 362100-322800322800×100 = 12.17%

Question 6
The number of digits an individual can report back without error in a single presentation represents(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.chunking
  • B.memory span
  • C.phonological loop
  • D.Time Zone
Correct Answer: memory span

Memory span refers to the maximum number of items (usually digits or letters) a person can recall in the correct order immediately after a single presentation.

 

It is a measure of short-term memory capacity.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 7
A history teacher wants to create an interactive timeline showcasing the evolution of different art movements over centuries? Which tool would best support the creation of this multimedia presentation?(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Prezi
  • B.Adobe Illustrator
  • C.Flipgrid
  • D.Google forms
Correct Answer: Prezi

Prezi is an excellent tool for creating interactive, non-linear, and visually engaging presentations, such as timelines, story maps, and evolution charts.

 

It allows zooming in and out of different time periods or movements, which is ideal for showing the evolution of art movements across centuries.

Question 8
A collection of the student's work in an area, showing growth, self reflection, and achievements is known as:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Modelling
  • B.Portfolio
  • C.Mastery goal
  • D.Problem solving
Correct Answer: Portfolio

A portfolio in education is:

  • a purposeful collection of a student’s work,
  • demonstrates progress, effort, and achievements over time,
  • often includes self-reflection and goal-setting by the student.

 

It is widely used for assessment, especially in project-based and performance-based learning.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 9
Match the List – I with List – II:List I(Swayamprabha Channel No.)a. Channel 03 (PRABODH)b. Channel 04 (SAARASWAT)c. Channel 05 (PRABANDHAN)d. Channel 06 (VIDHIK)List II(Theme)i. Education and Home Scienceii. Information, Communication and Management Studiesiii. Law and Legal Studiesiv. Social and Behavioural SciencesChoose thecorrectanswer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a-ii, b-iv, c-iii, d-i
  • B.a-iii, b-i, c-iv, d-ii
  • C.a-iv, b-i, c-ii, d-iii
  • D.a-i, b-iii, c-ii, d-iv
Correct Answer: a-iv, b-i, c-ii, d-iii

The correct match is as follows:

List I (Swayamprabha Channel No.) – List II (Theme)
a. Channel 03 (PRABODH) - Social and Behavioural Sciences
b. Channel 04 (SAARASWAT) - Education and Home Science
c. Channel 05 (PRABANDHAN) - Information, Communication and Management Studies
d. Channel 06 (VIDHIK) - Law and Legal Studies

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 10
Match the LIST - I with LIST – IILIST I(Term)a. Decision makingb. Confirmation biasc. Belief perseveranced. Overconfidence biasLIST II(Meaning)i. The tendency to hold on a belief in the face of contradictory evidence.ii. The tendency to have more confidence in judgement and decisions than we should based on probability.iii. The tendency to search for and use information that supports our ideas rather than refuses them.iv. Evaluating alternatives and making choices among them.Choose thecorrectanswer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a-iii, b-iv, c-ii, d-i
  • B.a-ii, b-iii, c-iv, d-i
  • C.a-iv, b-iii, c-i, d-ii
  • D.a-i, b-ii, c-iv, d-iii
Correct Answer: a-iv, b-iii, c-i, d-ii

The correct match is as follows:

 

List I (Term) → List II (Meaning)

(a) Decision making → (iv) Evaluating alternatives and making choices among them

 

(b) Confirmation bias → (iii) The tendency to search for and use information that supports our ideas rather than refutes them

 

(c) Belief perseverance → (i) The tendency to hold on a belief in the face of contradictory evidence

 

(d) Overconfidence bias → (ii) The tendency to have more confidence in judgement and decisions than we should based on probability

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 11
Which of the following research approaches suggests that theory is an outcome of research?(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.deductive approach
  • B.inductive approach
  • C.quantitative approach
  • D.cross-sectional approach
Correct Answer: inductive approach

The inductive approach (B) suggests that theory is an outcome of research. In inductive reasoning, researchers begin by collecting data and observing patterns or trends, and from these observations, they develop a theory. This approach is often used in qualitative research.

Deductive approach (A) starts with a theory or hypothesis and tests it using data.

Quantitative approach (C) refers to the use of numerical data and statistical analysis but does not inherently focus on whether the theory is developed from research.

Cross-sectional approach (D) involves observing data at a single point in time and does not necessarily relate to the development of theory.

Therefore, the correct answer is (B) inductive approach.

Question 12
When the sample has been randomly selected, which among the following may be expected in cross-sectional research designs?a. strong external validityb. weak external validityc. weak internal validityd. strong internal validityChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Only a and c
  • B.Only a and d
  • C.Only b and c
  • D.Only b and d
Correct Answer: Only a and c

In cross-sectional research designs, where data is collected at a single point in time from a randomly selected sample:

Strong external validity (a) is expected because random sampling helps ensure that the sample is representative of the larger population, allowing results to be generalized to the broader group.

Weak internal validity (c) may be a concern in cross-sectional research since it doesn't allow for causal inferences due to the lack of time-based data or experimental manipulation.

Thus, the correct answer is (A) Only a and c.

Question 13
If you want to understand the theoretical reasons that led researchers to conduct a study that appeared as a research article in a journal, you would read which of the following sections of the research article?(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.discussion
  • B.abstract
  • C.introduction
  • D.results
Correct Answer: introduction

The introduction (C) section of a research article explains the background and theoretical reasons that led the researchers to conduct the study. It typically includes the research problem, the rationale for the study, and the research questions or hypotheses.

Discussion (A) interprets the findings of the study.

Abstract (B) provides a brief summary of the entire study.

Results (D) presents the findings of the study without interpretation.

Therefore, the correct answer is (C) introduction.

Question 14
The students' t-test would be useful for?a. comparing two groups to see whether their means differ.b. comparing multiple groups (more than two) to see whether their means differ.c. testing the significance of correlation coefficient.d. testing the significance of regression coefficient.Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Only a, b and c
  • B.Only b and d
  • C.Only a, c and d
  • D.Only a, b, c and d
Correct Answer: Only a, c and d

The students' t-test is primarily used to compare the means of two groups to determine whether there is a significant difference between them. Therefore, it is useful for:

(a) Comparing two groups to see whether their means differ (this is the primary use of the t-test).

(c) Testing the significance of the correlation coefficient (in certain cases, the t-test can be used to test whether the correlation coefficient is significantly different from zero).

(d) Testing the significance of the regression coefficient (the t-test is also used to determine if the regression coefficient is significantly different from zero).

 

However, the t-test is not typically used for comparing multiple groups (more than two); instead, an ANOVA (Analysis of Variance) is used for that purpose.

Thus, the correct answer is (C) Only a, c and d.

Question 15
Identify the probability sampling techniques?a. simple random samplingb. snowball samplingc. stratified random samplingd. convenience samplingChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Only a and b
  • B.Only b and c
  • C.Only a and d
  • D.Only b and d
Correct Answer: Only a and d

Probability sampling techniques involve random selection, where each member of the population has a known, non-zero chance of being selected. The following are probability sampling techniques:

Simple random sampling (a): Each member of the population has an equal chance of being selected.

Stratified random sampling (c): The population is divided into subgroups (strata), and random samples are taken from each subgroup.

 

Snowball sampling (b) and convenience sampling (d) are non-probability sampling techniques, as they do not rely on random selection.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is (C) Only a and d.

Question 16
Description of ‘actual words, written or spoken, used to tell a story’ and images or pictures come under the category of(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Discourse
  • B.Event
  • C.Law
  • D.Performance
Correct Answer: Discourse

Discourse refers to the actual words, whether written or spoken, that are used to communicate ideas, narratives, or arguments.

Question 17
The general context of communication is known as communication -(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.situation
  • B.position
  • C.praxis
  • D.convention
Correct Answer: situation

In communication studies, the general context in which communication takes place is referred to as the communication situation.

 

It includes factors such as:

  • the participants (sender and receiver),
  • purpose of communication,
  • setting (physical, social, cultural),
  • medium used, and
  • the relationship between communicators.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (A).

Question 18
Which of the following are essential elements of mass communication?a. Electronic observationb. Technological mediumc. Large audienced. Professional communicatorse. Organizational structureChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Only a, b, e
  • B.Only a, c, d
  • C.Only a, c, d, e
  • D.Only b, c, d, e
Correct Answer: Only b, c, d, e

The essential elements of mass communication typically include:

 

(b) Tehnological medium –

Mass communication relies on media technologies such as TV, radio, newspapers, or the internet.

 

(c) Large audience –

By definition, mass communication targets a broad, dispersed audience.

 

(d) Professional communicators –

It usually involves trained professionals (e.g., journalists, broadcasters) who craft and deliver the message.

 

(e) Organizational structure –

Mass communication happens through media organizations that have editorial policies, production teams, and distribution systems.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 19
Which of the following, in communication, are the rhetorical structures’?a. paralanguageb. clustersc. formd. genree. narrativeChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Only a, b, c, d
  • B.Only b, c, d, e
  • C.Only a, c, e
  • D.Only a, d, e
Correct Answer: Only b, c, d, e

Rhetorical structures in communication refer to the organizational and stylistic frameworks used to convey meaning and persuade.

 

Following are included as rhetorical structures:

(b) Clusters –

Groupings of words or ideas that create associative meaning or emphasis in discourse.

 

(c) Form –

The structural arrangement of content (e.g., problem–solution, cause–effect) — crucial in rhetoric.

 

(d) Genre –

A category or style of communication (e.g., speech, editorial, documentary) that follows recognizable conventions.

 

(e) Narrative –

A storytelling structure, often used to organize arguments or emotional appeals.

Thus, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 20
Match List – I with List – II:List I (Patterns of communication)a. Physical situationb. Persons involved in interactionc. Manner of communication enactedd. Channels of communicationList II (Social Unit)i. Participantsii. Keyiii. Instrumentalityiv. Scene or settingChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a-i, b-ii, c-iii, d-iv
  • B.a-ii, b-iii, c-iv, d-i
  • C.a-iii, b-iv, c-i, d-ii
  • D.a-iv, b-i, c-ii, d-iii
Correct Answer: a-iv, b-i, c-ii, d-iii

These terms are based on Dell Hymes’ SPEAKING model in communication ethnography, which identifies elements of a speech event:

 

Question 21
Working 9 hours a day, 12 persons complete a work in 25 days. Working 6 hours a day, 15 persons can do the same work in(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.28 days
  • B.29 days
  • C.30 days
  • D.32 days
Correct Answer: 30 days

Required days = 9×12×256×15 = 30 days

Question 22
In the letter series, some of the letters are missing. Complete the given letter series by choosing the correct alternatives from the options given below.b_b_bb__bb_bbb_b_b(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.b b b b b a
  • B.b b a a a b
  • C.a b a b a b
  • D.a a a a a b
Correct Answer: a a a a a b

b a b a bb a bb a bbb a b b b

Thus, D is the correct answer.

Question 23
Three successive discounts of 30% on the marked price of an item are together equivalent to a single discount of(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.90%
  • B.27%
  • C.65.7%
  • D.78.2%
Correct Answer: 65.7%

Let MP = 100

Price after discounts = 100 × 0.7 × 0.7 × 0.7 = 34.3

Discount = 100 – 34.3 = 65.7%

Question 24
In a certain coding language, if the word ‘STORK’ is coded as ‘VQRON’, then the word ‘TIRED’ will be coded as(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.V E T C F
  • B.W F U B G
  • C.W E T C G
  • D.V F U B F
Correct Answer: W F U B G

S + 2 = V

T – 2 = Q

O + 2 = R

R – 2 = O

K + 2 = N

Similarly,

T + 2 = W

I – 2 = F

R + 2 = U

E – 2 = B

D + 2 = G

Question 25
A person travels from X to Y at a speed of 50 km/hr and returns from Y to X by increasing his speed by 50%. His average speed during the journey is(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.62.5 km / hr
  • B.60 km / hr
  • C.62 km / hr
  • D.64 km / hr
Correct Answer: 60 km / hr

Speed while returning be 45 km/hr

Let D be the distance and x be the average speed

Then, D50 + D75 = 2Dx

or x = 60 km/hr

Question 26
“Molecules are in random motion. Qutub Minar is composed of Molecules. Therefore, Qutub Minar is in constant random motion.” Identify the fallacy committed in the above statement.(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Equivocation
  • B.Slippery slope
  • C.Hasty generalization
  • D.Fallacy of composition
Correct Answer: Fallacy of composition

The fallacy committed in the statement "Molecules are in random motion. Qutub Minar is composed of molecules. Therefore, Qutub Minar is in constant random motion." is the fallacy of composition (D).

 

This fallacy occurs when it is assumed that what is true for the parts must also be true for the whole. In this case, the statement assumes that because molecules are in random motion, the entire Qutub Minar, made up of molecules, must also be in random motion. However, the motion of individual molecules does not imply that the entire structure behaves in the same way.

Question 27
If the statement “Some birds are not mammals” is given as true, which of the following statements can be immediately inferred to be false?(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Some mammals are not birds.
  • B.Some birds are mammals.
  • C.No birds are mammals.
  • D.All birds are mammals.
Correct Answer: All birds are mammals.

O is given as true then A is false. E and I are undetermined. Hence All birds are mammals is False.

Question 28
Which of the following statements are logically equivalent?a. Some non-birds are mammals.b. Some birds are not mammals.c. Some non-mammals are non-birds.d. Some non-mammals are not non-birds.Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a, b and c only
  • B.a and c only
  • C.c and d only
  • D.b and d only
Correct Answer: b and d only

Some non-mammals are not non-birds is CONTRAPOSITION of Some birds are not mammals.

Question 29
Which of the following is correct in the context of Syllogism?a. With two negative premise; affirmative conclusion can be drawn.b. Predicate of the conclusion is the minor term.c. Middle term must be distributed at least once in the premises.d. With two universal premises, particular conclusion can be drawn.e. The term distributed in the conclusion must be distributed in the premises.Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.b and c only
  • B.a and c only
  • C.d and e only
  • D.c and e only
Correct Answer: c and e only

Let's analyze each statement based on the rules of syllogistic reasoning :

 

a. With two negative premises, an affirmative conclusion can be drawn: This is incorrect because Rule of Exclusive Premises prohibits drawing a conclusion when both premises are negative. This is a fallacy of exclusive premises.

 

b. Predicate of the conclusion is the minor term: This is incorrect. In a standard syllogism, the minor term is the subject of the conclusion, not the predicate. The predicate of the conclusion is the major term.

 

c. Middle term must be distributed at least once in the premises: This is correct. Rule of Undistributed Middle specifies that the middle term must be distributed in at least one of the premises for the syllogism to be valid.

 

d. With two universal premises, a particular conclusion can be drawn: This is incorrect. Rule of Existential Fallacy tells us that no particular conclusion can be drawn from two universal premises. This would be an existential fallacy.

 

e. The term distributed in the conclusion must be distributed in the premises: This is correct. Rule of Illicit Process states that any term distributed in the conclusion must be distributed in the premises as well. If it’s not, it creates an illicit process.

Question 30
According to classical Indian school of logic (Nyāya) which fallacy is committed in the following argument “Anything that is thinkable is nameable because it is thinkable”?(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Asādhāraṇa
  • B.Sādhāraṇa
  • C.Āśrayāsiddha
  • D.Svarupāsiddha
Correct Answer: Asādhāraṇa

Asadharana: Here the middle term is too narrow. It is present only in the paksa and neither in the sapaksa nor in the vipaksa. It violates the rule that the middle term should be present in the sapaksa (sapaksasattva); e.g., ‘sound is eternal, because it is audible'. Here audibility belongs to sound only and is present nowhere else.

Question 31
Which of the following electronic technologies is the key technology for making the first generation electronic computer?(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Transistor based
  • B.Integrated Circuit based
  • C.Vacuum Tube based
  • D.Dual Core CPU based
Correct Answer: Vacuum Tube based

The correct answer is option (C) - Vacuum Tube based

 

The first generation of electronic computers (like ENIAC and UNIVAC) used vacuum tubes as the main electronic technology for processing and storage. These computers were large, bulky, and consumed a lot of power.

Question 32
Which of the following statements best describes a blog?(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.A website that allows multiple users to collaborate and create information.
  • B.A chronological list of posts on a website typically written by a single author about a subject.
  • C.A series of audio or video episodes that subscribers download or stream to their devices.
  • D.A standardised format that allows users to subscribe to view content updates from a creator.
Correct Answer: A chronological list of posts on a website typically written by a single author about a subject.

The correct answer is option (B) - A chronological list of posts on a website typically written by a single author about a subject.

 

A blog is typically a website or part of a website where posts are listed in reverse chronological order, usually written by a single author or a small group of contributors, often focusing on a specific subject or theme.

Question 33
Identify the sequence of words A–E that correctly fills the blanks in the following paragraph:The ________ is the ‘brain’ of the computer and the ________ processor made by Intel is an example of this. The speed of the processor is measured in ________. ________ is a volatile memory whereas ________ is used in most computers to hold a small special piece of software known as the ‘boot up’ program.a. ROMb. CPUc. RAMd. Pentiume. HertzChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.b, d, e, c, a
  • B.d, b, c, e, a
  • C.c, d, e, a, b
  • D.b, e, d, a, c
Correct Answer: b, d, e, c, a

The correct answer is option (A) - b, d, e, c, a.

 

The CPU is the ‘brain’ of the computer, and the Pentium processor made by Intel is an example of this.

 

The speed of the processor is measured in Hertz.

 

RAM is a volatile memory, whereas ROM is used to hold a small special piece of software known as the ‘boot up’ program.

Question 34
If(L)Mrepresents a number L in base-M number system, then which of the following equalities are true?(a)(127.125)10=(1111111.001)2(b)(127.125)10=(1333.02)4(c)(127.125)10=(177.1)8(d)(127.125)10=(7F.2)16Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a only
  • B.a and b only
  • C.a, b and c only
  • D.a, b, c and d
Correct Answer: a, b, c and d

(1111111.001) 2 is equal to 127.125 in base 10.
(1333.02) 4 is equal to 127.125 in base 10.

(177.1) 8 is equal to 127.125 in base 10.

(7F.2) 16 is equal to 127.125 in base 10.

Question 35
Match List – I with List – II:List I (Malware types)a. Trojan Horseb. Wormc. Logic Bombd. RootkitList II (Characteristics)i. Propagates copies of itself through a networkii. Triggers action when certain condition occursiii. Hooks standard OS calls to hide the existence of malwareiv. Contains unexpected covert effectChoose the correct answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a–i, b–iv, c–iii, d–ii
  • B.a–iv, b–ii, c–i, d–iii
  • C.a–ii, b–i, c–iii, d–iv
  • D.a–iv, b–i, c–ii, d–iii
Correct Answer: a–iv, b–i, c–ii, d–iii

The correct answer is option (D) - a–iv, b–i, c–ii, d–iii.

 

Trojan Horse (a): Contains unexpected covert effects (iv).

 

Worm (b): Propagates copies of itself through a network (i).

 

Logic Bomb (c): Triggers action when certain conditions occur (ii).

 

Rootkit (d): Hooks standard OS calls to hide the existence of malware (iii).

Question 36
The Convention of Biological Diversity (CBD) was first opened for signature during(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Conference on human environment
  • B.Earth Summit
  • C.Montreal Protocol
  • D.COP1
Correct Answer: Earth Summit

The correct answer is option (B) - Earth Summit.

 

The Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) was first opened for signature at the Earth Summit in Rio de Janeiro in 1992. The Earth Summit, also known as the Rio Conference, was a major event focused on sustainable development.

Question 37
To understand the Global Climate Change, GCM model are widely used. GCM stands fora. Global Circulation Modelb. General Circulation Modelc. Global Climate Modeld. General Climate ModelChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Only a and b
  • B.Only b and c
  • C.Only c and d
  • D.Only a and d
Correct Answer: Only b and c

The correct answer is option B - Only b and c.

 

GCM stands for General Circulation Model and Global Climate Model. Both terms refer to models used to simulate the Earth's climate system, including atmospheric and oceanic circulation, to understand global climate change.

Question 38
Dissolved Oxygen (DO), a water quality parameter, is essential in which of the following water bodies/sources?a River Waterb. Lake Waterc. Tap Waterd. Underground Watere. Pond WaterChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.a, b and e Only
  • B.c and d Only
  • C.b, d and e Only
  • D.a, c, d and e Only
Correct Answer: a, b and e Only

The correct answer is option (A) - a, b and e Only.

 

Dissolved Oxygen (DO) is essential in river water, lake water, and pond water, as these water bodies rely on oxygen for the survival of aquatic life. However, tap water and underground water generally do not have the same level of concern for dissolved oxygen, as tap water is usually treated and underground water is often oxygen-depleted.

Question 39
In a breeder reactor:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.More fissile materials are produced than it is consumed
  • B.Less fissile materials are produced than it is consumed
  • C.Neutrons are slowed down by moderator
  • D.U-238 a fissile material is produced from Pu-239 a fertile material.
Correct Answer: More fissile materials are produced than it is consumed

The correct answer is option (A) - More fissile materials are produced than it is consumed.

 

In a breeder reactor, the primary purpose is to generate more fissile material than is consumed during the nuclear fission process. Typically, U-238 is converted into Pu-239, a fissile material, through neutron absorption and subsequent nuclear reactions.

Question 40
When a water body becomes extremely low in nutrient content, then it is called as:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Dystrophic
  • B.Oligotrophic
  • C.Mesotrophic
  • D.Eutrophic
Correct Answer: Oligotrophic

The correct answer is option (B) - Oligotrophic.

 

An oligotrophic water body has very low nutrient content, leading to low biological productivity. These water bodies typically have clear water with low concentrations of dissolved nutrients like nitrogen and phosphorus.

Question 41
An important feature of the third five-year plan was:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Abolition of Education Commission.
  • B.Reduction in the number of colleges
  • C.Setting up examination research units in some universities
  • D.More emphasis on open book examination.
Correct Answer: Setting up examination research units in some universities

The correct answer is option (C) - Setting up examination research units in some universities.

 

An important feature of the Third Five-Year Plan (1961-1966) was the focus on improving education and research. It aimed at strengthening educational infrastructure, including the establishment of examination research units in some universities to improve examination processes and academic standards.

Question 42
The National Education Policy, 2020 aims to create:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.Fragmented universities
  • B.Online universities
  • C.Knowledge hubs
  • D.Corporate clusters of education
Correct Answer: Knowledge hubs

The correct answer is option (C) - Knowledge hubs.

 

The National Education Policy (NEP), 2020 aims to create knowledge hubs by fostering multidisciplinary education, promoting innovation, and developing higher education institutions as centers of excellence for research and learning. The policy emphasizes the need for a holistic approach to education that blends various subjects and skills.

Question 43
Dr. Baba Saheb Ambedkar was associated with:a. Presidency College, Kolkatab. Khalsa College, Mumbaic. Siddharth College, Mumbaid. Milind College, Aurangabade. National College, BengaluruChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.only a, b, c
  • B.only b, c, d
  • C.only c, d, e
  • D.only a, d, e
Correct Answer: only b, c, d

The correct answer is option B - only b, c, d.

 

Dr. Baba Saheb Ambedkar was associated with Khalsa College, Mumbai (b), Siddharth College, Mumbai (c), and Milind College, Aurangabad (d). He studied at and worked in these institutions during various stages of his education and career.

Question 44
Which of the following universities were multi-disciplinary in ancient India?a. Banaras Hindu Universityb. Takshashilac. Nalandad. Vallabhie. VikramshilaChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.only a, b, c
  • B.only a, c, e
  • C.only a, d, e
  • D.only b, c, d, e
Correct Answer: only b, c, d, e

The correct answer is option D.

 

Universities that were multi-disciplinary in ancient India –

b. Takshashila

c. Nalanda

d. Vallabhi

e. Vikramshila

Question 45
The National Education Policy, 2020 recommended the integration of humanities at the undergraduate level with subjects of:a. Scienceb. Technologyc. Engineeringd. Mathematicse. Propaganda techniquesChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:(UGC NET 21 Aug 2024 Morning)
  • A.only a, b, c, d
  • B.only b, c, e
  • C.only a, c, d, e
  • D.only a, b, d, e
Correct Answer: only a, b, c, d

The correct answer is option (A) - only a, b, c, d.

 

The National Education Policy (NEP) 2020 emphasizes the integration of humanities and arts with science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) at the undergraduate level. This multidisciplinary approach aims to foster creativity, critical thinking, and holistic development among students. The policy encourages curricula that blend these disciplines to enhance learning outcomes and prepare students for complex real-world challenges.

Question 46
Read the passage carefully and answer the following questions:A. K. Ramanujan was one of those thinkers, like Freud (whom he greatly, though not uncritically, admired), who so transform our way of looking at a subject that we are in danger of undervaluing their contribution, since we have come to take for granted precisely what they taught us, as we view the subject through their eyes.
